story:
The Nepal's Light 3.0

My aim is to produce portable power bank for Tesla Electric Vehicles.

The Nepal's Light 3.0 technical testing phase:
 

 

Why Nepal’s Light 3.0? 

The answer is very simple: To save life in any sort of emergencies. The Nepal’s Light is coming back with so many added features and by making itself a life savior. 

The previous version was only able to charge mobile phones and provide light but imagine! what if a portable kit is powerful enough to charge almost any electronic device that too in emergency? 

What if the next version will power your electric car? 

Wouldn’t that be amazing? 

Yes, The Nepal’s Light 3.0 will be a complete package that can charge a laptop, a phone to a car. 

Along with that, the kit will also have a first aid kit included, drinking water, some food & a tent that becomes essential to save life during disaster. 

We have seen many people around the world getting stuck to a place for days during disaster. To avoid the damage done to people’s lives by those situations The Nepal’s Light 3.0 is mandatory. 

There were first aid kits in the past but with the change in time we have digitized ourselves. The change demands the power kit which is the Nepal’s Light 3.0 that will have almost everything to save life that too in a portable format. This portable version will track you in case of any emergencies as well as provide you shelter no matter where you are.

Imagine a situation where you are locked inside your car because of the battery running out of charge. What will you do? Nepal’s Light 3.0 will save you from those circumstances which are unpredictable. 

With the immense support, motivation and love from you all in the past, Nepal's Light was born. After successful landing of the project in 2016, Nepal's Light 2.0 was made with all of yours involvement. The Nepal's Light 1.0 and Nepal's Light 2.0 became the reason to smile for most of the earthquake victim in different remote places of Nepal.

As you all know that Nepal's Light 1.0 and Nepal's Light 2.0 altogether made 1000 different families and may be more than 1500 individuals started smiling even in the night because of the light that we spread with Nepal's Light. I am unable to find a beautiful word to say that I really appreciate all of yours support. Each and everyone of you are equally kind hearten and are engaged in this project. Having your backup gave me the strength to realize that world has bunch of generous individuals to make this planet a beautiful and cozy place. 

How will you react if I say that I have decided to work for yet another version of Nepal's Light? Will you be surprised? How about I say the new version 3.0? YES!! Nepal's Light 3.0. You might be curious on what's with the next version?  For that you can have a look at this:

I have started to give new shape to Nepal's Light by making it capable of providing power to almost anything in emergency scenarios. In the past, it was able to charge few mobile phones and provide lights. Now, with some research on how to make more powerful energy, I am all set to make Nepal's Light 3.0, which will charge not only phones but will be a power energy backup even for laptops, that too in the same portable size. Alongside, the 3.0 will also have an emergency kit. The kit will include everything that is needed to save life during emergency, from safety aid to urgent network to powering up devices.

The version 3.0 will have its own mobile application and the app opens up when one uncovers the Nepal's Light 3.0 kit and will start using the network provided by the 3.0. The app will then automatically send the information of that user to our server. We will then be able to know who is at risk and where. While we prepare to reach out to that user, the user will be using the 3.0 kit to protect them and still get connected to us. 

I have realized this concept of next version having heard of so many natural disasters as well as man-made emergency scenarios where so many lives were lost that could have been saved if a bit more catious system were created then. But it is never late to do good job and together we all can!

To make this happen, I need support from all of you and your reviews so that the concept becomes more strong as well as reliable. After hearing from you, I will again post update on how the 3.0 is actually going to look and what are the stuffs that the Nepal's Light 3.0 kit will have.

Help me make this successful by sharing this update to your friend and family as well, so that we together can make a better kit very soon.

 

The Nepal's Light 2.0

I am thankful to everyone who have helped me raise funds to create and distribute Nepal's Light. After successfully raising the funds I have developed new version of Nepal's Light and soon after few days I will be going to different rural areas and start distributing the Light to people and families in real need. Here is how the new version looks:

 
 
Nepal's Light version 2.0 distribution started from remote village of Nepal from 11th Feb 2017.
Here are few images of distribution:
 

 

 

 

The Project Story (Since 2015)

The Nepal's Light 1.0

Short Summary

I am a 25-years old electronics and communication engineer in Nepal, who built a solar-powered charger, named “The Nepal’s Light”, and this invention is currently powering 500 Earthquake victims homes in rural Nepal. I am looking to raise funds to distribute and manufacture this product to rural regions of Nepal, hardest hit by the Earthquake.
 

The Earthquake

On April 25th, 2015, a massive 7.8 magnitude earthquake struck Nepal, killing 8,000 people and injuring 21,000. The earthquake also triggered an avalanche on Mt. Everest, killing 21 - the deadliest day in Everest’s history. In addition to the death and destruction caused by the quake, hundreds of thousands of people were were left homeless and lost access to basic needs like water, electricity, and communication services.

It’s hard to describe what it’s like to watch not only your home, but your entire neighborhood get destroyed by nature’s fury.

This is a tranquil place with caring people of modest means; we didn’t deserve this. People tried to console me, but their words did not ease my anguish. However, I am not going to dwell about the pain this tragedy inflicted on me, my family and my community. I am an engineer and I have been trained to solve complex problems, and that is how I decided to focus my energies.

 

 

(Nepali Earthquake Victims holding the Nepal's Light 1.0, honoring those lost in the quake) 

My Objective

My goal in this project is to inform people about the impact of this tragedy on the people of Nepal and to introduce an invention I designed to address one particular consequence of the disaster, i.e., that people have been left without an adequate source of electricity to power their homes as well as to recharge their mobile phones and other electronic devices.

 

 

Part I: My Upbringing

I am originally from Bouddha, Kathmandu and  have always been fascinated by electronics and how things work. As a teenager I was inspired by engineers and people who were adept at building and fixing stuff. Engineering, particularly hardware and electrical engineering, captivated me. This led me to apply to Khwopa Engineering College in Bhaktapur, Nepal, where I studied electrical engineering, and began my journey into the engineering universe.

In college, I really began to understand what I was meant to do: build things.

I transformed from a kid with lots of wacky ideas to a professional engineer with a mental framework for problem solving. Once the earthquake hit, I was immediately able to put my engineering training and passion to work.

 

Part II: The Inception of the Idea

 

The desperation I felt when the earthquake hit compelled me to conceive of some way to help these people - my neighbors - and my engineering background inspired me to devise a temporary, portable power source.

It dawned on me that a solar powered mobile phone charger that could also power some other devices and which also had a flashlight was an ideal, economical solution.

 

However, I soon found out that a similar device was already available on the Chinese market, but the shipping costs makes them prohibitively expensive. There were also similar devices in Nepal but they were also not affordable for most people. This is when I began to think about making an affordable portable solar powered charger for my Nepali community.

 

Part III: The Prototype

I drove to my Engineering Lab in Kathmandu, and I got to work on building a prototype. I scrapped together a spare solar panel, some electrical cables, solder, a soldering iron, and a variety of spare electrical parts, and spit out a prototype. Here it is:

 

Part IV: Initial Manufacturing Run

 

A stroke of serendipity hit when manufacturers with whom I developed relationships when I was in college participating in tech hackathons became interested in partnering with me to build the product.

I showed the prototype to Sir. Bal K Joshi of thamel.com and he promised me he would help me manufacture the product so that it reaches to the needy. He introduced me to Ghampower, a solar company in Nepal.

I got to know about Bal Sir from Idea Studio Nepal. Idea studio is the platform that turns business ideas into reality by providing networks, funds and business strategies. I am fortunate that I was selected from my idea to initiate a robotics lab in Nepal couple of years ago. Because of Idea studio that I was able to talk with Joshi Sir and his network. Idea studio provided me with all necessary networks that I needed to explore. Idea studio is currently executing its 2nd session to find out sustainable business ideas. Thanks to idea studio for opening up opportunity.

With funds from Joshi Sir and with help from Ghampower, I was able to develop 500 such lights in just couple of weeks. The lights were sent to different rural districts of Nepal. Some of those lights were sent to Gorkha, the epicenter of the first earthquake where most houses were destroyed and there were thousands of casualties.

In persuading the manufacturers to back me, it didn’t hurt that I had already sold 100 of the devices, and I had an impressive order book for many hundreds more.

We quickly ramped up and went into mass production, and with experience, we figured out how to make an even less expensive and higher quality product. The device now costs only $20 per unit - 3x less than competing devices in Nepal - and it not only operates as a mobile recharger but it also has and two lights attached to illuminate the device. The unit also includes a rechargeable torch-light which operates as a super flashlight.

When I first conceived of the idea, I was only thinking of designing a relatively cheap product to solve a desperate problem. However, working with the manufacturers forced me to focus on building a very high quality, reliable product, not just a cheap one. Now, allow me to give you a more detailed look at Nepal’s Light.

The conditions I encountered trying to build the light were less than ideal. Just imagine a situation where you have to walk 5 Kilometers just to get a single LED light or a solar panel. I still remember that while I was was working on the final design at the factory an aftershock hit and we were terrified! In spite of this, I continued to work and finally completed the prototype and began manufacturing the product.

I need help in making this light a real product for the world.

I want to reach each and every village where there is no light and people still have no way to charge their mobile phones. To do this, I need funding in order to make a better product so that product works fine for longer time. I also need funding because we need to manufacture in high speed so that people in need get access to this light sooner.

As noted, we were able to manufacture 500 Nepal’s Lights. We are now working on an improved version of the product on Collaborizm, as well as crowdfunding $10,000 on IndieGoGo to add new features to the device and to scale production to 5,000 more units.

How it Works

Under the hood we are using:

1 Solar Panel

Nepal's Light comes equipped with a model x solar charger. It is is durable and is designed for outdoor use.

 

 

12 Hours of Illumination

The light, states here, can power an average home for 12 hours .

 

 

12 Hours of Cell Phone Charging

The Light comes with 2 chargers for cell phones, and can charge 5 phones for 1 hour.

 

 

Business Venture

  • While my product addresses a major problem confronting Nepalis and I conceived of it out of my concern for my community, I must acknowledge that my venture is for profit - I am young and I support myself - though I only intend to cover my costs and make a modest return.

  • We have a viable business model; i.e. we have proven that we have a scaleable business and have secured adequate manufacturing capacity from reputable sources, we have a strong engineering/technical team, and we have reliable distribution channels.

Nepal's Light in Action

Why We Need The Funds

Manufacture 5,000 Units.

We are looking to manufacture 5,000 Nepal's lights with this money. It costs approximately $18 to manufacture 1 Nepal's Light charging station. The $10,000 will aid in this process. 

Distribute 5,000 Units. 

 

We will need the funds to also ship the products in Nepal, and other neighboring markets where people are desperate for a cheap light and charging station. It will cost approximately $10 to ship each product. The $10,000 will aid in this process. 

More About Me

I am the inventor of Nepal's Light. I am 25 years old and studied at Khwopa Engineering College in Bhaktapur, Nepal, where I focused on electrical engineering. When the earthquake devastated my country, I knew I had to apply my training to help my community.

I first learned about Collaborizm when I had just built and was distributing 500 of my prototype devices to my community. The platform appealed to me because I had been working on my project alone, and Collaborizm allowed me to network with people who possess skills complementary to my own - around the world.

Collaborizm also allowed me to meet people with business experience who mentored me on converting my idea into a full scale business. Becoming part of this sophisticated, supportive community has given me confidence to launch an IndieGoGo campaign to raise $10,000 which I would use to add features to Nepal's Light (e.g., make it WiFi and GPS enabled, so that users could monitor and control the device via their cellphones and so users can be located in the event of another catastrophe.)

The Collaborizm Partnership

The Collaborizm community has been an invaluable tool in helping me advance my project and has also provided me with much needed encouragement. I am deeply grateful for everyone's support and I continue to rely on Collaborizm for mentorship, advice and to meet new teammates. I also enjoy using it to explore the many interesting projects and discussions people are posting on the platform. You can see Nepal's Light here: https://www.collaborizm.com/project/41VwOaLoe. 

Work Accomplished on Collaborizm: 

  • Launched my Project on Collaborizm
  • Collaborated with the Collaborizm Community to make my Project Video
  • Formed a team and found interested Contributors in the Community to help me push the project forward
  • Received advice on Electrical Engineering tactics/principles to help design the product
  • Help setting up the IndieGoGo Campaign :)
  • Crowdstorm manufacturing strategies
  • Continue to update community on Project progress and find new teammates and mentorship from the Community
  More Photos

A stroke of serendipity hit when manufacturers with whom I developed relationships when I was in college participating in tech hackathons became interested in partnering with me to build the product.
I showed the prototype to Sir. Bal K Joshi of thamel.com and he promised me he would help me manufacture the product so that it reaches to the needy. He introduced me to Ghampower, a solar company in Nepal.
I got to know about Bal Sir from Idea Studio Nepal. Idea studio is the platform that turns business ideas into reality by providing networks, funds and business strategies. I am fortunate that I was selected from my idea to initiate a robotics lab in Nepal couple of years ago. Because of Idea studio that I was able to talk with Joshi Sir and his network. Idea studio provided me with all necessary networks that I needed to explore. Idea studio is currently executing its 2nd session to find out sustainable business ideas. Thanks to idea studio for opening up opportunity.
With funds from Joshi Sir and with help from Ghampower, I was able to develop 500 such lights in just couple of weeks. The lights were sent to different rural districts of Nepal. Some of those lights were sent to Gorkha, the epicenter of the first earthquake where most houses were destroyed and there were thousands of casualties.
In persuading the manufacturers to back me, it didn’t hurt that I had already sold 100 of the devices, and I had an impressive order book for many hundreds more.
We quickly ramped up and went into mass production, and with experience, we figured out how to make an even less expensive and higher quality product. The device now costs only $20 per unit - 3x less than competing devices in Nepal - and it not only operates as a mobile recharger but it also has and two lights attached to illuminate the device. The unit also includes a rechargeable torch-light which operates as a super flashlight.
When I first conceived of the idea, I was only thinking of designing a relatively cheap product to solve a desperate problem. However, working with the manufacturers forced me to focus on building a very high quality, reliable product, not just a cheap one. Now, allow me to give you a more detailed look at Nepal’s Light.
The conditions I encountered trying to build the light were less than ideal. Just imagine a situation where you have to walk 5 Kilometers just to get a single LED light or a solar panel. I still remember that while I was was working on the final design at the factory an aftershock hit and we were terrified! In spite of this, I continued to work and finally completed the prototype and began manufacturing the product.
I need help in making this light a real product for the world.
I want to reach each and every village where there is no light and people still have no way to charge their mobile phones. To do this, I need funding in order to make a better product so that product works fine for longer time. I also need funding because we need to manufacture in high speed so that people in need get access to this light sooner.
As noted, we were able to manufacture 500 Nepal’s Lights. We are now working on an improved version of the product on Collaborizm, as well as crowdfunding $10,000 on IndieGoGo to add new features to the device and to scale production to 5,000 more units.
How it Works
Under the hood we are using:
1 Solar Panel
Nepal's Light comes equipped with a model x solar charger. It is is durable and is designed for outdoor use.
 
 12 Hours of Illumination
The light, states here, can power an average home for 12 hours .
 
 12 Hours of Cell Phone Charging
The Light comes with 2 chargers for cell phones, and can charge 5 phones for 1 hour.
 
 Business Venture

While my product addresses a major problem confronting Nepalis and I conceived of it out of my concern for my community, I must acknowledge that my venture is for profit - I am young and I support myself - though I only intend to cover my costs and make a modest return.
We have a viable business model; i.e. we have proven that we have a scaleable business and have secured adequate manufacturing capacity from reputable sources, we have a strong engineering/technical team, and we have reliable distribution channels.

Nepal's Light in Action




Why We Need The Funds
Manufacture 5,000 Units.
We are looking to manufacture 5,000 Nepal's lights with this money. It costs approximately $18 to manufacture 1 Nepal's Light charging station. The $10,000 will aid in this process. 
Distribute 5,000 Units. 
 
We will need the funds to also ship the products in Nepal, and other neighboring markets where people are desperate for a cheap light and charging station. It will cost approximately $10 to ship each product. The $10,000 will aid in this process. 
More About Me

I am the inventor of Nepal's Light. I am 25 years old and studied at Khwopa Engineering College in Bhaktapur, Nepal, where I focused on electrical engineering. When the earthquake devastated my country, I knew I had to apply my training to help my community.
I first learned about Collaborizm when I had just built and was distributing 500 of my prototype devices to my community. The platform appealed to me because I had been working on my project alone, and Collaborizm allowed me to network with people who possess skills complementary to my own - around the world.
Collaborizm also allowed me to meet people with business experience who mentored me on converting my idea into a full scale business. Becoming part of this sophisticated, supportive community has given me confidence to launch an IndieGoGo campaign to raise $10,000 which I would use to add features to Nepal's Light (e.g., make it WiFi and GPS enabled, so that users could monitor and control the device via their cellphones and so users can be located in the event of another catastrophe.)
The Collaborizm Partnership
The Collaborizm community has been an invaluable tool in helping me advance my project and has also provided me with much needed encouragement. I am deeply grateful for everyone's support and I continue to rely on Collaborizm for mentorship, advice and to meet new teammates. I also enjoy using it to explore the many interesting projects and discussions people are posting on the platform. You can see Nepal's Light here: https://www.collaborizm.com/project/41VwOaLoe. 

Work Accomplished on Collaborizm: 

Launched my Project on Collaborizm
Collaborated with the Collaborizm Community to make my Project Video
Formed a team and found interested Contributors in the Community to help me push the project forward
Received advice on Electrical Engineering tactics/principles to help design the product
Help setting up the IndieGoGo Campaign :)
Crowdstorm manufacturing strategies
Continue to update community on Project progress and find new teammates and mentorship from the Community
  More Photos

story:
With KrazyRide , there is no need to call a dispatcher, stand in long line, hail at a taxi on the street or look for tour guide while traveling. Now you can request a driver for your local and long distance trips and road trips from the touch of a button. As a travelers coming to town, you can select a variety of tour options, select a driver that fits your native tongue and all from a simple touch of a button.

KrazyRide, the travel booking app is an innovative travel solution providing a safe, reliable source of transport through leading edge technology in the form of a mobile app. It is convenient, easy to use and available to download for free on the App Store and google play.
https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/krazyride/id884...
KrazyRide is the answer to many global travel issues.
- Improving safety and convenience for commuters.
- Reducing emissions therefore helping the environment.
- Simple and reliable app that anyone can use.
- Messaging features that allows users and drivers to communicate instantly.
- Alert feature that users and drivers can use while on the trip to promptly stop or avoid any issues arising.
- Providing a great solution to traffic congestion, travel times and transport logistics for everyday commuters and travelers.
KrazyRide is solving real travel issues:
Finding tours services or travel services have always been a difficult logistic task for travelers landing in places they usually are not familiar with to start., adding to it language barrier. with KrazyRide, you have a valuable friend that let you be in control. You pre-book your trip or tour, get to know the driver prior to boarding your ride, many features to keep you safe and aware of your surroundings. It is quicker, more affordable, safer and most importantly at the palm of your hand. We work at your pace and not the other way around. With our variety  of travel partners, our drivers and riders get to receive special treatments and deals in Hotels, events and many more!!!!
Where is the Money Going ?
We need $75000 to develop the leading edge technology, which provides sustainable solutions for drivers and customers alike.
Here at KrazyRide.com, we are forward thinking and will continue to find ways to improve our offering so we can deliver a premium service to our users solving the very real issue of transportation that will impact lives, businesses and the environment.
Once we have completed our rollout in California, we have plans to cover other major States in America and we also have sights on other territories such as Australia and Europe, where they experience similar tourism and travel issues.

Thank you so much for supporting our campaign and for further information feel free to email us for the perks at info@krazyride.com
Keep in touch with us on social media
www.instagram.com/krazyrideapp
www.twitter.com/krazyride

story:
About iC-R (Intelligent Cranium) Helmets

The iC-R (Intelligent Cranium) Helmet is a revolutionary product invention idea for a more technologically advanced & truly SMART motorcycle helmet providing the utmost in Rider Safety; finally giving riders the BEST Advantage needed on the road.

My name is Ambrose Dodson and I am the Founder of Intelligent Cranium Helmets.  The idea of the iC-R Helmet was first thought of while driving to work one day, and I took notice to a number of motorcyclists that happened to be traveling in the same direction I was.  What I observed was the motorcyclists needing to always physically turn their head whenever they needed to do a lane change, and that's when it hit me.  I said to myself there has to be a safer way for these riders to ride.  That's when the idea was born.  I wanted to make a motorcycle helmet that would completely eliminate the need for motorcyclists to turn their heads; ensuring their utmost safety when attempting to change lanes.  Since then (through endless brainstorming and research) the idea has evolved into something some might have thought to be unimaginable, but most of all something that has never been done before.  Over time this idea has moved from just a product idea...to a Brand.  My goal is to build "Intelligent Cranium Helmets" for motorcyclists everywhere, that will:

  • Make riding safer

  • Put in front of riders information they didn't think they'd ever have

  • Save Lives

  • I want to bring forth a new era of revolutionary motorcycle helmets that will satisfy the needs and wants of all motorcyclists abroad; all while providing them with the best advantages on the road. I need your help to raise the necessary funds to turn this product idea into a product reality.

"I have much more in store for the riders of the world.  I'm here to make Intelligent Cranium Helmets (the iC-R) the motorcycle helmets of today and the future" -Ambrose D. (CEO)

Why We Need Your Support & How You Benefit

No great product ever sees the light of day without great support from it's followers/consumers (YOU).  We need your support through every facet of this project; specifically for :

  • Prototype Development
  • Testing
  • Quality Assurance
  • Tooling & Production

By supporting/contributing to this project & its processes you:

  • Get a low pre-order down payment buy in rate for your custom iC-R Helmet
  • Get real-time updates as this journey continues
  • Get GREAT iC-R Perks
  • Exclusives
  • Special Discounts
  • Comfort knowing you contributed to making the lives of riders abroad safer
The professional sourcing company we've selected to partner with has successfully manufactured other great products of this magnitude. They have an experienced team in the field which will partner with the iC-R Dream Team to assist with quality control, shipping, and other logistics. 
Please note: The iC-R Dream Team would like those opting to Pre-order this awesome helmet to be aware of the following:
  • The projected NLT (No Later Than) ship date for all pre-orders is projected to be December 1, 2017.  Of course we are fully committed to doing our best to get all pre-orders out a lot sooner than the projected ship date, but we want to ensure that we are as honest and transparent as possible with our backers/supporters.  We never want to over promise and under deliver.  We want to always meet or exceed your expectations.
  • Of course the main reasons for this projected ship date are to allow adequate time for every facet of the development phases of this project.
  • Those that opt to Pre-order at this juncture will receive an additional discount at the time of shipment as a special thanks.

iC-R Features

Two Heads-up Transparent LCD Displays

  • These heads-up display lenses provide a projected split view of all real time video streaming from the two rear-view cameras, as well as mobile software related functions such as: Incoming Calls, Navigation, Rider Speed/Rider Telemetry, and much more.
LED Interior Notification Lighting

  • This interior lighting acts as a notification system and is integrated with an ARS (Assisted Rider Software) and internal sensors. There are two LED colors supporting this system which are Amber & Red. The LED lighting system works in tandem with a warning sound and/or vibration inside the helmet. The soft Amber color means "Warning"; which will blink in 2 second intervals when a vehicle gets within 420 ft. This feature is also accompanied by a warning sound and/or vibration (optional) inside the helmet. - The Red color means "Danger"; which will blink in 1 second intervals when a vehicle gets within 240 ft. (Note: These warning distances have been calculated based on speed of travel).  This feature is also accompanied by a warning sound and/or vibration (optional) inside the helmet. Both colors will be visible, but not as to blind or distract the rider while on the road.


Software Center | OTA Software Updates | Open SDK

  • The software center is the brain of the motorcycle helmet and where all the magic happens.  The PCB (Printed Circuit Board) will come with a very high level of security baked in.  The software center will offer Bluetooth Smart/LE, OTA software updates, Open SDK (for custom mobile application development) capabilities and much more.

Two Rear-view Cameras (210° Field of View)

  • The Two Rear-View Cameras are strategically placed, and share a total field of view of 210° allowing the rider to see a wider view of what is behind him or her; completely removing the need for the rider to take his or her eyes off the road ahead.
Power Port

  • This Power Port is built into the rear of the helmet acting as the primary power source, and is in place to allow the helmet and all internal components to be charged and always operational; in the event there is lack of sufficient solar energy throughout the riders day.
Solar Panel

  • This Solar Panel is built into the top of the helmet acting as the secondary power source; allowing the helmet and all internal components to be charged and always operational while the rider is riding the motorcycle.
High End Interior Speakers

  • These interior speakers work in tandem with the built in hardware and software to provide sound and audio notifications to the rider as needed.  My team is currently seeking to partner with a big name audio company to achieve the best sound quality for this iC-R system.
User Controlled Tinting Visor

  • This user controlled tinting visor is projected come standard on all iC-R Helmets and will allow for the fastest response in tinting your visor when you need it.
Bluetooth Smart|LE 

  • This Bluetooth Smart | LE feature will work in tandem with the iC-R Cloud app allowing any rider with an iC-R Helmet to:

  • Share their location with other riders

  • Link with riders nearby and begin two-way communication via voice activation.  The app will provide each rider with an audio & visual prompt to connect.  Both riders must accept in order to connect with each other.

iC-R Cloud Mobile App

  • The iC-R Cloud mobile app will link and work in tandem with the iC-R Software Center.  This app will boast a number of internal features such as: a Maps section which will provide Navigation, Radar, Riding Conditions, Traffic Patterns, Fuel Stations, & more.

  • Allow riders sharing their location via Bluetooth LE to see & connect with other riders nearby through text or voice communication.


The Impact You Can Make By Contributing

By sharing our passion to make riding safer for all riders abroad & joining us in this journey to make that happen, you can rest assured that:

  • You are supporting a Team more than capable of surpassing the tasks at hand.
  • Every cent of all contributions will go directly and solely to the pursuit of bringing this life changing product to market, and in the hands of riders everywhere.
  • The iC-R Dream Team will successfully meet ALL demands during this journey, placed on us by you the contributor/consumer, and those in the near future.
  • Our product line will be well worth your support, and doesn't stop at this model.  We have BIG PLANS for future Intelligent Cranium Helmets products.

Risks & Challenges

Of course with any project we as developers and engineers encounter Risks & Challenges.  No one wants to see a good idea executed poorly. We have worked extremely hard to ready this product for Indiegogo and full-scale manufacturing and fulfillment, but a few risks & challenges we expect are:

  • MANUFACTURING: Creating the tooling to manufacture a product of this size is expensive and requires expert knowledge to get it right. There are typical delays regarding molding, technical difficulties during testing that could occur. To minimize that possibility we're working with expert tooling manufacturers partners, engineers (internal), software developers (internal) with a track record for prompt quality.
  • PRODUCT ADJUSTMENTS: As the iC-R gets geared up for production, there will likely be some minor adjustments to improve the final product. Pre-production prototypes are made to test and refine the product and allow us to incorporate our adjustments and those suggested by experienced manufacturing partners. These will always be for the benefit and safety of you, the consumer, and we will let you know exactly how and why any are made.
  • FULFILLMENT: Sometimes things go awry that can’t be planned for: a supplier misses a deadline, a machine breaks down, or a shipment gets lost. Those things could cause a delay. To minimize the possibility of manufacturing setbacks we will enter the manufacturing stage with at least one back-up supplier for each component pre-located and my product commercialization experts will help ensure smooth sailing from our suppliers and factories.
  • Availability of components
  • Meeting important rider helmet safety standards

We will be working with manufacturers who have years of experience delivering excellent products in tremendous quantities. There will no doubt be some surprises along the road, but any obstacle will be addressed by combining our internal knowledge with external expertise, and an overall goal of making the best possible product for you, our Intelligent Cranium Helmets customers.

ANY pledge amount brings us one step closer to our goal. Help us bring this great concept product to life by selecting a Perk option to Back This Project, or by helping us spread the word by sharing our page.

The iC-R Dream Team are firm believers in that "it's not the size of the storm that comes your way, but how you go through it".

The iC-R Dream Team

A.J. Dodson (Chief Executive Officer)

A. Dodson (Chief Operations Officer)

B. Hostetter (Project Manager)

N. Mathur (Engineer)

D. Jones-Harris (Logistics Manager)

R. Irvine (Cost Analyst/Finance Manager)

Achilles Entertainment (Design Team)


Other Ways You Can Help

We know that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they still can't help.  One of the best ways any and everyone can show their support is by spreading the word via word of mouth or through social media.

So take a leap of faith and support this great company, project, product, and other products to follow.  #iCRHelmets #HelpSaveLives #ClickFundShare

And that's all there is to it.

Custom iC-R Perks

story:
As a way to support gorgeous Gaёl and the guys and show her how many of us love her and are thinking of her - it struck me that we could all check down the back of the sofa for pennies. 

If we all did that, we might be able to collectively help Gaёl, Jadzia, Albert, Eddie and Magnus to go on a much wished-for trip to Costa Rica. Magnus's father lives on a farm there and the lovely doctors have said a post-chemo holiday would be a great thing. They so deserve it, each one of them. How about it? Got a spare couple of quid? Lets see if we can collectively rustle up enough to help get them there!

I don't know how we do the tweeting and googling and all that stuff - but let's click the buttons and get it shared out there to all of us who know this gorgeous lot!

We love you Mosessons!! xxxx

story:
Weather you are a survival expert, looking for some local delicacies or just struggling to pay the bills. the natural environment is packed full of free food for the taking. my app will help make it available for everyone. a simple to use app using a map format that all users can tag locations of what they have found and add descriptions. with a star rating system and comments section for others to update.   

we are looking for partial funding for the design and implementation of the project. and in return when it's ready you will get access to an add free vip "founding fathers" version of the app before it hits the ground. (only people who have helped us will get this)

story:
At VALO we started with a simple idea - how do we satisfy a pain point (wasting time on unnecessary things) in everyone's life?  How do we manage it?  How do we change it?  We then tried to solve the riddle: "How do we get more people to think like us?"  We spent hours, days, months and years trying to figure this out.  We dreamed, we planned, and we collaborated.  We knew that in order to fulfill our mission, we couldn't stop with the idea.  Unīt is the first product from this process.

VALO's primary objective is to create exciting products that keeps things in life truly simple - from the design to functionality to impact.  Each intention is deliberate.  Unīt is the first in an ecosystem of products, focused on convenience and conservation, allowing you to commit to what is truly important to you.  From the moment you purchase our product, you become aware of its potential for your own use.  From there, you will become a member of a conscientious community of buyers who believe in things like sustainable, environmentally-friendly and reusable products.  Finally, you join our movement of opportunity, as we partner with organizations that give back to their communities.

Purchasing Unīt not only saves you time, but it connects your heart.

Where we are in our development

We currently have an array of sample product components, focused on meeting all of our requirements.  We are design and detail enthusiasts.  We have worked for over two years in optimizing the product and have paid for final sample development and first run production.  We are in the process of tooling and testing the water bottle and shoes, to optimize fit, reliability and design to meet our extraordinarily high standards.

One of our goals for Unīt by VALO is to create an eco-friendly product. Our clothing is made from 100% organic cotton, a much better alternative to regular cotton.


Aside from our clothing, we wanted to make sure our water bottle was eco-friendly as well. We achieve that by using BPA-free Tritan, rather than your standard plastic.


Why we need YOUR help

After over two years of design, testing and market research, we now need your support for tooling, process certification and manufacturing acceleration. 

By pre-ordering Unīt and helping to spread the message of this good work, we can engage our manufacturers to fulfill orders in a timely and efficient manner.  Large scale manufacturing is important in order to allow us to offer this product at a great price.  Your support will also allow us to extend our reach to our partners, thereby expanding our cause.  You are our catalyst for growth.


Other ways you can help

If you are unable to make a financial contribution right now, don't worry!  There are other ways you can support us.

Please share and like us on Social Media:

  Facebook     Instagram     Twitter


This is one of the most powerful ways you can support and engage with our movement.  Spread the word, share the opportunity, and grow the dream.

Contact

If you would like to get in contact with us, please go to our website and send us a message:

www.valoventures.com or email us directly at valoventures@gmail.com.

story:
Introducing Tick Bands

Tick Bands are for people who know they need tick protection but don’t want to be hassled by it. Maybe you’re one of the 350,000 people in the U.S. every year who have contracted a tick-borne illness and don’t want one again. Or you just don’t want to get sick in the first place.

Tick Bands empower people to feel safe outdoors with advanced tick protection. We want you to enjoy being in the woods or your back yard. Your enjoyment shouldn’t suffer because you’re worried about ticks or getting sick.

And Tick Bands are incredibly easy to use: just spray, wrap and go!

Tick Bands’ secret weapon against ticks is patent-pending Thermoflage technology. When ticks are close by you, they hunt using infrared vision. Thermoflage uses anti-infrared materials developed to make soldiers invisible to night vision goggles – so you look less like a tick’s next meal.

 

Our Story

Tick Bands come from the personal experience of founders Dean DeSeve and his dad Gerry. We love being outdoors. We also live in Pennsylvania – the state with the most cases of Lyme Disease, a tick-borne illness.

Dean at age 9

When Dean was 9 he was bitten by a tick and came down with Lyme. Once he recovered, he didn’t want ticks to keep him from being outside.

So Dean picked up a glue gun and made the first Tick Bands using scrap fabric. They worked so well that we made more, to keep our whole family safe.

The first Tick Band, made by Dean

Since those first Tick Bands, we’ve built and tested nine generations of prototypes. Each one has been an improvement, with better design, stronger construction, and more rugged materials.

We researched how ticks hunt their prey and how they see. We’ve spent hours field testing Tick Bands to make sure they’re truly effective. We bought an industrial sewing machine (nicknamed “The Beast”) to make lots of Tick Bands for use in the real world.

 

Praise For Tick Bands

We’ve been thrilled by the positive reactions to Tick Bands by testers and fans. Here are some of the reactions so far:

this is AMAZING! - Julie C.

I have used Tick Bands for months now and I find them effortless to put on and so comfortable to wear that I forget they’re on. I cannot recommend them enough. - Chris S.

Our family spends a ton of time in the woods either hiking or geocaching. Tons of opportunities to get ticks. So far, so good and no ticks! - Joan L.

The moment I saw them I thought 2 things:  (1) Genius; and (2) I can’t believe these weren’t invented years ago. Great product. - Mark O.

I had to drop you a note telling you how much I have enjoyed the Tick Bands. Living here in the Connecticut Valley and being an avid woodcock hunter I ended up with three embedded ticks at the beginning of hunting season last fall. Sending along a photo of [all of the ticks] I took off of [my dog] Sassy in one two hour hunt. After putting on the bands I didn’t have one problem. The thing that was most significant for me was the peace of mind that it created. Again can’t thank you enough. - Rich C

Ticks taken off of Rich C's dog

 

Tick Bands Go Anywhere

Tick Bands are made to go anywhere and do anything you love doing outdoors, like hiking, camping and gardening.

 

Making A Great Product

We’re obsessed with making sure Tick Bands are a great product. We want your Tick Bands to keep you safe for years. So we're making them in the USA from the most rugged, high-quality materials available. 

We've gotten a lot of requests to ship Tick Bands as soon as possible. In order to meet this need, we will produce Tick Bands in-house for our first backers using our industrial sewing machine. We've made hundreds of Tick Bands already and we're ready to make more so our early backers can get them quickly.

Volume production will be done by MISC Products of Michigan. MISC is a custom manufacturer of complex webbing assemblies such as aircraft harnesses and seat belts. They've been in business for more than 50 years.

MISC Products' production facility in Macomb, Michigan

MISC's customers include Tesla, GM and the Department of Defense. We're confident MISC will be able to produce the high-quality product our customers deserve!

 

Backer Rewards

Be the first to get Tick Bands by backing our campaign. 

Pair Of Tick Bands In Coyote Brown

Pair Of Tick Bands In Foliage Green

The Duo - Two Pairs Of Tick Bands In Your Choice Of Colors

 

Available Perks

Tick Bands are available during the campaign in quantities from one to five pairs. Perks will ship in June of 2018. We only offer shipping to the United States.

 

Sizing 

Tick Bands are sized by height. Find your height below to select the right size.

5 Feet Tall Or Less - Extra Small

5' 1" to 5' 5" - Small

5' 6" to 5' 9" - Medium

5' 10 to 6' 0"  - Large

6' 1" to 6' 4" - Extra Large

Please note:

1)  We will gladly exchange your unused Tick Bands for another size if they don't fit.

2) Order a size larger if you will be wearing your Tick Bands over boots or heavy pants like corduroys.

3) Order a size down if you will be wearing your Tick Bands with shorts.

4)  There are not separate sizes for men and women: everyone can use the size choices above.

 

Production Timeline

The Tick Bands team is committed to getting backers their premiums on time. Our production will begin immediately after the campaign has ended, and the last shipments will be sent in October. Our manufacturing partner, MISC Products, has committed to the production schedule below based on a volume of 10,000 pairs.

Long-term, we will continue making Tick Bands. We will take orders from our Web site (http://tick-bands.com) after the Indegogo campaign has ended. Ultimately, we plan on having Tick Bands sold through major on-line retailers and sporting goods stores.

 

Who We Are

Dean and Gerry

Dean is in 6th grade. His favorite subjects are history and math. He’s on the middle school track team. In his free time, Dean reads (a lot), runs, hikes, skis and plays golf. He loves his two cats and two dogs.

Gerry is an inventor and entrepreneur. He’s launched several new products, has filed three patents, and was a Vice President of Business Development for a Fortune 500 company. Read more about Gerry on LinkedIn.

We also want to thank our extended team, including super model Andrew, drone videographer Jackson, and the fantastic Lauren, who did a truly great job writing most of what you're reading here. Of course, we also want to thank our amazingly supportive family.

 

How We Give Back

Tick Bands is proud to be giving 5% of our annual revenue to the amazing LivLyme Foundation.

LivLyme provides support to children with Lyme Disease whose families can't afford treatment and funds Lyme-related research. LivLyme was started by chronic Lyme Disease sufferer Olivia Goodreau when she was 10. Learn more about LivLyme and donate here: http://livlymefoundation.org.

We also regularly volunteer our time, raise money for causes we're passionate about (like this one), and donate Tick Bands to those who need them. Most recently, we've donated Tick Bands to the Scouts, Lyme Disease Awareness Month and a family of four, all of whom have Lyme Disease and are struggling financially. If an organization you know needs Tick Bands for fundraising or staying safe, definitely send us a message though Indegogo and we'll do our best to help out.

 

Social Media

We'd love to have you follow us and learn more about our story!

We're @tickbands on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter.

 

Media Inquiries

Visit http://www.tick-bands.com/media for Tick Bands’ Media Kit including our fact sheet, photos and detailed information about tick-borne illnesses like Lyme Disease.

We have a limited number of pre-production prototype samples for members of the media, bloggers and influentials – request yours by visiting http://tinyurl.com/tickbandsvip.

 

Credits

Spray Bottle icon by Julieta Felix, rotating arrow by Universal Icons and Walking icon by irene hoffman. All icons came from the Noun Project.

story:
WEE WEE VIP Pet Pads

Isn't it time someone made a better pet training pad?

My name is Charles Rick, and I am one of the proud owners of Sorbco.  Our mats originated for industrial uses such as protecting air cargo from leaks and spills.
Utilizing this Revolutionary Technology, our New DECORATIVE Pet Mat's Benefits Include:
  • Absorbs Instantly
  • Entire Mat is Absorbent - No Aiming for the Middle!
  • Leak-Proof
  • Cuts To Size
  • Washable/Reusable
  • Soft Faux Fur Brushed Feel
  • Durable/Rip Proof - Even Post Saturation!
  • Airline Approved

And like All Sorbco Products... NO TOXINS, NO CHEMICALS, 100% RECYCLABLE


What We Need & What You Get

To help support and promote our growth, we would like to offer the following specials:

$5 - 1 Mat

$60 - 30 Mats - 1/Day for a Month even though they can be reused.

$49/Month - Auto-Ship - 30 Mats - Different Pattern Each Month.

$2500 - Premium - 1000 Mats - Upload your PERSONAL Design!


WHY WEE WEE VIP Pet Pads?

Standard Pet Training Pads are an Eyesore and Leak but more importantly, they are a combination of cotton, polymers, and plastic resulting in a trip straight to Landfill.

  • Sorbco Pads are Eco-Friendly - The Absorbance Comes from our Patented Design
  • My Team and I have an Incredible Background in Plastics and Small Companies so put your faith behind Us and these Amazing Mats.

Risks & Challenges

  • We always knew we had a unique Absorbent Mat... making it Decorative for Your Home was our Biggest Challenge.
  • Patterns are Embedded in the Weave so they DO NOT wash off or bleed.
  • Liquid is Locked and Contained within Our Patented Construction.

If You Don't Have a Pet ...

  • Please Forward to your Friends
  • and use Indiegogo share tools to make it even easier.

YOU and Your PET DESERVE BETTER!

story:
As you may or may not already know, David Lee Dodge has come so far over the past couple years. I have accomplished things I never dreamt possible of myself, whether rebuilding the entire drivetrain, continually overcoming seemingly endless obstacles, or actually finding funds to keep this thirsty dude covering mile after mile.

 

If you know me, you already know that more often then not, I create not for cash, but to make someone smile. I find much more substance and fulfillment in in someone being stoked about a piece of art then I ever could in the payment of such an item. This however, does not fill the tank.

 

This is where you come in...

 

Ms. Sue kept her end of the deal and moved into the shop for a year, learned new ways to see anything, pushed her comfort levels out of her regular scope, & fully committed to a different way of life with me, even so much as helping me fund the build out of our traveling art studio.

 

Now I must do the same. I have fully committed to going east, & learning the lessons I feel I can only find with her tribe. Adjusting to a completely different setup, & be it weather, or personalities, I will see it through and accept the lessons to come. I wish to learn what she needs of me to find her balance, & find the pieces of myself I need to be the best version of myself I can be, for her.

 

I have put countless hours, blood, sweat, tears, & rage quit fits into this dude. I have fully committed to the next step of the journey, & the spiritual lessons to follow. The only thing left to accomplish, is to keep that gas tank full. 

 

I will be shooting out her way for the summer, & at the end of August, we shall begin this journey together. For your contribution to this gas fund, I would like to cruise by on our way back, see a spot in your space that centers your spirit, & create for you, something from my spirit.

 

I can't do this without the backing of my buds who have pushed me further into my destiny for so long now, I can't wait to make some new friends to create for, & I honestly can't thank you enough for your support of this, the most important endeavor of my spirit and craft to date.

Adjusting to a completely different setup, & be it weather, or personalities, I will see it through and accept the lessons to come. I wish to learn what she needs of me to find her balance, & find the pieces of myself I need to be the best version of myself I can be, for her.
 
I have put countless hours, blood, sweat, tears, & rage quit fits into this dude. I have fully committed to the next step of the journey, & the spiritual lessons to follow. The only thing left to accomplish, is to keep that gas tank full. 
 
I will be shooting out her way for the summer, & at the end of August, we shall begin this journey together. For your contribution to this gas fund, I would like to cruise by on our way back, see a spot in your space that centers your spirit, & create for you, something from my spirit.
 
I can't do this without the backing of my buds who have pushed me further into my destiny for so long now, I can't wait to make some new friends to create for, & I honestly can't thank you enough for your support of this, the most important endeavor of my spirit and craft to date.

story:
Unique Tree house in cradle of nature

Most tree houses in Lithuania are only for private use, so we decided to make a tree house available for public. We want that anyone could come in our tree house and spend here some time in calm and nice nature. The tree house is supposed for those, who want to run from stress, from city, from fast life mode and escape to place they dreamed about - nature, nobody around, slow life mode, calm, birds, swinging tree house in the trees and possibility to do nothing. The tree house will be equipped with wood stove heating system, walls, roof and floor heat insulation so you could stay in winter time as well. You even could celebrate Christmas time 2019 or 2020 New Year celebration or 2020 Valentine day in the tree house. 

This tree house will be best for alone or couple stay. You can watch birds from early spring to late autumn. The tree house is only few kilometers away from Žuvintas biosphere reserve, where birds are the lords. And there are thousands of them, they live there all the time. So you will be able to listen and to see them. During your stay in the tree house you will be able to go directly to Žuvintas biosphere reserve and stay there for all day and then come back to tree house for night calm rest.  You can find many information about Žuvintas biosphere reserve here. This is official reservation page, so it is in Lithaunian, but of  course, please ask us if you have any need of translation. Property of "Perk" pictures belongs to Žuvintas biosphere reserve.

So we want to offer for our contributors and supporters to live in the tree house as first guests and to get this possibility for lower price. Later, we will rent the tree house over booking.com, airbnb.com and other platforms. We have investigated the budget for tree house, we made visualization, which you can see in our video and we made action plan for building the tree house. 

We are professional tree house builders with 5 years of experience. In this time we created and tested different types of tree house platform attachments and completed around 20 projects of different tree houses. Our website. Time plan for Veribejai tree house is:
- Up to April 15, 2019 to build the platform.  This depends on weather and how fast the spring will come.
- Up to June 1, 2019 to build the tree house. This will depend on the contributions we will get. If we will get full sum we need, then we will finish the tree house in full scale as we planed. 
- Up to June 15, 2019 to finish the tree house and invite first guests by that date. As well by that date it will be made camping site and fireplace on the ground next to the tree house. Again, this will very very depend on the contributions we will get. 

Contributors will be able to stay in this tree house first ones - 2019 summer and later depends on when you will want to come.

What We Need & What You Get

We already chose place, made agreement with landlord, made 3D drawings and have materials for platform. 

To build this unique Tree house we need your support of 7000 EUR / 7971 USD for materials and hired labor. Total amount of the project is 7790 EUR / 8870 USD. Around 10% of the sum we will invest our own funds.

If we will not succeed to gather necessary amount of money, we will built the tree house in smaller scale and with less features. This will be specified later according to the budget we will gather.

The Impact

  • Most tree houses in Lithuania are private and people can't use opportunity to stay in the tree houses. We will change the game and we will create the opportunity for anyone to stay or even live for longer time in the tree house.  
  • Tree house is located next to the most important swamp in the Europe - Žuvintas biosphere reserve (It is in UNESCO secured territory list). So we will make possible for people to stay next to that marvel place and to listen, to watch and to feel the birds life.
  • Of course, people stayed in the calm tree house will improve their mental situation (less stress, rest in the nature). 

Risks & Challenges

  • Tree house platform is quite big, so we need to hing it on trees with less stress for trees.
  • Our goal is to do as less as possible intervention and not to damage trees.
  • The risk is not build tree house up to the time we decided if we will not gather enough budget. So we will have to make it in smaller scale and less features. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share this campaing with your friends, it's only way to gather necessary funds.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

I am a retired Architect/Project Manager that controlled a large region for an Telecommunications company. During my many trips, especially on very early mornings, I found it difficult if not impossible to sleep on planes or trains and envied those who could fall asleep immediately on take-offs. Asking for pillows was futile, as I could not get them in the correct position to aid in my comfort. I always thought there were possibilities, but after searching and finding nothing that offered relief, I went about sketching ideas. After numerous tries, I came up with one design that quickly turned into a home made prototype. This was tested out on my spouse who found it extremely comfortable on an 8 hour drive. Wanting to believe, I tried it out myself on the return trip and found myself asleep on the drive home. The prototype sat in the closet for a few years until recently.

Fast forward to retirement and the Travel Kozy came alive. Now I have taken it to a point where I need to get this out to the mass market so that it can be enjoyed by the million of travelers around the world. I've been in contact with several professional marketers that can assist with this effort, but I need your support to make this happen. I have taken the Travel Kozy from the concept stage to being patented, trademarked and produced, now I need to get it to the mass market through a well planned marketing campaign that will benefit the many travelers given the environment of smaller, thinner and hard seats we are experiencing in today's airplanes.

With your help and backing, the Travel Kozy can be featured in the "As Seen on TV" market, Travel magazines, retail and on-line stores and the like. 

What We Need & What You Get

I am seeking a sum of Forty Thousand Dollars ($40,000) to embark on this campaign with all funding going towards marketing to the general public and the purchase of additional promotional items shown further along and described below. 

Perks being offered include:

A well designed beverage koozie with the company logo

Baseball cap with company logo

Polo shirts with company logo in white, black or charcoal

Canvas shopping bag with company logo

Best of all, the Travel Kozy in 1 or 3 piece design (ready to ship)

I am seeking flexible funding with funds going towards the marketing efforts and/or purchase of promotional items (depending on support over and above those already in hand). The remaining funds will be supplemented by personal funds to achieve the marketing funding goal.

The Impact

In my video, I shared a story about an elderly lady and her discomfort on the flight home from Las Vegas and how the Travel Kozy made her flight comfortable. Stories like hers demonstrate how a device like the Travel Kozy is important for the traveling public, especially for those that suffer from back and other upper body issues. Since its development and testing, there are several testimonials from travelers that swear by the Travel Kozy and its comfort, but I need you the public to support this effort in bringing this to the mainstream market and making today's travel more comfortable and bearable given the trend in seat designs and overcrowded planes.

Although the Travel Kozy was designed and intended mainly for travel, we have discovered multiple other uses for the device, all reporting back from our in-field testers who are constant business travelers. Below are just a few testimonials!

"I use the Travel Kozy in my hotel room propped on pillows to provide the perfect support while completing my trip reports. It does not collapse like pillows and offer the perfect support"

"I could only drive for 2 hours on long trips before stopping to stretch due to back pains. With the Travel Kozy I was able to drive for 8 hours without stopping"

"I could not sleep on planes and dreaded my long flight from Tampa to Hawaii because of my severe back pains, but with the Travel Kozy, I not only slept for the first time, but did not experience the pains with the trip"

These comments only fueled my desire to make the Travel Kozy a success story and with your help, this can become a reality.

Risks & Challenges

To date I have overcome most of the challenges associated with a product of this type. The prototypes were developed with a local company, the patent was secured in record time (10 months) was featured in Inventors Digest and had a pre-launch on line. Due to some medical issues and other distractions in retirement, the project has lapsed into obscurity and now is the time to bring it back to life. The Travel Kozy is lightweight, measures 6 inches in diameter by 15 inches long in its compressed state and travel bag. The challenge faced is how to get it to market without an infomercial so that people will realize the benefits of the product. This is a daunting task that your assistance will play an important role in making this happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

Should you not be able to assist in this campaign, please share this story with your friends and family. Thanks for your help. Much appreciated.

story:
Short Summary

 

The Manneken Trip started 16 months ago on January 2018, and is a big success so far. Since the beginning of the expedition, I (Arnaud Maldague) covered + 12.000 kilometers, through very diverse and extreme environments. If the americas have been crossed before, none were as innovative and challenging, this human powered expedition is a Worldwide first.

- Skiing & ski-kiting the Canadian Arctic : 1700 km , 110 days.
- Cycling Manitoba : 1900 km , 30 days.
- Kayaking the Mississippi river : 3900 km , 103 days.
- Cycling USA, Mexico, and Belize : 4500 km, 69 days.

Carrying a GPS devise, my progress can be followed live on Livexplorer, and my previous itinerary can be checked here. The expedition is now halfway, nonetheless huge challenges remain ahead. And that's why The Manneken Trip needs your support !

- Sailing the Caribbean sea : Belize to Guyana.
- Paddling and walking the Amazon jungle : Guyana, Manaus Brazil, Peru. 
- Cycling Peru and Bolivia
- Horse-riding Argentina
- Walking Patagonia.

The expedition has the privilege to benefits from Berghaus and Flysurfer Kiteboarding sport equipment support. However, The Manneken Trip expenses remain self-funded since the beginning. In 2016 at 26 years old, believing it is worth to chase your dreams, I started training and working full time on this human challenge. I invested every penny in the expedition, owning nothing myself in Belgium. 

To be able to continue, and and achieve this worldwide first, The Manneken Trip needs you !

What I Need & What You Get

100% of the funds are used towards the expedition achievement, and sharing of the adventure to the Manneken Trip community. Contributing to this campaign is not only being part of a worldwide first and human achievement. It is also enabling me to share the journey with all of you. The trip is recorded through action-cams, drones and DSLR cameras, which sole purpose is to enable public to join and immerge into a lifetime experience.

The success of this trip will be followed by a documentary movie, public conferences and a book.

Upcoming costs

Daily life
- Visas : 900 €
- Food (18 months) : 7200 €
- Insurances : 1700 €

Gear & logistic 
- 2 Horses : 4000 €
- Gear ( Horse riding gear, Packraft, Amazon jungle, etc )  :  4200 €
- Equipment sending costs : 800 €

Communication & video
- Iridium satelite communication (Sailing & Amazon jungle) : 1200 €
- Electronics hardware (cameras, hard drive, etc.) : 1000 €

Total = 21 000 € 

What I ask : 10 500 €

 

The Impact

Why this trip ? What benefits ? 

This adventure has as main purpose to demonstrate the perks of going out of your comfort zone. We all have unfulfilled dreams, or unfollowed passions, the expedition wants to demonstrate the perks of following them, spark the energy inside you. But because we don't all have the same chances in life, this is also just an open window on the outdoor world for those who physically can't do the same. An invite to immerge into nature and escape our interconnected world. 

The Manneken trip is also an environmental project, which goal is to promote environmental initiatives in each country. Giving an open voice all over the Americas to socio-environmental initiatives and focus on positive  and concrete actions. The project has already recorder and interviewed 5 projects so far, only 1 video was edited and published however by lack of time and resources to do so. 

 

Risks & Challenges

Risks and challenges are numerous, the journey is paved with them and that's what makes it a unique achievement. Pirates, wildlife, jungle, mountains, the ocean, health issues, extreme weather and dangerous environments are all big threats to be aware of. Most legs of this expedition, if taken apart, offer huge challenges, combined they create a unique, unprecedent and extreme one.

This is why I trained for 2 years prior to the expedition. The Manneken trip has been my single focus since 2016, training all over Europe in each practice of the trip. Each leg has been carefully analysed and accounted for. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Small gesture that helps me more than you imagine  

  • Please share this campaign.
  • Invite all your friends to follow the trip on Facebook and Instagram.
  • If you're a social media Guru or videomaker willing to help, feel free to reach out :)

Infinite thanks,  and Welcome to the Journey !

story:
Short Summary

  • Hello, our names are Jim and Ryan! We both live in Rigby, Idaho and enjoy creating and building new ideas. Jim moved to Idaho a couple years ago after selling his cattle business in Eastern Washington to help his wife pursue her dream of running a business. They have a young boy and love riding horses and being out in the country. Ryan moved back to Idaho a few months ago after three years of living in Arizona running a small business with his wife. They are both passionate about the outdoors and love traveling and meeting new people. 
  • We have both worked in the construction industry and know how difficult it can be to carry small, yet heavy, equipment around. We also understand the difficulties of storing heavy equipment when you travel or go camping. Combining these two aspects into one idea, we created an assisted lift to haul heavy equipment around the work-site and the camp-site. We are motivated by the joy people see in our products and inventing new ideas to help those around us who enjoy the outdoors and traveling. 
  • This is a new product that has never been on the market before. We have patented the design and it's functionality. We are being our online store and hope to be present in retail stores and construction equipment stores around the nation. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are looking to get $10,000 in initial funding to help get our prototype perfected and built by a manufacturer to start sending out product. We are making them by hand and would love to have them perfect in every possible way. 
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, we would still use the funds in the same way but in a smaller scale. 

The Impact

 

  • This is a really fun idea and is very helpful to whomever uses it. It lowers the risk of injury on the workplace and allows everyone of all ages to haul heavy equipment (generators, cargo, construction equipment, etc...) without strain. 
  • This will also impact our lives as well and help us achieve our goal of working together and building something meaningful. We would love your support in making this become a reality. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you are not able to make a contritubtion, please feel free to share this with everyone you know. The most important thing right now is spreading the word! Every little bit helps and we would be so thankful for everything. 

Thank you all so much!

story:
Ready or not, here we come... introducing the R72 Grab&Go Vest, which includes 8 modular bags, a tube tent, and removable flotation liners.

View new User Support Videos at:

 

Load up the modular bags you need for your adventure on the front and back of the R72 Grab&Go Vest. R72 hat and knife bundle pictured above.

We are focused on inspiring people to pursue adventures while also preparing for emergencies. Like you, we've personally experienced unexpected emergencies and disasters and lost friends to flash floods and other natural disasters. We're on a mission to help the alarming number of people not prepared for unexpected emergencies and adventures, live prepared!

How will Indiegogo funds bring R72 to life?

We've invested our own time and money in the research and development of multiple prototypes and in searching for the right manufacturing partners. Thanks to you, we're  proceeding with production and on-time delivery.    

Below is an example of how one R72 designer packs his R72 Grab & Go Vest. 

Items Pictured (not included with pledge) - 

Front (left vest): cellphone, knife, tactical pen, first aid kit, tissue paper, granola bars, hand sanitizers, thermal blanket, soap, shampoo. 

Back (right vest): clothes, eating utensils, flashlight, radio, batteries, MREs, tent, heating can, blanket, documents (front zipper - top bag) 

Whether or not you decide to pledge, PLEASE ready yourself and your family for emergencies by building a 72 hour readiness kit. Click for GUIDELINES

Yes, all of the below items can fit in the R72 Grab&Go Vest.

What will you take on your next adventure?

Recommended packing of front for proper weight distribution

Recommended packing of back for proper weight distribution

 

Who are the creators of this project?

We are a small group of friends who specialize in different fields - disaster response & security, recreation, innovation & design, sales & marketing, sourcing & fulfillment, and fundraising. Our collective experience and shared resources allow for this collaboration. We warmly welcome backers of R72 to drive future product development by connecting and collaborating with us here, via this Indiegogo campaign.

We initially asked ourselves, "Why let 72-hour kits sit unused and get outdated when we can create a practical, modular system of vests and bags that are useful for both emergencies and adventures."  

Early mockups of R72 vests.

Prototypes are in hand! Decisions, decisions. Our highly-skilled prototyper designs military-grade bags. Notice that we're using military weave patterns for both functionality and modularity. When a modular bag is on the vest, it is REALLY on.

While we know not everyone will need this feature immediately, each R72 vest comes with removable flotation liners (pictured in bottom left corner above). Whether you live on an island, on a coast, or in a desert, you never know when a flood might hit. This feature is inspired by too many lives lost in unexpected flash floods. While flotation is NOT the primary intended use of the R72 Grab&Go Vest, we do feel it could be helpful in an emergency. The removable flotation liners may be used with or without the R72 Grab&Go Vest. 

Currently the R72 Grab&Go Vest is designed for adults and teens - 20+ inches around waist. For this crowdfunding campaign, we are focused on manufacturing the adult vest first. Once you receive your vest, we would love any feedback for a 2.0 version and a children’s version that will be released in 2021 on RSeventyTwo.com.

Too often, we see families separated during floods and tsunamis. The strap at the top of the R72 Grab&Go vest serves as both a sturdy holding strap, as well as a snap-on-tool to connect and keep families together during disasters. 

In the 20 second clip above, R72's Chief of Innovation spends a quick minute showing you how committed we are to functional modularity - the flotation liners can be used in the vest or out of the vest! A reviewer of this campaign page commented that the flotation liners can also be used as a comfortable pillow while camping... too cool! R72 backers will drive future development.   

 

The R72 vests and bags ship in mesh packaging that can be used for multiple purposes. It conveniently carries the bags or doubles as a laundry bag.

Fit up to 32 ounces in included bottle carriers (2)

Eight R72 Bags, flotation liners, and a tube tent come with the R72 Vest - more modular bags to come for photography, hunting, fishing, and more. We'd love your feedback.

Need more R72 Grab&Go Vests or Gear? Once the campaign ends, you'll have the option of adding additional vests.

 **All shipping fees will be collected separately once the campaign is over via CrowdOx** 

Discounted shipping is provided through R72's partnership with Hatch Fulfillment. Free local pickup/delivery in Utah will also be optional.

Shipping estimates for the first R72 Grab&Go Vest:  United States: $15-20 | Taiwan: $40 | United Kingdom: $40 | EU: $48 | Hong Kong / Malaysia / Singapore: $48 | Rest of the World: $50

Each additional R72 Bundle: United States: +$18 | Rest of the World: +$25/

Each Pledge Add-On: Around $5/Add-On (US & Rest of the World)

*VAT/Customs duty will be pre-charged for customers in EU countries. In all other countries the responsibility is at time of delivery for the backer.

For EU backers only: We will be charging VAT duties in BackerKit once the campaign is over. Please see below for duties costs depending on your country.

VAT by country: Austria, Bulgaria, Estonia, France, Slovakia, United Kingdom: 20% | Belgium, Czech Republic, Latvia, Lithuania, Netherlands, Spain: 21% | Croatia, Denmark, Sweden: 25% | Cyprus, Germany, Romania: 19% | Finland, Greece: 24% | Ireland, Poland, Portugal: 23% | Italy, Slovenia: 22% | Hungary: 27% | Luxembourg: 17% | Malta: 18%

Click image above to access R72 Grab&Go Vest Press Kit

While it is not common practice to offer refunds or returns on items received as Indiegogo perks, if you find any defects with R72 products when you receive your shipment(s), please let us know via email at RSeventyTwo@gmail.com and we will be happy to make it right. 

 

Thank YOU sincerely for your interest in this unique product design project. The R72 brand is new and you are considering being a part of pioneering it. Thanks!

Whether or not you decide to support the R72 Grab&Go campaign, we encourage you to have an emergency plan in place for yourself and your families for emergencies, by visiting https://www.ready.gov/plan. 

#LIVESAFE #LIVEPREPARED #LIVEKIND #LIVEJOY 

 

Tap/Click to join the R72 Facebook Community
