story:
Thank you for taking the time to check out our project. We are thrilled to be back to introduce our Key Titan product line! We started our crowdfunding career with Pry.Me, a penny-sized titanium bottle opener and more recently ran a special Kickstarter “All in 1” 7-day campaign with Brew Soldier, a key-sized titanium bottle opener. We have gotten tremendous support for Pry.Me and Brew Soldier both on Kickstarter and here on Indiegogo and are excited share our patent pending Key Titan lineup!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Comparison of Standard Key Ring vs Key Titan - Shake Test

 

 

 

KT5: Put a Ring on It

The KT5 uses a Suppression Ring to silence your keys.  

  1. Install your keys  
  2. Slip the Suppression Ring into position
  3. Run around, enjoy the silence.  

Our two-step key removal ensures your keys stay where you want them (See “Be Secure” Section Below).

.

Installing Keys onto KT5

 

Suppression Ring Grooves

 

KT7 and KT10: Three Gates are Better Than One

The KT7 and KT10 uses a Sweeper Gate and Elastic Loop to silence your keys.  

  1. Install your keys  
  2. The sweeper gate will push them together  
  3. Tuck the keys up under the elastic  
  4. Jump, enjoy the silence.  

Our two-step key removal ensures your keys stay where you want them. (See “Be Secure” Section Below). 

Installing Keys onto KT7 (Applies to KT10)

 

Reverse Clipping 

Reverse clipping Key Titan can ensure extra security when travelling or allow you to take your keys with you (noise free) when you exercise. 

Reverse Clipping Key Titan

 

 

 

Tip: Put your keys in the order that you use them during the day to ensure you stop the “Key Fumble” as you approach a door.

Organize the Mess and Stop the "Key Fumble"

 

Access a Single Key on KT7 or KT10 

KT7 and KT10 feature an elastic loop which can be used to store keys and keep them silent. The elastic is in an optimal position for varying key lengths allowing easy storing and deployment of individual keys. To access a single key, grab the rib that runs down the side of it and rotate it out. To store the key back into your Key Titan slide the elastic loop up and push the key back into position:

Key Access on KT7 (Applies to KT10)

 

Separate Key and Hang Areas

We gave Key Titan two clip areas, one for keys (green area) and one for hanging the Key Titan unit (red area) removing the chance of an accidental key drop when clipping your Key Titan to your pant loop, purse handle, or other objects.

Separate key opening (green area) and hang opening (red area) to prevent accidental key drops when attaching or removing Key Titan.

 

KT5: 2-Step Key Removal

Your keys are important to you…so we have added a 2-step removal to all the products in the Key Titan lineup to ensure they don’t unexpectedly get away from you:

Step 1) Open Closure Gate

Step 2) Unhook Suppression Ring from the Suppression Ring Hook and push into the Closure Gate Opening

2-Step Removal of Keys from KT5

 

KT7 and KT10: 2-Step Key Removal

Your keys are important to you…so we have added a 2-step removal to all the products in the Key Titan lineup to ensure they don’t unexpectedly get away from you:

Step 1) Untuck Keys from the Elastic Band 

Step 2) Open Closure Gate

2-Step Key Removal of Keys from KT7 (Applies to KT10)

 

Concealed Bottle Opener (KT5, KT7, KT10)

As you may already know from our previous crowdfunding projects with the penny-sized Pry.Me and key-sized Brew Soldier bottle openers, we love inconspicuous bottle openers which keep your keys professional but always beer ready. We just couldn’t resist on this one. In the entrance to the closure gate there is a small bottle opener feature. Made possible by the grade 5 titanium body construction, this feature is less than .050” in height and blends in with the closure gate seamlessly. The neat thing is that you use your keys as the leverage arm which gives you a hidden-in-plain-sight 2.5” bottle opener.

Concealed Bottle Opener

 

1/4" Slip Wrench (KT5, KT7, KT10)

Each Key Titan features a ¼” Slip Wrench. The wrench slips to allow you to drive a ¼” object/bit without lifting the Key Titan off the object/bit. Now you’re not going to be assembling a house with this, but it is a handy tool to have around for those smaller fixes. 

1/4" Slip Wrench Feature

 

Animation of 1/4" Slip Wrench Feature

 

 

Have a Pry.Me or Brew Soldier bottle opener from one of our previous campaigns? We got you covered!  

Brew Soldier

Falls in line nicely with your keys with Key Titan: 

 

PRY.ME (Option 1)

Attach to one of the Key Titans Key Ring Loops:

PRY.ME (Option 2)

Drop your Pry.Me Bottle Opener between two keys and you're off to the races. You can now use your keys as a leverage arm: 

 

I know the above information was a lot to read but we wanted to thank you for taking the time to stop by to read about our project. We are excited to get this third project underway and are extremely thankful for any and all support!

story:
B U L L 3 T :  World's Most Powerful Micro Flashlight, EVER. 

We wanted to create something better, brighter and more robust. Keeping the roots of our BULLET design but improving it's functionality and strength. 

The most powerful BULLET yet! 100 Lumens packed into a robust design. 

How did we finish this tiny, powerful key torch? Our signature black aerospace aluminum and a NEW SOLID Titanium BULL3T. 

One of the most notable advantages of titanium is its strength. It’s among the strongest and most durable metals on the planet, which is why we used it for BULL3T. 

In fact, titanium has the highest strength-to-density ratio of any metallic element on the periodic table, making it the best possible metal to use for a tiny flashlight. Another key advantage associated with titanium is its natural resistance to rust and corrosion. 

We've come a long way since 2015. Our initial BULLET design was flawed, coming undone at the threads at times. To many, a quality control disaster. To us an opportunity to show the world what we were about. Fast forward 4 years, 6 successful projects and over $1M+ raised, here we are.

We wanted to top ourselves when designing BULL3T, designing it smaller than BULLET 02 was near impossible since it's already the World's Smallest, so we took a slightly different approach. It was very important for us to give people what the want out of a EDC flashlight. People wanted brighter, stronger and easy to use, so that’s what we did. 

We used a SMD LED Module (surface-mount device light-emitting diode module) LED and added bigger more powerful batteries. 

SMD LEDs mount on the surface of electronic boards but do not physically go through the boards like other types of LEDs. This minimizes the amount of space needed to mount the LED. One of the biggest improvements is that SMD spotlights offer a higher lumen output for a lower energy consumption – making them more powerful and energy efficient than older LED lights.

This time we threw in more powerful batteries, made the threads tighter, finer, and added a rubber O-ring inside the casing to create a more secure and waterproof flashlight. We upgraded our LED to a premium SMD LED, providing a brighter output of 100 LUMENS. In addition, the leverage provided by the mini O-ring makes it easy to twist on/off.

We ditched the "V-Ring" design and added a loop system with a mini key ring. This new design helps BULL3T stay just where you need it, right when you need it.

 

 

SPECIFICATIONS

  • Weight: Titanium- 13g / Aluminum- 11g
  • Width: 14mm
  • Length: 30mm
  •  Materials: Premium Aerospace Grade Aluminum Alloy (T6061) / Titanium 6Al-4V 
  • Battery: LR44H Button Cell
  • Type of Bulb: Nano SMD LED, 2mm
  • Special Features: Premium On/Off twist setting, Mini Key ring attachment.
  • Metal Options: Polished Titanium / Anodized Black Aluminum

 

SLUGHAUS is a small company based out of San Francisco with the sole mission of helping you stay minimal and functional. We believe that your everyday carry essentials influence your lifestyle. BULL3T's elegance inspires innovation, while its functionality keeps you on-the-go. We hope that our products not only help keep you minimal, but help mold your lifestyle as a whole.

GALLERY:

 HI-RES MEDIA KIT

We know a thing or two about flashlights. We went from the World's Smallest in 2015 to the World's Smallest, Even Smaller in 2017. After 6 successful Kickstarters, $1M+ in funding and delivering 100,000+ flashlights, we wanted to visualize things through a slightly different stream of light; a brighter one. 
B U L L 3 T :  World's Most Powerful Micro Flashlight, EVER. 
We believe that your everyday carry essentials are a reflection of you and your lifestyle. BULL3T is no exception- not only is it functional, beautiful and minimal, but its new design makes it the best, most powerful everyday carry micro LED flashlight available.  We wanted to create something better, brighter and more robust. Keeping the roots of our BULLET design but improving it's functionality and strength. The most powerful BULLET yet! 100 Lumens packed into a robust design. 
How on earth did we pack 100 Lumens into such a compact design? Simple, we upgraded to a state-of-the-art SUPER THIN SMD LED Module offering a higher lumen output for lower energy consumption. 

 
How did we finish this tiny, powerful key torch? Our signature black aerospace aluminum and a NEW SOLID Titanium BULL3T. One of the most notable advantages of titanium is its strength. It’s among the strongest and most durable metals on the planet, which is why we used it for BULL3T. In fact, titanium has the highest strength-to-density ratio of any metallic element on the periodic table, making it the best possible metal to use for a tiny flashlight. Another key advantage associated with titanium is its natural resistance to rust and corrosion. We've come a long way since 2015. This minimizes the amount of space needed to mount the LED. One of the biggest improvements is that SMD spotlights offer a higher lumen output for a lower energy consumption – making them more powerful and energy efficient than older LED lights.
We stuck with our Spring-Lock Mechanism design due to how well it worked for BULLET 02 - second iteration of the World's Smallest Torch Light. However, we made the Gold Plated spring bigger and thicker to provide more pressure inside the casing, giving you a smooth, sturdy operation experience every time.This time we threw in more powerful batteries, made the threads tighter, finer, and added a rubber O-ring inside the casing to create a more secure and waterproof flashlight. We upgraded our LED to a premium SMD LED, providing a brighter output of 100 LUMENS. In addition, the leverage provided by the mini O-ring makes it easy to twist on/off.We ditched the "V-Ring" design and added a loop system with a mini key ring. This new design helps BULL3T stay just where you need it, right when you need it.  SPECIFICATIONS

Battery: LR44H Button Cell
Type of Bulb: Nano SMD LED, 2mm
Special Features: Premium On/Off twist setting, Mini Key ring attachment.
Metal Options: Polished Titanium / Anodized Black Aluminum

story:
Summary

Henry Nickel was elected to San Bernardino's 5th Ward City Council seat in a special election on February 4, 2014.  He currently serves as Chairman of the Ways and Means Committee, and as a member of the Audit and Legislative Review Committees.

Henry was born in San Bernardino.  His family roots within the region extend more than a century.  He received his undergraduate degree in communication, legal institutions, economics and government in 1999 from American University in Washington, DC.  He holds a graduate degree in National Security Studies with honors from California State University San Bernardino.  Additionally, he attended the Campaign Management and Lobbying Institutes at the prestigious American University Center for Congressional and Presidential Studies.

As a student he served internships with both the City of Redlands and former U.S. Representative Jerry Lewis.  During the 2000 and 2004 presidential elections, Henry assisted overseas voter registration efforts in Germany.  From 2001 to 2003 he served as a financial analyst with the U.S. Treasury Department in Washington, DC.  In 2005 he returned to the Inland Empire, establishing a career in transportation.  

In 2007 he was appointed by the San Bernardino Board of Supervisors to Inland Empire HIV Planning Council to oversee federally funded public health programs throughout both San Bernardino and Riverside Counties.  Henry remains committed to lifelong learning, family and community service.  He brings nearly 20 years experience in government, financial services, business, transportation and public health.  Henry consistently advocates for active civic engagement, an improved economy and better quality of life within San Bernardino and throughout the region.  He is honored to serve the constituents of the 5th Ward and City of San Bernardino.

What We Need

Elections matter.  Since winning a special election to the San Bernardino City Council last year, Henry has come to know many like you who strive to make our city and region a better place. Yet as 2015 rolls on, our city approaches a crossroads.  Voters will select candidates to fill a total of 7 seats within the city of San Bernardino this November.

The years to come will present both challenges and opportunities as San Bernardino recovers from bankruptcy. Throughout this time our city must remain devoted to transparency, fiscal responsibility and responsive government.  Indeed the strength, wealth and resilience of a community rely upon the commitment of those who together serve the interests of residents, prosperity and future generations.

Thus we must:

·  Continue transforming our city government and improve the manner in which services are provided within our community.  

·  Demonstrate increased financial accountability to those we serve.

·  Remain committed to rebuilding our city’s tax base and the economic stability required to support a better quality of life both today and tomorrow.  

Our goal is to raise $5,000 in individual contributions by October 15, 2015.  Your generosity will ensure San Bernardino stays the course and emerges as a premier city within the Inland Empire. 
Promises Made, Promises Kept

Since taking office, Henry has fulfilled his commitments to the residents of San Bernardino including:

Safer Neighborhoods: Henry enhanced law enforcement capabilities by approving investments in new police vehicles, enhanced video surveillance capabilities and grant-funded community policing programs. He remains committed to cutting crime, improving enforcement and reducing response times. He supports our law enforcement professionals by advocating for a motivated, stable and capable police department.

Bringing Integrity Back to City Hall: Henry improved transparency through regular community discussions with residents before every city council meeting. He invites input from constituents before crucial council votes. He believes elected officials must remain accountable to those served. He encourages collaboration over conflict within city hall while stressing the need for professionalism over the destructive petty politics of the past.

Addressing our Financial Crisis: Henry voted for sustainable measures to bring San Bernardino out of bankruptcy. He supported the city’s first balanced budget in nearly a decade. He serves on the team now completing the city’s overdue financial audits dating back to 2012. He champions fiscal discipline while putting taxpayers first, pressing for the delivery of the highest quality city services at the best value.

Enhancing Public Safety Services: Henry supported law enforcement efforts to crack down on illicit drug activity. He continues to support enhanced police, code enforcement and fire services. He is committed to restoring service levels to meet the needs of our residents. He understands the city’s first responsibility is to protect life and property through sound investment in our police and fire departments.

Encouraging Homeownership: Henry encouraged the creation city’s first Home Expo event in October 2014 to champion homeownership among city residents. He understands that responsible property owners discourage crime and blight. He recognizes that increased rates of ownership stabilize neighborhoods, increase community involvement, enhance property values and ultimately improve the quality of life for all.

Restoring Prosperity: Henry approved investments to improve neighborhoods, encourage new construction and attract new tax-paying residents and businesses to San Bernardino. He supports simplified permitting and licensing to stimulate investment, commerce and jobs. He understands that efficient, responsive and accountable city government is vital to economic stability, opportunity, growth and success.

The Challenge Ahead

As the November election nears Henry asks for your support.  We must elect those who will remain dedicated to reviving San Bernardino.  Since taking office, Henry maintain an open door policy and invites you to reach out in person or online at www.henrynickel.com.  Together we will continue to rebuild the City of San Bernardino.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
I've been dreaming and planning about cycling the Americas for the past two years. Having to cycle 24.000 km in 9 months is a real challenge but when the challenge represents your dream, you do anything to accomplish it. Not content with "just" cycling the Americas I will also attempt to summit the two highest volcanic peaks in North and South America, Orizaba peak (5638 m) in Mexico and Oyos del Salado (6893 m) in Chile. More so, Montreal-based filmmaker Ioan Roman will follow me in key-points along the way to shoot a documentary of this epic 9 months trip across the wilderness of the Americas.


 Cycling 24.000 km 

Starting on August 1st, I will be cycling from the northernmost point of North America, Prudhoe Bay in Alaska to the southernmost continental point of South America, Ushuaia in Argentina. The entire trip is scheduled to last 9 months and the plan is to cycle about 120 km every day for 5 days a week. Plenty of challenges await me on the way, ranging from surviving in the wild regions of Alaska and Yukon and successfully avoiding any contact with the wild animals to safely bypassing the areas of Central and South America, most often riddled with poverty and controlled by drug cartels. 

 Climbing the highest volcanic peaks 

Not contempt with just cycling 24.000 km, I am also attempting to summit the two highest volcanic peaks of North and South America, Orizaba peak (5638 m) in Mexico and Oyos del Salado peak (6893 m) in Chile/Argentina.  This adds an extra challenge to the entire expedition and the fatigue and the dangers associated with climbing this majestic peaks may jeopardize the entire trip.

Filming the adventure

Having picked up on my story, Montreal-based filmmaker Ioan Roman found my expedition worth to be featured in a documentary film. Thus, an independent crew of two people including him will join me in six locations throughout the entire trip. 
The goal of the entire trip is the overcome all my previous limits and inspire young people from around the world to follow their own dreams. As a fresh graduate of Software Engineering, if I were to follow the "normal" path I should've gotten a job upon graduation this year. Instead I decided to follow a dream, to be the first Romanian-Canadian to cycle across the Americas. By contributing to this project, you help me give others the courage to pursue their own dreams, they own adventures. Do not forget, all our craziest dreams can come true, only if we have the courage to pursue them!

 Costs

In order to make #cycletheamericas expedition and the related documentary possible I will need at least 35,000 USD. The expenses related to the expedition and the shooting of the documentary are explained below:


You can also help by...

Any contribution is important so besides supporting my project financially you can help me by sharing my journey with your friends on the social medias and thus spread the word about the #cycletheamericas expedition & documentary.

Together we can make it happen and show the world the beauty of the Americas and the overcoming of all obstacles standing on my way!

story:
About this project:

Once upon a time I was invited to spend the night in a tent on a nearby mountain from this girl that I was smitten with. When she asked I was taken aback because it was snowing so hard outside that I could not see the building across the street. My clever moment came when I asked "Do I get a badge for that" and she replied "That will depend on your effort". So I rushed home got my scouting hat and handkerchief for around my neck, packed my ruc sack with comics and potato chips....ok that last  part is not true.

Camp Love Scouts was created to recognize your scandalous scouting achievements and provide incentive for more.

So I was thinking this could be fun, and what the world needs now, (to borrow a phrase from the 60's)- Is love sweet love. Okay I am borrowing from a guy named Burt (Who was married to Sheelana the woodland temptress) ok different Burt....Bacharach.

Camp Love Scouts is your opportunity to enjoy the great outdoors while making memories that will keep you smiling for years to come. When others ask if you have been out biking lately, or boating, or climbing they might also wonder what those blushes are for.

You have the scandalous outdoor recreation, We have the reward for that! 

All in a format that your grandmother could approve. (Yay!)

This IndieGoGo funding will provide us with:

  •  Production equipment - $6,200
  • Start up inventory - $19,500
  • Web page design, hosting, other marketing - $9,400
  • Packing, shipping, inventory hardware and software - $1,350
  • 12 months 8-5 customer service outsource, telephone, cable $6,800
Goal is to provide a humorous, slightly suggestive, unique high quality product at a fair price with high customer satisfaction.



Risks, Challenges, and Impact:

Even though I have a bachelors degree in Marketing as well as Accounting and have plenty of independent business experience I still struggle with the confidence in getting the word out about the business and the concept. All of the artwork and characters are my designs but the work with Adobe and other illustration and web based software I rely on others. These two factors make up the slightly high need for a marketing budget that almost reaches the $10,000 mark.


Originally I had intended to contract out the majority of the production but with the variety of graphics involved the quotes I was receiving from all over the United States and abroad it became clear I would need to make the garments as orders come in. This will be time consuming but will allow me to offer a better variety of t-shirt types and colors. With the funds freed up by reduced shirt inventory I think I am going to be able to steer that into offering additional nostalgic scouting gear (with a subtle hint of sexuality).

I can still contract out some production to a small local operation which would allow even greater variety, I would sacrifice margin. I have searched out production opportunities in Haiti, and the states of Kentucky, Michigan, Washington, and Wisconsin. So there is still a high likelihood that success will travel to other localities and not just our small city.

Other than the t-shirts the remaining merit awards can be contracted out to manufacturers and I can still order quantities that get good cost points.

The ruc sacks and the messenger bags are a bit of a problem getting exactly what I am looking for. I would have preferred to provide embroidery on these but that will need to wait until success has been established. The future plan is to use these canvas production capabilities to market the same ruc sacks and messenger bags to other customers such as universities with brand identity embroidery.

Shipping costs will pose challenges but I have been very thorough on that research as well and feel that I have allowed for the needed cost in the pricing.

So there are challenges but there is fund to be had.

loveisbetter@camplovescouts.com

story:
Welcome to my project, it's taken me a long time to this point.

Have you ever been caught in a situation were you need some cash, and there's not a ATM machine in sight. I've searched lots of stores for a suitable product to hold some backup cash, and couldn't find anything. That's when I started my designs for the Backup Emergency Wallet. I've done a lot of testing with various materials, sizes, and shapes before coming up with this design.
I do a lot of outdoor sports in Yorkshire (England), its an amazing place but the weather can turn very quickly. I find simple solutions are often the best, I set out  with these key requirements for the design:
  • The smallest size possible
  • Tough
  • Light weight
  • Waterproof
The final design allows you to carry one tightly rolled note securely on your key chain. Your pledge will allow me turn my idea from the prototype stage into a product.

 My first prototype used plastic but after a crash on my mountain bike it split, so I decided to use aluminium as its strong yet light. The screw top is the best reseable solution, as it offers far superior waterproof seal compared with flaps and push together seals.

The size is designed to fit a UK £20 note,  it will also fit Euro and Dollar notes. Because the Backup Wallet is designed to be as small as possible it weighs just 10 grams (Just less than 2 x 25c coins) you will hardly notice it's there.

What I need from you to make this project happen

I have got my design to prototype stage. I need your pledges to fund the first production run. The funding goal will cover the first production run, and also all shipping costs to anybody who is kind enough to support the project. Here's the pledge levels you can opt for:

  • $9 Receive one Backup Emergency Wallet in your choice of colour, includes worldwide shipping.
  • $12 Receive two Backup Emergency Wallets in your choice of colours, includes worldwide shipping.
  • $15 Receive three Backup Emergency Wallets in your choice of colours, includes worldwide shipping.
The lead time for production of the first batch is 4-6 weeks so you will receive you Backup Wallets in August.

Risks & Challenges

I have experience in sourcing products from suppliers. I also assisted my best friend launch a wooden watch brand in the UK.  This is my first solo project but I feel I have more than enough experience to turn this prototype into a product and deliver it to you. Should there be any problems I will do my best to reasolve them, and keep anybody who has pledged informed.

story:
Takımın senin desteğine ihtiyacı var!

(English summary at the bottom)

2014 yazında ilk defa bir Türk takımı misafir olarak da olsa Dünya Extreme Sailing Serisinde yarışma imkanı yakaladı.  Bu takım 2011 senesinden bu yana çılgınlar gibi çalışıp bu imkanı yakaladı.  Şimdi de 2015 yarışlarına misafir olarak değil- artık bir yarışmacı olarak katılmak için davet aldı.  2015'in ilk bacağı Singapur'da yarıştı  ama hepimizin desteğine ihtiyacı var.  Singapur yarışlarından ülkemize 3 birincilik getirdi bile!  Umman'da genel klasman da 5. oldu.  Hızlı yükselişi ve gösterdiği üstün gayretten dolayı Land Rover Above and Beyond Ödülünü aldı!

Gel sen de takımın bir parçası ol ve ilk defa bir Türk takımının bu dünya etkinliğinde yer almasına imkan sağla ve şampiyon olmasına destek ol!

Bunun için senden isteğimiz senin gönlüden ne kadar koparsa kopsun, bir bağış takıma destek olman.  Sadece iki dakikanı alacak.  Takımın bizden beklediği önümüzdeki iki yarış için bütçelerine destek olmamız.   
Yandaki rakamları takılmayın, daha azı veya fazlası, gönlünüzden ne koparsa onu verin.  Ya da hediyelerimizden birisini seçin :) 
Senin destek olman, takımın sponsor bulmasına da yardım ediyor- yani vereceğin her bir liranın katkısı aslında o paradan da daha fazla.  Yani bu iki yarışa destek olarak bir sonraki 5 yarışa da yardımcı olmuş oluyorsun.
Takımın senin için ufak ve büyük hediyeleri de var :).  Bağış miktarını seçin takım da hediyelerinden birisi ile size teşekkür etsin.  Eğer farklı bir miktarda bağış yapmak isteseniz, onu da kendin belirleyebilirsiniz
Indiegogo (bu kampanyanın platformu) dünyanın en güvenilir online platformlarından.  Kredi kartınız veya isterseniz paypal hesabınız ile 2 dakikada bağışta bulunabilirsiniz.  İsterseniz isminizi gizli bile tutabilirsiniz.
Bu kampanyanın tüm gelirlerli takımın yarış masraflarına gidecek.

Extreme Sailing yelken sporunun Formula 1'i gibi.  10 kişiden oluşan ekipler İstanbul dahil Dünya'nın 12 şehrinde ekipler 11 ay boyunca yarışıyorlar.   Team TurX oluşturan ve senelerdir özveri ve karşılıksız olarak bugüne hazırlanan ekibi bu linkten tanıyıp onlara destek olabilirsin: Team TurX ekip üyeleri

Bağışının miktarı kadar bağış yapmış olmadan da bizim içn çok önemli.  Neden mi?  Çünkü büyük kurumsal sponsorlar bu rakama bakıyorlar.  Ne kadar çok destekçi olursa büyüklerin desteği de rakam olarak o kadar artıyor.  Yani bağışta bulunarak büyüklerden de bağış toplamamıza yardımcı olacaksın.  Onun için yandaki hediyelerimizden birisini seçip bize destek olman bizim için tahminin de değerli.
Bu para ile takım ne yapacak?  Desteğin takımın antramanlarını, seyahat masraflarını, ve yarışa katılım masraflarını karşılayacak.  Kesinlikle kar için kullanılmayacak.  
Geçen sene misafir olarak bile katıldığında adından çok söz ettiren bu takıma destek olma kararı sana ait.  Senin için ufak bir katkı takım için çok şey farkettirecek.  Geçen senenin yankılarından bazı örnekleri aşağıdaki makalelerde görebilirsin:
Team TurX'ün 2014 medya yankıları
İyi ki varsın!  
Takım olarak beraber çok daha güçlüyüz!
Şimdiden desteğin için teşekkürler!

Biraz daha bilgi?

Extreme Sailing Series nedir?

Yelkenin Formula 1'i olarak tanımlanan uluslararası Extreme Sailing Series (ESS) yarışları senede bir kez yapılmatadır ve 8 ayrı dünya şehrinde toplam 200’den fazla adrenalin dolu yarıştan oluşmaktadır.  Yarışlar, saatte 73 kilometre gibi inanılmaz bir hıza çıkabilen, 'Extreme 40' adı verilen ve iki gövdeden oluşan teknelerle yapılır. 

2015 Yarış Şehirleri ve Tarihleri

Singapur, Singapur (tamamlandı)

Oman, Muscat (tamamlandı)

Qingdao, Çin (Mayıs 1-4)

Cardiff, İngiltere (Haziran 18 – 21)

Hamburg, Almanya (Tem. 23 – 26)

St. Petersburg, Rusya (Ağs. 20 – 23)

İstanbul, Turkiye (Ekim 1 – 4)

Sidney, Avusturalya (Aralık 10 – 13)

Team TurX

İyi ki varsın! 

Takım olarak beraber çok daha güçlüyüz!

Şimdiden desteğin için tekrar teşekkürler!

CNN: Team Turx Umman'da Barış Rüzgarları Estirecek

TurkSail: Team Turx Singapur'a Davet Edildi!


******************************************************
ENGLISH SUMMARY
Donate and be part of a winning team andt help Turkey's first ever Extreme Sailing team to participate in the full 2015 Series.  
In 2014, for the first time ever, a Turkish was invited to participate in the World Extreme Sailing Series as a "guest".  This was the result of months of hard work and practice since 2011.  In 2015, the team was invited to participate in the whole series as a real competitor!  The team delivered 3 wins from the first leg of the race in Singapore and took home Land Rover Above and Beyond Award from Muscat, the second leg along with an overall 5th degree!  We now have 6 more races to go!
And the team needs your support to complete the remainder of the legs.  Your contribution is not only important financially but also in terms of count of individual supporters.  The more supporters we an show (and of course the more money we can raise), the more our chances are with big corporate sponsors.
So please donate....what ever amount you like or one of the set amounts on the right to claim one of our many "thank you gifts".
Want to more about us?  See us on the Extreme Sailing Series homepage:
http://www.extremesailingseries.com/teams/view/...
Thank you in advance!
Your contribution and support means a lot to us!

Team TurX wins Land Rover Above and Beyond Award in Muscat for their spirited performance!

As Series Main Partner to the Extreme Sailing Series™, Land Rover presented the Above and Beyond Award to relative newcomers, Team Turx powered by Kaya Ropes, co-skippered by Edhem Dirvana and Mitch Booth. The team posted six podium positions, one race win and were the third highest point scoring team on the final day. Land Rover’s Global Brand Ambassador, Hannah White, commented, “It’s been a tough venue for the teams, who have been buffeted by strong winds and waves of up to three metres. Showing grit, determination and strength of mind, Team Turx powered by Kaya Ropes was also revealed by SAP Sailing Analytics to be the fastest starting and upwind boat of the Act on average – they’re certainly ones to watch.”
story_txt:
Takımın senin desteğine ihtiyacı var!
(English summary at the bottom)

2014 yazında ilk defa bir Türk takımı misafir olarak da olsa Dünya Extreme Sailing Serisinde yarışma imkanı yakaladı.  Bu takım 2011 senesinden bu yana çılgınlar gibi çalışıp bu imkanı yakaladı.  Şimdi de 2015 yarışlarına misafir olarak değil- artık bir yarışmacı olarak katılmak için davet aldı.  2015'in ilk bacağı Singapur'da yarıştı  ama hepimizin desteğine ihtiyacı var.  Singapur yarışlarından ülkemize 3 birincilik getirdi bile!  Umman'da genel klasman da 5. oldu.  Hızlı yükselişi ve gösterdiği üstün gayretten dolayı Land Rover Above and Beyond Ödülünü aldı!


Gel sen de takımın bir parçası ol ve ilk defa bir Türk takımının bu dünya etkinliğinde yer almasına imkan sağla ve şampiyon olmasına destek ol!

Bunun için senden isteğimiz senin gönlüden ne kadar koparsa kopsun, bir bağış takıma destek olman.  Sadece iki dakikanı alacak.  Takımın bizden beklediği önümüzdeki iki yarış için bütçelerine destek olmamız.   
Yandaki rakamları takılmayın, daha azı veya fazlası, gönlünüzden ne koparsa onu verin.  Ya da hediyelerimizden birisini seçin :) 
Senin destek olman, takımın sponsor bulmasına da yardım ediyor- yani vereceğin her bir liranın katkısı aslında o paradan da daha fazla.  Yani bu iki yarışa destek olarak bir sonraki 5 yarışa da yardımcı olmuş oluyorsun.

Takımın senin için ufak ve büyük hediyeleri de var :).  Bağış miktarını seçin takım da hediyelerinden birisi ile size teşekkür etsin.  Eğer farklı bir miktarda bağış yapmak isteseniz, onu da kendin belirleyebilirsiniz
Indiegogo (bu kampanyanın platformu) dünyanın en güvenilir online platformlarından.  Kredi kartınız veya isterseniz paypal hesabınız ile 2 dakikada bağışta bulunabilirsiniz.  İsterseniz isminizi gizli bile tutabilirsiniz.
Bu kampanyanın tüm gelirlerli takımın yarış masraflarına gidecek.

story:
Whats up with VASTAL?

I run a public life arts school: VASTAL (The Vivoarts School for Transgenic Aesthetics Ltd.) I am really into DIY-BIO, citizen science and Bioart in terms of maker spaces and hacker culture, biopunk and pure, amateur research without the big science aftertaste. VASTAL provides open to the public art and science labs involving: Eco Art, Food Art, Bio Art, Transpecies Art and Body Art. We specialize in hybrid, living, interactive, hands-on, alt-educational, exhibition style biotech-embodied art production labs. VASTAL has been asked to take part in events, think-tanks, exhibitions and advising in Greece and Portugal in the next two months!

Food Art DNA: Hybrid DNA Isolation' / Saturday, 22 Nov 2014, 12 noon,Vodnikov trg. (Ljubljana Food Market), Ljubljana, DEMONSTRACIJA PROJEKTA: 'Izolacija hibridnega DNK'

/ sobota, 22.11.2014, ob 12h Vodnikov trg (ljubljanska tr nica), Ljubljana, Galerija Kapelica


Back Story:

  • My writings about VASTAL public labs focused on an array of legal, ethical, social and libidinal implications of biotechnological and all live art materials and methods. 
  • That kind of insight earned me a Doctorate (I/EAR, RPI, 2012)
  • The Dissertation earned me a book deal at a peer-reviewed university press (PSU Press)
  • In the name of the book deal, I applied for a post-doctoral Research position and I got that too!
  • I am now a Next Nature post-graduate ARA (Advanced Research Associate) and receipient of the ARA I-Node Grant for 2014-2015 of the I-Node of the Planetary Collegium programme and its host Institution – the Ionion Center of Arts and Culture (based on the Island of Cephalonia in Greece.)
  • Besides my utterly limited cash, everything is on course. ;)


Who am I?

I am Adam Zaretsky, Ph.D., a Wet-Lab Art Practitioner mixing Ecology, Biotechnology, Non-human Relations, Body Performance and Gastronomy. I stage lively, hands-on bioart production labs based on topics such as: foreign species invasion (pure/impure), radical food science (edible/inedible), jazz bioinformatics (code/flesh), tissue culture (undead/semi-alive), transgenic design issues (traits/desires), interactive ethology (person/machine/non-human) and physiology (performance/stress).

A former researcher at the MIT department of biology, for the past fifteen years, I have been teaching experimental bioart classes at: San Francisco State University (SFSU), SymbioticA (UWA), Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute (RPI), University of Leiden’s The Arts and Genomic Centre (TAGC), Waag Society, Das Arts, Carnegie Melon University (CMU) and New York University (NYU). I am currently Media Arts Faculty in the School of Communication and the Arts at Marist College. My life is really fun and I like teaching, parenting and taking my art on the road. I like my son to see the world with me too. We have a lot of fun and he learns about international culture, meets smart and diverse people and generally gets to explore.


What do I want to fund?

Primarily, I want to make two important presentations/exhibitions happen:

I have been invited to Greece in April and Portugal in May.

They are both important to my career and the venues are professional, funky and smart:

A: The trip to Greece is a part of my post-doctoral research position requirement. Part of this trip involves poster presentations at the following venues:

•   Ionion Center for the Arts and Culture

•   Art Athina, Athens International Art Fair

The postdoctoral research part of this trip aids in continuance towards development of a fine working draft of my first book for peer-review. Along with the poster session, I will continue fulfilling my professional development as an international post-doctoral research associate by mixing and co-advising graduate and doctoral students from the multimode-multinode gathering of students from: the Swiss, Italian and Greek Nodes of the program. It’s a very cool big deal at an artist’s residency: the Ionion Center for the Arts and Culture on the island of Cephalonia. I would like to offer an art-lab as part of my appreciation of Katerina Karoussos, Director of the I-Node, Planetary Collegium, my host in Cephalonia, Ionion Center for the Arts and Culture and the Director of the whole program, Professor Roy Ascott.

B:

I have been invitated to participate in exhibition in Portugal. This one is curated by Marta de Menezes Graça, Director of Cultivamos Cultura. She is organizing an international exhibition and Conference called for the Spring/Summer of 2015. The exhibition she is organising is primarily devoted to new media in art, with a focus on experimentation and research. Cultivamos Cultura is a nonprofit organization dedicated to the promotion of the creative arts within a local community in the Southwest of Portugal. The main focus is the exploration of new avenues for artistic manifestations, namely new media (with an emphasis in technology) and new discourses. My family is actually invited for three weeks, to develop a new art exhibition and create with an internationally known bunch of bioart literati.

 

Paramecium Alterity : Cheese Method - Performance Document - Unsealed: Sterile Field Inter-Public Body Art Performances, Glovebox Design: Adam Zaretsky and Mason Juday, Performance Artists Curated by Adam Zaretsky and Marije Jannsen, Performance artists: Kira O’Reilly,  WARBEAR,  Jeanette Groenendaal,  Zoot Derks,  Boryana Rossa,  Oleg Mavromatti,  Sarah Hamilton,  Jennifer Willet, Adam Zaretsky, bionihil and giuliana videopirate, Theatrum Anatomicum at the Waag and Bouwkeet van Stedelijk Museum, Amsterdam, The Netherlands, 2009

Why do I need to ask for money? 

Along with exhibition, the trips are built to develop a fine working draft of my first book for peer-review and continue the international post-doctoral research associate position. The goals are worthwhile. Here is the crux of it. Both the book and the research position are affiliated with Universities, but both projects are not funded. In fact, the postdoc charges tuition and I pay for airfare. The postdoc is low residency and it allows you to keep your job but it does not pay. I did receive a grant that made my tuition significantly lower for which I am thankful. I certainly am not fluid enough to do all of the above without some help. Both scenarios are important to my career and the venues and company engaged are professional, fun and personal. So, I am turning to crowd funding to make it all happen. 

G®FRP: The GloFish® Freedom and Reconciliation Project, Adam Zaretsky, TDR: The Drama Review Provocation 54:4 (T208) Winter 2010. New York University and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, pg. 2-3 : G®FRP: The GloFish®Freedom and Reconciliation Project, Multispecies: Swarm, in New Orleans & Certified Copy at the Verbeke Foundation, Belgium 2010

 How much will it cost?

The trip for Greece is planned to leave for Greece April 17th and return May 2nd. In order to be able to attend, I need to pay my tuition for the year. Tuition is due in April and should be covered for the year. The cost of tuition about $5000.00 (minimum amount due this session is $3000) It costs $2000-$3000 in airfare round-trip from New York to Athens-Cephalonia (for myself and my son and perhaps a friend to care for him when I am in postdoctoral advising sessions.) If I want to offer a lab or two, I should provide my own materials and some documentation. I like healthy exorbidance in my labs and a nice production value. I am sure the Ionion Center for the Arts and Culture would be able to raise some funds but this is a gift world culture and I would like to thank my hosts by sponsoring something for them too! One of my labs can be had produced handily for $1110.00. There is also all the extraneous costs: transportation, food, toiletries, etc. So, I have asked for $11110.00 to make it all happen.

Solar Zebrafish: Green Summer, Verbeke Foundation, Belgium, 2010

What happens if VASTAL reaches our goal and then more money comes in?

 Well, I do need to take my time and write in July and August. The book needs effort and when I am off from work is the best time to make big leaps. I also have an offer to run a summer VASTAL residency in the Catskills (New York State country, two hours north of Manhattan) in collaboration with Grace Exhibition Space, Body Art and Performance Space and funky involved folk. That could be a wild sleep away camp! I would also like to get two of my major artworks (the VASTAL Virginarium and the Errorarium shipped to the US for further use and experimentation. If this works I may startup a more permanent version of VASTAL. I am considering forming a biotech company for artist researchers only. Perhaps with a street level clinic for medical tourism, psychic fertility etc. I suppose time will tell. The future looks favorable and even bold. Lets just see if we can get our shows!

What if I don’t reach my goal?

Well, nothing is perfect. Leonard Cohen says, “there is a Crack in everything, that’s How the light gets IN!” If there is enough money to pay tuition and fly to Greece, I will continue my ARA post doc with the Planetary Collegium. If there is only enough money to go to Portugal, then that is what I will do. On the other hand, I am optimistic in general, sometimes to a fault! Life goes on and all will be well. I just think these projects are worth making happen.

 

08.01.2015 | GMOs on display The use of genetically modified organisms in exhibitions (CGM/141219-01)

http://www.cogem.net/index.cfm/en/publications/publicatie/gmos-on-display-the-use-of-genetically-modified-organisms-in-exhibition

The Netherlands Commission on Genetic Modification (COGEM) was asked by the Ministry of Infrastructure and the Environment (IenM) to prepare a report on the societal or public interest aspects of exhibitions involving the use of GMOs.

My application and much more is HERE

The reason for this study was a permit application for an exhibition involving zebra fish embryos which would be injected with genetically-modified (GM) cyanobacteria (blue-green algae). In dealing with this request it became clear that the present assessment framework has no provision for exhibitions. There is a trend in art in which biological (living) materials are used, treated and exhibited. Government, risk assessors, artists and the general public hold differing views about the desirability and admissibility of such activities. The differences make it clear that there is a clash between the technological possibilities and how public opinion is formed. The use of higher order organisms and genetic modification without a primarily scientific goal would appear to heighten the discussion.

COGEM notes that most applications of GMOs and organisms in exhibitions are covered by the existing regulatory framework. COGEM observes that certain niche applications of BioArt, specifically combinations of GMOs with embryos, however, are covered only by the GMO legislation. As a consequence, objections or a general sense of public unease could arise in society.

This report is about the use of genetic modification in BioArt: the altering of genetic material in microorganisms, plants and animals or combinations of these in exhibitions. It sets out the various elements involved in the use of GMOs in exhibitions.

Download publications

· Topic report CGM/141219-01

DIYsect. A series about the 

DIY Biology & Biology-Art 

intersection releases chapter 

3: Fear of the Unknown 

today. 


The article/review by Regine of We-Make-Money-Not-Art (wmmna.com) is HERE.  


A short excerpt:

Things are gettng tricky with episode 3. Fear of the Unknown which should is out on vimeo as of today!

The episode delves into the discussions surrounding synthetic biology. On the one hand, a project like the Kickstarter-funded Glowing Plant is creating controversy by bringing synthetic biology to the consumer market in the form of a plant that glows in the dark. Its developers' rhetoric is fairly unconvincing (at least as far as i am concerned.) On the other hand, the technology watchdog group ETC. Its members fear the lack of regulation (the plant doesn't require any form of approval in the U.S. since it is not food) and the potentially damaging impact that the release of the plant might have on the environment. Somewhere in the middle is artistAdam Zaretsky who has long used his provocative performances to try and raise a broader debate about what is ethical or not in the field of synthetic biology. There's this great moment in the film when he explains that we don't really know what we are doing and that we need to stop and think before we 'fuck up our world' beyond human control.

On a side note, i believe we need to see more of Zaretsky's provocations and reflections here in Europe, so let's help him fund his next trip to the old continent. 

What Ben and Mary Have to say about their latest chapter: 

The third episode of the DIYSECT web-series highlights discussions surrounding the emerging field of transgenics, and the artist and scientists who are provoking them.  Synthetic Biology is making its way into the consumer market, evidenced by the Kickstarter-funded Glowing Plants project. This has created a backlash with technology watchdog groups like the ETC, who fear its release will have damaging effects on the environment. The episode also features artist Adam Zaretsky who uses performance to push the boundaries on what is commonly perceived as frightening and disgusting to the public in biotechnological advancements. His work takes advantage of its controversial nature to propel a wider discussion on what is ethical in the field of synthetic biology. The episode also looks at the public’s relationship with genetically modified organisms, and how corporate manipulation has created general mistrust in the public sphere.

I stage lively, hands-on bioart production labs based on topics such as: foreign species invasion (pure/impure), radical food science (edible/inedible), jazz bioinformatics (code/flesh), tissue culture (undead/semi-alive), transgenic design issues (traits/desires), interactive ethology (person/machine/non-human) and physiology (performance/stress).

I am currently Media Arts Faculty in the School of Communication and the
Arts at Marist College. My life is really fun and I like
teaching, parenting and taking my art on the road. I like my son to see the
world with me too. We have a lot of fun and he learns about international
culture, meets smart and diverse people and generally gets to explore.



What do I
want to fund?
Primarily,
I want to make two important presentations/exhibitions happen:
I have been invited to Greece in April and Portugal in May. 
They are both important to my career and
the venues are professional, funky and smart:
A: The trip to Greece is a part
of my post-doctoral research position requirement. Part of this trip involves
poster presentations at the following venues:
•   Ionion Center for the Arts and
Culture
•   Art Athina, Athens International Art
Fair
The postdoctoral research part of this trip aids in continuance
towards development of a fine working draft of my first book for peer-review.
Along with the poster session, I will continue fulfilling my professional
development as an international post-doctoral research associate by mixing and
co-advising graduate and doctoral students from the multimode-multinode
gathering of students from: the Swiss, Italian and Greek Nodes of the program.
It’s a very cool big deal at an artist’s residency: the Ionion Center for the Arts and Culture on the island of Cephalonia. I would like to offer an
art-lab as part of my appreciation of Katerina Karoussos, Director of the
I-Node, Planetary Collegium, my host in Cephalonia, Ionion Center for the Arts
and Culture and the Director of the whole program, Professor Roy Ascott.
B: 
I have been invitated to participate in exhibition in Portugal. This one
is curated by Marta de Menezes Graça, Director of Cultivamos Cultura. She is organizing an
international exhibition and Conference called for the Spring/Summer
of 2015. The exhibition she is organising is primarily devoted to new media in
art, with a focus on experimentation and research. Cultivamos Cultura is a
nonprofit organization dedicated to the
promotion of the creative arts within a local community in the Southwest of
Portugal. The main focus is the exploration of new avenues for artistic
manifestations, namely new media (with an emphasis in technology) and new
discourses. My family is actually invited for three weeks, to develop a new art exhibition
and create with an internationally known bunch of bioart literati. 
 


Paramecium Alterity
: Cheese Method - Performance Document - Unsealed: Sterile Field Inter-Public
Body Art Performances, Glovebox Design: Adam Zaretsky and Mason Juday,
Performance Artists Curated by Adam Zaretsky and Marije Jannsen, Performance
artists: Kira O’Reilly,  WARBEAR,  Jeanette Groenendaal,  Zoot Derks,  Boryana
Rossa,  Oleg Mavromatti,  Sarah Hamilton,  Jennifer Willet, Adam Zaretsky,
bionihil and giuliana videopirate,
Theatrum Anatomicum at the Waag
and Bouwkeet van Stedelijk Museum, Amsterdam, The Netherlands, 2009



Why do I
need to ask for money? 

Along with exhibition, the trips are built to develop a fine working draft of my first book for peer-review and continue the international post-doctoral research associate position. The goals are worthwhile. Here is the crux of it. Both the book and the research position
are affiliated with Universities, but both projects are not funded. In fact,
the postdoc charges tuition and I pay for airfare. The postdoc is low residency
and it allows you to keep your job but it does not pay. I did receive a grant
that made my tuition significantly lower for which I am thankful. I
certainly am not fluid enough to do all of the above without some help. Both scenarios
are important to my career and the venues and company engaged are professional, fun and personal. So, I am turning to crowd funding to make it all happen. 



G®FRP: The GloFish® Freedom and Reconciliation
Project, Adam Zaretsky, TDR: The Drama Review Provocation 54:4 (T208) Winter 2010. New
York University and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, pg. 2-3 : G®FRP: The GloFish®Freedom and Reconciliation Project, Multispecies: Swarm, in New
Orleans & Certified Copy at the Verbeke
Foundation, Belgium 2010
 How much
will it cost?
The trip for Greece is planned to leave for Greece April 17th
and return May 2nd. In order to be able to attend, I need to pay my
tuition for the year. Tuition is due in April and should be covered for the
year. The cost of tuition about $5000.00 (minimum amount due this session is
$3000) It costs $2000-$3000 in airfare round-trip from New York to
Athens-Cephalonia (for myself and my son and perhaps a friend to care for him
when I am in postdoctoral advising sessions.) If I want to offer a lab or two,
I should provide my own materials and some documentation. I like healthy exorbidance
in my labs and a nice production value. I am sure the Ionion Center
for the Arts and Culture would be able to raise some funds but this is a gift
world culture and I would like to thank my hosts by sponsoring something for
them too! One of my labs can be had produced handily for $1110.00. There is also all
the extraneous costs: transportation, food, toiletries, etc. So, I have asked
for $11110.00 to make it all happen.



Solar Zebrafish: Green
Summer, Verbeke Foundation, Belgium, 2010
What
happens if VASTAL reaches our goal and then more money comes in?
 Well, I do need to take my time and write in July and August.
The book needs effort and when I am off from work is the best time to make big
leaps. I also have an offer to run a summer VASTAL residency in the Catskills (New York
State country, two hours north of Manhattan) in collaboration with Grace Exhibition
Space, Body Art and Performance Space and funky involved folk. That could be a
wild sleep away camp! I would also like to get two of my major artworks (the
VASTAL Virginarium and the Errorarium shipped to the US for further use and
experimentation. If this works I may startup a more permanent version of
VASTAL. I am considering forming a biotech company for artist researchers only. Perhaps with a street level clinic for medical tourism, psychic fertility etc. I suppose time will tell. The future looks favorable and even bold.
Lets just see if we can get our shows!


What if I don’t reach my goal?
Well, nothing is perfect. Leonard Cohen says, “there is a
Crack in everything, that’s How the light gets IN!” If there is enough money to
pay tuition and fly to Greece, I will continue my ARA post doc with the
Planetary Collegium. If there is only enough money to go to Portugal, then that is what I will do. On the other hand, I am optimistic in
general, sometimes to a fault! Life goes on and all will be well. I just think
these projects are worth making happen.

 
08.01.2015 | GMOs on display The use of genetically modified organisms in exhibitions (CGM/141219-01)
http://www.cogem.net/index.cfm/en/publications/publicatie/gmos-on-display-the-use-of-genetically-modified-organisms-in-exhibition
The Netherlands Commission on Genetic Modification (COGEM) was asked by the Ministry of Infrastructure and the Environment (IenM) to prepare a report on the societal or public interest aspects of exhibitions involving the use of GMOs.
My application and much more is HERE
The reason for this study was a permit application for an exhibition involving zebra fish embryos which would be injected with genetically-modified (GM) cyanobacteria (blue-green algae). In dealing with this request it became clear that the present assessment framework has no provision for exhibitions. There is a trend in art in which biological (living) materials are used, treated and exhibited. Government, risk assessors, artists and the general public hold differing views about the desirability and admissibility of such activities. The differences make it clear that there is a clash between the technological possibilities and how public opinion is formed. The use of higher order organisms and genetic modification without a primarily scientific goal would appear to heighten the discussion.
COGEM notes that most applications of GMOs and organisms in exhibitions are covered by the existing regulatory framework. COGEM observes that certain niche applications of BioArt, specifically combinations of GMOs with embryos, however, are covered only by the GMO legislation. As a consequence, objections or a general sense of public unease could arise in society.

This report is about the use of genetic modification in BioArt: the altering of genetic material in microorganisms, plants and animals or combinations of these in exhibitions. It sets out the various elements involved in the use of GMOs in exhibitions.
Download publications
· Topic report CGM/141219-01

DIYsect. A series about the 

DIY Biology & Biology-Art 
intersection releases chapter 
3: Fear of the Unknown 
today. 

The article/review by Regine of We-Make-Money-Not-Art (wmmna.com) is HERE.  

A short excerpt:
Things are gettng tricky with episode 3. Fear of the Unknown which should is out on vimeo as of today!
The episode delves into the discussions surrounding synthetic biology. On the one hand, a project like the Kickstarter-funded Glowing Plant is creating controversy by bringing synthetic biology to the consumer market in the form of a plant that glows in the dark. Its developers' rhetoric is fairly unconvincing (at least as far as i am concerned.) On the other hand, the technology watchdog group ETC. Its members fear the lack of regulation (the plant doesn't require any form of approval in the U.S. since it is not food) and the potentially damaging impact that the release of the plant might have on the environment. Somewhere in the middle is artistAdam Zaretsky who has long used his provocative performances to try and raise a broader debate about what is ethical or not in the field of synthetic biology. There's this great moment in the film when he explains that we don't really know what we are doing and that we need to stop and think before we 'fuck up our world' beyond human control.
On a side note, i believe we need to see more of Zaretsky's provocations and reflections here in Europe, so let's help him fund his next trip to the old continent. 
What Ben and Mary Have to say about their latest chapter: The third episode of the DIYSECT web-series highlights discussions surrounding the emerging field of transgenics, and the artist and scientists who are provoking them.  Synthetic Biology is making its way into the consumer market, evidenced by the Kickstarter-funded Glowing Plants project. This has created a backlash with technology watchdog groups like the ETC, who fear its release will have damaging effects on the environment. The episode also features artist Adam Zaretsky who uses performance to push the boundaries on what is commonly perceived as frightening and disgusting to the public in biotechnological advancements. His work takes advantage of its controversial nature to propel a wider discussion on what is ethical in the field of synthetic biology. The episode also looks at the public’s relationship with genetically modified organisms, and how corporate manipulation has created general mistrust in the public sphere.

story:
The Camkart came into being about 8 years ago when I was running a wildlife rescue centre in the Rainforest in Panama.  I spent a lot of my time in the firest and the mountains and plains and found it very difficult to carry the equipment I needed for any length of time.  (This is a problem many photographers face).

I developed the original Camkart using bits and pieces that were available and upon my return to the U.k. modified it and refined it to what it is today. You will see me in the video but what you cannot see is that the whole thing weighs 24kgs (54lbs) with the equipment I have in it, and yet it requires very little effort to pull it around.  It actually only takes 6kgs of effort to pull it up a 30 degree muddy slope.


The new model, which is now fully designed and shown here digitally, is all integral which makes it very strong and more compact than the original model.  It is stronger, more versatile and is even available in a range of colours. 

I am sure it will appeal to all photographers, bird watchers and others engaged in outdoor pursuits who need to carry a lot of heavy equipment over all sorts of terrain. It is also ideal for city based photographers because the front castors make easier to wheel around than a childs buggy. 


The plate on the handle means that a camera can be mounted here, which is especially useful for where tripods are not allowed.. And in situations where you need to be above the crowd, lock the castors and stand on it!!


Another great advantage is speed. You dont need to get your kit out of your backpack to change lenses. Just open the lid (which also acts as a shelf) take out your camera and shoot. Put it back and move on  - it's as easy as that.


YOU might not need one but please tell your friends and share the info, videos and FB page.  This great innovation can also be used by Fishermen, Engineers, Equestrian Grooms etc. Dog trainers, Campers,  Rock collectors and so on. 

IT'S A GREAT AND UNIQUE PRODUCT AND WILL BE MADE IN THE U.K INITIALLY AND THEN FOR THE NORTH AMERICAN MARKET, UNDER LICENCE THERE.

                                                       BULLET POINTS

THE UNIQUE CAMKART ALL TERRAIN  LET THE WHEELS TAKE THE STRAIN

*The Ultimate all terrain equipment trolley has been designed by a working photographer and trialled in 3 continents over 6 years.

*Easier and more accessible than a backpack, slingbag, roller case or shoulder bag.

*Carries all your equipment with ease. No strain on your neck, back or arms, the wheels take the weight. (Typically only 6kgs on a 30 degree up slope)

*All terrain, large PUNCTURE proof wheels will go virtually anywhere. Smaller locking castors at the front mean it can be wheeled as easily as a baby buggy on flat ground or indoors.

*Instant access to all your gear. No need to get it off your back and lay it on the ground, unzip it and then put it all back on again!

*Strong enough to sit or stand on.

*Has a built in camera mounting plate that takes a ball head, great for using where tripods are not allowed.

*Has a special bracket on the back to carry a tripod, umbrella, walking poles or monopod, or ALL of them!

*No danger to YOU or your equipment if you fall over!

*Great for all outdoor pursuits; PHOTOGRAPHY, VIDEOGRAPHY,  BIRDWATCHING, FISHING, EQUESTRIAN, DOG TRAINING ETC

CAMKARTS GIVE YOU THE FREEDOM TO REALLY ENJOY YOUR HOBBY

story:
Fire Damaged Campground Reopening

This campground was closed several years ago after a fire destroyed the bathhouse and main building. We purchased this campground with the goal to reopen it and improve it so families can make lasting memories. We have put everything we had into purchasing this park and now just need some help to rebuild and open it.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • All funds raised will go to rebuilding the damaged buildings and the years of neglect to the grounds and swimming pool.
  • We have set up some cool perks for our backers!
  • Every penny helps

The Impact

 

  • Not only will backing this campaign help the campground but it will also help the surrounding community by bring back tourist to the area.
  • We are a firm believer in the trickle down effect and our guest will spend money at local shops, restaurants, farms, and more.
  • We have plans for some nice new buildings that will make this park look great. This will truly be one of the nicest campgrounds around.

Idea of new office.

Risks & Challenges

 

  • One challenge is not getting funded to open by April 2018
  • To over come this we will run a crowdfunding campaign to make up the difference.

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • Tell the world!
  • Used share tools!
  • Volunteer for our clean up weekends

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Performance highlights

This qualities combined make the Talent Jogger ideal for all styles and occasions.

 

Australian Merino wool is regarded as the finest and softest wool in the world.

The natural benefits unique to merino wool are not found in any other fiber - natural or artificial.

 

Merino wool has long been utilized in winter coats, fine scarves, and winter gloves. Now, we have applied this amazing natural, renewable material to footwear to create the most stylish and comfortable footwear experience with cutting-edge technologies.

 

With our meticulous selection process, the wool fiber sheared from one merino sheep only produces enough finished product for four pairs of Talent Joggers. We strike to put our best efforts toward sourcing the absolutely finest raw materials , combined with over-engineered components,  finding the perfect balance between style and utility, this is Talent Jogger.

 

Pure, supple Merino Wool covers every inch of your feet. For ultimate comfort the entire lining, including both sides of the vamp are covered with woven wool, surrounding your feet in unbelievable comfort. It’s like walking on a cloud.

 

 'Feet-on' Review by Unbox Fantasy 

It feels terrible when your feet get wet on a rainy day. Forget your worries with TALENT JOGGER. They easily repel water splashes thanks to the  ”Teflon non-fluorinated stain and water-based stain repellent technology.” while still maintaining breathability. 

 

Besides, thanks to more than 100 curves on every inch of Merino wool, the wool upper effectively wraps your feet with premium wool sweater material during times of cold. Your feet stay dry and warm even without socks.

 

Say goodbye to heavy bulky boots. On top of keeping your feet and ankles warm, we are committed to developing a product that lets every user defy gravity, instilling TALENT JOGGER with a dozen high-tech components that provide comfy support without a heavy burden.  

 

Three major innovations make our shoes unbelievably lightweight-----only 8 ounces

 

1. Cooperating with Ortholite®, the world-renowned insole manufacturer, we designed a dual-layer insole - The top side that touches your feet is Merino wool and the bottom layer is full of air pockets that support your feet with a lightweight structure.

 

2. Talent Jogger uses ultra-lightweight, rubberized EVA for its outsole compound. 

 

A unibody construction such as this, provides both excellent abrasion performance and running-shoe elasticity.

 

3. Our original Hive-Impact™ outsole construction is the core innovation occupying the rear 2/3rds of the outsoles. 

 

With hexagon cavities, this design reduces even more weight from our insoles.

 

When combined, these innovations greatly reduce the weight of the overall shoe while still providing comfortable, all-day support. A pair of Talent Joggers is on average, 15% lighter than a typical pair of wool sneakers.

 

A pair of Talent Joggers is on average, 15% lighter than a typical pair of wool sneakers.

 

According to our ergonomics research, the proprietary Hive-Impact™ technology makes the rear 2/3rds of the outsole considerably more stable and structurally more rigid, while retaining the flexibility of the forefoot section.

 

The hexagon structure also supports your feet better than a traditional solid outsole when you walk, or even during jogging. 

In general, with our cutting-edge technologies, Talent Jogger can keep strong support for at least 18 months.

 

Merino wool is prized for footwear because it naturally wicks away moisture while remaining breathable. It continuously absorbs small amounts of liquid into its fibers, then wicking moisture away through small openings in the woven fabric.

 

 This results in a shoe that is never too hot, eliminating perspiration build up and leaving your feet dry and comfortable.

 

The unique open-cell structure of Ortholite® foam creates a moisture management system, helping to remove moisture and provide a cooler, drier, healthier environment. It also contains active anti-microbial agents to prevent fungi from growing inside your shoes.

 

Talent Jogger are the ultimate in comfort for bare feet.

 

Merino wool is easy to care for. Talent Joggers may be cleaned in your washing machine and air dried.  (Shoelaces and insoles are still recommended to wash by hand separately)

 

Sustainability is part of our mission.

1. Merino wool can be fully recycled and is often reused as material for carpets.

2. Ortholite® uses recycled rubber in every pair of insoles, and bio-oil from castor beans which reduces the need for petroleum-based ingredients in insoles.

 

Take a closer look at some other details

· Latex-free, elastic holding straps on the shoe tongue

· 3M® reflective tape heel-loop

· Eyelets with custom computerized embroidery

and parts that are inside the shoes

· Heel counter with recyclable TPU insert

· Long-lasting PU collar foam (from premium sports bras)

 

Ideal for All Styles and Occasions

Choose a color you love

 

Be our super early bird to save up to 65% against our manufacturer suggested retail rice. You will also get 2 pairs of Talent Jogger socks worthing $8/pair! with rewards of double-pair early birds.

Detail makes perfect
and parts that are inside the shoes
