· Long-lasting PU collar foam (from premium sports bras) Ideal for All Styles and Occasions

Choose a color you love



 
Be our super early bird to save up to 65% against our manufacturer suggested retail rice. You will also get 2 pairs of Talent Jogger socks worthing $8/pair! with rewards of double-pair early birds.

story:
For the past twelve years a small team of British boatbuilders have been working in the relative secrecy of the Devonshire countryside on the project of a lifetime. Headed up by Mike Ludgrove, the group's combined labour of over 40 years has brought the construction of the project, Helena, to near completion. A 60ft classic yacht due to be launched in spring 2018.

As the date for her launch draws ever closer, we now look for assistance from backers to make the final step from workshop to water possible.  In return we'd like to offer you the opportunity to step aboard and set sail with us upon her maiden voyage.

We are offering a range of sailing experiences from one day coastal hops in the South West of England to charters in the French Riviera, the Mediterannean and even Christmas in the Caribbean!

As a boy Mike was given the chance to sail with the London Sailing Project, a charitable organisation which allows underpriviliged young people the opportunity to experience an adventure at sea. This formative experience remained with Mike through several non nautical related endeavours in his early adult life until he was in a position to embark upon creating his dream. As homage to this early inspiration, Helena will be used in the same spirit, to help and inspire young people who would not ordinarily get the chance to do such a thing.

In order to get Helena in the water we need your pledge; with this contribution we can procure over 2,500 sqft of canvas and an expert sailmaker. These sails will harness the power of the wind, withstanding loads of up to 30 tons, powering Helena to any destination in the world.

The funds will also be used to transport Helena to the waters edge and crane her in, cover the cost of creating the upholstery and furthermore, provide her with a bank of batteries to power the onboard systems such as navigational equipment, water desalinator, lighting and entertainment. What remains of £80,000 after these things have been paid for will cover mooring fees while system tests and sea trials are carried out to ensure that everything is working smoothly.

Then comes the best part. When these tasks are complete you'll be invited to come aboard, join us for a drink or two at one of our cocktail parties, bring a friend along and we'll show you around Helena, the project you helped to complete. Or for a sail, whether you choose to keep it local, taking a hop along the Devon and Cornwall coast, or joining us somewhere a little more exotic.

Corporate Daysail  is a tailored package aimed at staff groups/ businesses for team building or one day holiday/ adventure experience and is priced for the entire boat for a group of up to 8 people with Champagne reception and 3 course dinner included. The day will begin when you and your team are welcomed aboard with a champagne reception at the recently redeveloped Royal William Yard in Plymouth. This spectacular historic naval yard is the perfect place from which to set off on an afternoon sail around the natural harbour of Plymouth Sound wich offers a beautiful but sheltered location for those who have not earned their sea legs. Your group will be active participants in crewing Helena; under expert supervision you will be shown some basic navigation, how to sheet in the sails and even get your hands on the wheel. As the sun begins to set, you will return for dinner to the William Yard which boasts a selection of great bars and restaurants. For sample menu please click link, https://bistrotpierre.co.uk/menus/soiree-gastro...

Day trips, 3 and 6 Day Charters aboard are also on offer around some of the world's most desireable yachting locations such as the Balearics, French Riviera and Corsica. Antigua, Barbuda and St Kitts depending on which side of the Atlantic you prefer. A 3 Day Charter gives you three days of cruising your chosen area within either the Mediterannean or the Caribbean with two nights onboard, lounging on deck or taking a mask and snorkel to discover the local wildlife.  Breakfast and lunch will be brought onboard each day fresh from local markets and after a day of exploration you will be delivered ashore for a stroll around and to have dinner at a restaurant of your choice. Then, at your leisure, return to Helena for a night's rest, ready to begin again in the morning. 3 and 6 Day Charters are subject to four people booking.

 

WHERE AND WHEN

 

Balearic Isles  Majorca, Menorca, Ibiza and Formentera

May to June 2018 inclusive. Please let us know your preferred dates by clicking  Ask A Question at the top right of the page. 

Airport  Palma de Majorca

Transfer between airport and yacht is inclusive.

There are many flights to Palma with Ryan Air, Easy Jet and British Airways

 

 

French & Italian Rivieras  Nice, Genova and the magnificent sweep of the Ligurian coastline and epicurean harbours in between. 

July to August 2018 inclusive  Please let us know your preferred dates by clicking  Ask A Question at the top right of the page.  

Airport  Nice

Transfer between airport and yacht is inclusive.

There are many flights to Nice with Ryan Air, Easy Jet and British Airways

 

 

Caribbean Cruises

Antigua, Barbuda & St Kitts Nevis Sailing, dining and snorkeling in the spectacular coral coves of the Central Leeward Islands.

December 2018 to April 2019 inclusive  Please let us know your preferred dates by clicking  Ask A Question at the top right of the page.   

Airport St John's International Antigua

Transfer between airport and yacht is inclusive.

There are regular direct flights with British Airways and Virgin Atlantic to Antigua

 

Christmas in the Caribbean will be hosted from Sunday the 24th December until Wednesday 27th December 2018 providing 3 nights accommodation on board. Join us at St. John's, Antigua for a Champagne and Lobster brunch then enjoy an afternoon of leisurely cruising. Dinner in the evening will be at a restaurant of your choosing, then return to Helena for a nights rest with Christmas breakfast being served on board the next morning. Then out for a cruise again to find the perfect spot to lay up, cool off in the sea, have some cocktails and enjoy an amazing traditional Caribbean Christmas lunch onboard. This trip is for four people inclusive.

 

A few things to note about sailing trips:

If you are making a pledge for a Mediterannean trip, please specify your chosen cruising ground (Ballearics, French and Italian Riviera). All our trips will be navigated by a fully qualified skipper and lifejackets will be provided so you'll be in safe, experienced hands. Day trips will sail in groups of 8 passengers, this means that if, for example, you book for you and a friend, you will sail with 6 other people plus crew. Three and six day cruises get you the whole boat, so you can either come on your own or bring up to 3 guests included in the price of the pledge.

Please note ; flights are not included in any of the above prices.

 

Further Information

​Please feel free to contact us if you have any questions, we are more than happy to hear from you and will do our best to answer any queries. A full specification relating to Helena's dimensions and build will be incorporated into this space soon, but anyone requiring earlier sight of these please contact us through Indiegogo using the Ask A Question button top right. 

 

But don't be disheartened if these trips are not an option for you, we understand it's a lot of money. So we've created a range of perks that are more affordable but still intimately linked to Helena:

Help A Young Person

The Helena Bursary 

Float Helena has teamed up with The Cirdan Sailing Trust to form the float Helena Bursary. Choosing this perk will enable a young person to experience the exhilaration of sailing a large vessel. As I know from my own experience this can be a life changing event. Help change someones life today!

Tote bag and the A3 Sail Plan both display a copy of the actual sail plan drawing used in her construction. Drawn by the late Ed burnett, a world renowned naval architect, Helena will be the last of his engineering projects to reach the water.

Tea & Tour enables you to get to see Helena close up while she is stationary in the water. Come onboard for a tour and a chat with Mike.

Fayum Portrait of Helen of Troy rests on Helena's midship bulkhead bringing a sense of calm occupation to the saloon. Painted by Mike's wife Elaine the portrait will be reproduced as a 40 x 30cm Gicle print to bring the same serenity to your room.

Come visit our workshop for a tour around this unique project. Lead by Mike, you will get an in depth explaination of the story behind Helena, not only the construction but also the personal motives behind such an undertaking. Having made and overseen every step of design and construction Mike will give you insights and anecdotes that few others could and answer any questions you might have. This will be rounded off with an informal chat over tea and cake.

Skype Consultation gets you a 90 minute chat with Mike who's 20 years in boat construction qualifies him to help you with any project you may need advice on. Whether its your strip plank canoe, your fibreglass/foam sandwich racing dinghy or something much larger, this time will undoubtedly prove invaluable in helping you overcome whichever obstacles there are or simply provide insights you may not have come accross.

Onboard Cocktail Party! As swanky as it sounds. A pledge made for this perk gets you and a friend onboard with canapés and a cocktail each on us at one of our evening events. There will be a cash bar, entertainment and a lot of boat chat. Please, no heeled shoes/ stilettos as they damage the deck.

Each sailing trip pledge you make (excluding early bird pledges), we will match; after Helena has fulfilled all pledges made on Indiegogo she will begin to take underpriviledged young people out on sailing trips to experience something that they would not normally be able to attain. Growing up in a deprived area in the south of London in 1950's post war Britain, it was just such an experience that gave Mike the purpose that he found and lead him to where he stands today. This means that your pledge goes further than others might; it puts Helena in the water and helps realise a man's life long vision, it gives you an amazing adventure you won't forget and it affords someone else a life changing experience they would otherwise not have.

This is a unique crowdfunding opportunity in that Helena is not a promise or an intention, she is not in committee stages or even prototyping, she is finished. Though the appendages that are needed are essential, her construction is complete. You too can see her now, stand beneath her elegant prow and walk at ground level the length of her hull as she rises in her cradle 16 feet above. You can climb the ladder and walk stern to bow on her swept teak deck as we do every day, go below and see the galley, the nav station and the ample saloon, all with cheerfully light, solid maple cabinetry. Helena will reach the water one way or another; if we don't reach our goal we will explore investment partnerships. With this in mind we chose to go the route of flexible funding because whatever is raised will help and all pledges will be fulfilled. This represents an immensly exciting time for Mike and his family and we hope to share something of our efforts with you too. If you are unable to contribute financially, don't walk away just yet! You can still help by telling your friends and family, every mention of this project is useful too so please talk, text, tweet, instagram and email. All exposure helps to get Helena to where she wants to be and we are immensely grateful that you have taken the time to read about this project and any time you put into helping out.

Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

After traveling to many campground across the country I found most campgrounds are ill-equipped to handle special needs guest. After many conversations with families dealing with a disabled loved one I often heard that same stories of how they would love to take the family camping but would be impossible do to the lack of true handicap accessible campgrounds. Hearing this broke my heart so I decided to do something about it. With the help of my fiancee, family, friends, and great people like you I can make this campground come true for so many people!

About me

I grew up around kids and later in life turned this passion into a career working as a nanny for many wonderful children. Now in life I want to work with more children giving them and their families and place where they can come and have fun and make great memories!

What We Need & What You Get

Here are the perks for our great backers!

 

$25.00  Will be listed in our donation book that will be on display at the reservation desk. One night free camping certificate to be used at anytime. This excludes cabin.

 

$100.00  Will be listed in our donation book that will be on display at the reservation desk. One weekend free of camping certificate to be used at anytime. This excludes cabin.

 

$1,000.00  Will be listed in our donation book that will be on display at the reservation desk. Will have a name plaque in our Hall of Fame. One weekend free of camping per year for life certificate to be used at anytime. This excludes cabin.

 

$15,000.00 will be listed in our donation book that will be on display at the reservation desk. Will have a name plaque in our Hall of Fame. One week free of camping per year for life certificate to be used at anytime.

* free camping certificate is for full hook-up RV sites. This excludes cabin.

The Impact

So many families will benefit from this one of a kind campground. 

  • This campground could precedent on how campgrounds handle special needs.
  • As we grow I would like to set up a work experience program for high school and college students they will help them in their studies.
  • This will be a a place that is truly for everyone regardless of disability

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge will be raising enough money to purchase everything this park will need.

  • I know there are good people out there that want to be part of such a unique project

  • If I fail to open all money raised will be donated to several charities!

Other Ways You Can Help

I know not everyone has the means to help so I have other ways you can help!

  • Help spread the word about this campaign
  • Send me your ideas and experiences 
  • When park opens, volunteer your time

story:
We're Ready to Expand The Sea Monkey!

Hi! We're Ryan and Stacy, and we moved to Isla Bastimentos to found The Sea Monkey in August of 2014. A lot of people dream of quitting their jobs, moving to a tropical island, and opening their own bed and breakfast, and we did it!
 
While we both had several years of experience in the hospitality industry, we were complete newbies when it came to construction and to operating a business overseas. The learning curve was steep and there were challenges along the way, but we've built two overwater bungalows and founded one of the top-rated restaurants on the island.
 
In the process, we've learned the ins and outs of local construction and of operating a business here in Panama. We now find ourselves in the enviable position of having more demand than we can accommodate, so we're ready to build three new, loft-style overwater suites, starting with the first unit, which you can see on the right in the architectural drawing below.
 
And, because we already have two bungalows, we're ready to start delivering perks to our backers now! Claim your fully-transferable stay with no blackout dates or expiration date at a steep discount, and help us achieve our dream of expanding our creation while helping create at least six new high-paying construction and hospitality jobs in our community! Get yourself a stay at a discounted rate that can be redeemed any time in the future!
 

Our Budget

After working with several local builders and suppliers, we've created a budget of $39,000 for the first of our three new loft-style overwater suites, including labor, materials, furniture, decor, and permits.

Budget breakdown:

  • Building materials and furniture/decor: $19,840

  • Labor and permits: $15,000

  • Chakra bags/postcards/t-shirts/totes and shipping: $1000

  • Indiegogo's 5% fee on funds raised: $2000

  • Stripe's 2.9% fee on credit card pledges: $1160

We know from prior experience that project costs can increase over projections due to changes in the availability of materials and fluctuations in material and labor prices, so we are seeking to raise $45,000 to ensure that -- even if unexpected hiccups arise -- we can complete our new bungalow by January of 2019.

If we are lucky enough to come in under budget or to exceed our goal, any extra funds will be put toward beginning work on the other two suites shown on the left in the architectural drawing above.

Should we fall short of our full goal, the funds we do raise will help us begin work on our new suite and will not affect our ability to fulfill our perks since we already have two overwater bungalows ready to go. And, after four years building and working in Panama, we're no strangers to working around challenges!

Exclusive Perks for Our Backers

We have some stellar perks to offer to our backers, which we are ready to deliver immediately since we already have two overwater bungalows and an award-winning restaurant in place.

There are no blackout dates and no expiration for any of our perks, so you can use the dates whenever you would like, subject to availability. They are fully transferable, so you can give them as gifts if you can't make it to Panama. Lock in a special rate to redeem any time in the future!

  • Book a stay of 1, 3, or 7 nights in one of our existing or future overwater bungalows at a steep discount. We're known for our island-style breakfast/brunch, which is included with all stays.
  • Get the run of the house for a week for yourself and up to six friends or family members! Breakfast included.
  • Come have dinner at our top-rated restaurant that features a rotating menu of island-fusion dishes centered around local, organic produce and seafood. We can easily accommodate dietary restrictions, and our menus are vegetarian and vegan-friendly.
  • Thinking of moving overseas? We've been through it all and can offer customized, expert advice to help you choose a destination, come up with a business plan, avoid common pitfalls, and navigate the logistics of the move and of doing business overseas. We are available via email, phone, or Skype.
  • Have you stayed with us or eaten at our restaurant and want to recreate one of our dishes at home? Our executive chef will create personalized, easy-to-follow recipes for any of our dishes!
  • Name a signature cocktail! We'll work with you to create a craft cocktail to serve at our bar and restaurant and you get to name it.
  • We work with Ngobe-Bugle women to source handmade chakara shoulder bags. Get yourself a snappy accessory and help local indigenous women launch small businesses and earn money for their families and communities.

A Focus on the Environment and Local Community

We would obviously love your help to achieve our goal of expanding our little creation, but it's about more than that! We employ four local chefs and housekeepers and several local tradesmen, and provide income to all of our local boat captains who transport our guests around the islands and on tours.

We promote a living wage in the community by paying our employees significantly more than the local average. By expanding, we will be able to create at least six new construction and hospitality/tourism jobs that offer high wages and opportunities to learn new job skills.

In our local community of Old Bank, unemployment is relatively high, so it would be hard to overestimate the impact those jobs could have for several local families.

We also work closely with the local government to improve infrastructure and to promote the protection of our community's natural treasures by sponsoring local clean-up days, educating our guests about the threats that plastic waste pose to our ecosystem, and limiting waste and the use of plastics in our operation.

We have never sold drinks in plastic bottles or used plastic or styrofoam takeout containers, we were the first business on the island to go plastic-straw free, we've consistently managed to stay close to zero food waste by shopping carefully and by serving our extra food to locals in need, and we strive to reduce our environmental impact by salvaging and reusing materials in building and landscaping.

By supporting The Sea Monkey, our backers are also supporting the responsible development of the islands of Bocas del Toro and helping support local families and the community of Old Bank as a whole.

Why Back Us?

Unlike a lot of crowdfunding campaigns, we aren't starting from scratch. We've been in operation since June of 2015 and have managed to create a solid reputation for our business online and in our community.

We aren't new to the challenges of building on a remote island in a developing country, either. We've built hundreds of feet of dock, two overwater bungalows, and the foundation platform for our three new suites from scratch.

We have also remodeled a local home from the ground up to create Casa Takalua, our overwater casita, and have founded one of the highest-rated restaurants in the area, which we've been operating since 2015. Both our restaurant and bed and breakfast have consistently earned TripAdvisor's Certificate of Excellence and are recommended by Lonely Planet.

 

Check out some of our reviews:

  • The Sea Monkey Bungalows on Tripadvisor
  • The Sea Monkey Restaurant on Tripadvisor
  • The Sea Monkey on Airbnb
  • The Sea Monkey on Facebook
  • The Sea Monkey on Lonely Planet
  • The Sea Monkey on The Blonde Abroad

Meet Our Team!

Stacy Harris and Ryan Stacy, Co-Founders/Hosts

We moved to Isla Bastimentos in August of 2014 with nothing but a few suitcases and a big idea! Since then, we've built two overwater bungalows, founded one of the top restaurants on the island, remodeled a local home for use as an overwater rental, and managed rental properties on the island for owners who can't be here year-round.

Tom Pelgrum, Tour Manager/Owner and Founder of Bastimentos Alive

Hi, I'm Tom. Originally from Holland, I moved to Bastimentos in August of 2015 to form Bastimentos Alive, the top-rated tour operation on the island.

We partner with The Sea Monkey to offer guests customized tours throughout the islands. Whatever adventures you have in mind, we can make it happen!

Guillermo Rodriguez, Construction Foreman

Hi, I'm Guillermo. Welcome to Bastimentos! I live next door to The Sea Monkey with my wife, Genia, and have been working with Ryan and Stacy for two years. I will be the foreman responsible for building their three new bungalows along with my crew of six of the area's best carpenters, plumbers, and electricians. I have over twenty years of experience building here in Bocas del Toro, having built several private homes, hotels, and restaurants on land and over the water, including the famous Blue Coconut on Isla Solarte. I'm known in Bocas for my attention to detail and my ability to get work done quickly and on budget.

Elvia Forchiney, Chef and Kitchen Manager

Bienvenidos a Isla Bastimentos! I'm Elvia, and my family has lived in Old Bank on Isla Bastimentos for generations. The picture above is of me and Gorda, my co-worker Tania's daughter.

I was the very first employee at The Sea Monkey and have been here since the beginning! Come try out my famous tropical pancakes with banana-rum sauce or coconut-crusted French toast at breakfast, or come see me at dinner for some Caribbean Pad Thai or locally-caught seafood in Salsa Caribeña with coconut rice, my specialty.

Tania Gonzalez, Head Chef

Welcome to my island! I'm Tania, and I've been working at The Sea Monkey since November of 2015 cooking breakfast and dinner for our guests.

Bocas has an amazing variety of tropical fruits, vegetables, and seafood, which serve as the basis for our ever-changing island-fusion menu. The islands are also known globally for heirloom cacao, which we turn into some killer chocolate-based desserts. Dietary restrictions or allergies? No worries, I got you.

The Crispy Asian-Glazed Chicken Wings that everyone raves about in our reviews are my creation. Come try them and maybe some Yangshuo Beer Fish made with fish caught by my husband!

Valeria Rogers, Front of House Manager

Hi, I'm Valeria, but you can call me Val. I was born in Panama but have lived all over the US. I came back home about a year ago and started working at The Sea Monkey, serving up plenty of cocktails and jokes to keep our guests entertained. I can help you arrange any activities you might be interested and provide insight into the local community.

Lyn Forchiney, Chef

Welcome to my island!  My name is Marilyn, but I go by Lyn. I came to work at The Sea Monkey with my sister, Elvia, in 2016. You can catch me at the restaurant most mornings for brunch and a chat. If you need any inside info on what to while you're here in Old Bank, just let me know!

 

You Don't Need Money to Help Us Reach Our Goal!

While we are extremely grateful for all of our backers, we realize that not everyone is in a position to contribute financially. Here are other ways you can help:

  • Help us spread the word about our campaign by sharing it with your friends and family via email or on social media
  • Use Indiegogo's share tools at the top right of this page
  • Be on the lookout for contests on our Twitter and Facebook pages. You could win a free stay for helping us spread the word!
story_txt:
We're Ready to Expand The Sea Monkey!Hi! We're Ryan and Stacy, and we moved to Isla Bastimentos to found The Sea Monkey in August of 2014. A lot of people dream of quitting their jobs, moving to a tropical island, and opening their own bed and breakfast, and we did it! While we both had several years of experience in the hospitality industry, we were complete newbies when it came to construction and to operating a business overseas. The learning curve was steep and there were challenges along the way, but we've built two overwater bungalows and founded one of the top-rated restaurants on the island. In the process, we've learned the ins and outs of local construction and of operating a business here in Panama. We now find ourselves in the enviable position of having more demand than we can accommodate, so we're ready to build three new, loft-style overwater suites, starting with the first unit, which you can see on the right in the architectural drawing below. And, because we already have two bungalows, we're ready to start delivering perks to our backers now! Claim your fully-transferable stay with no blackout dates or expiration date at a steep discount, and help us achieve our dream of expanding our creation while helping create at least six new high-paying construction and hospitality jobs in our community! Get yourself a stay at a discounted rate that can be redeemed any time in the future! Our Budget
After working with several local builders and suppliers, we've created a budget of $39,000 for the first of our three new loft-style overwater suites, including labor, materials, furniture, decor, and permits.
Budget breakdown:

Building materials and furniture/decor: $19,840
Labor and permits: $15,000
Chakra bags/postcards/t-shirts/totes and shipping: $1000
Indiegogo's 5% fee on funds raised: $2000
Stripe's 2.9% fee on credit card pledges: $1160

We know from prior experience that project costs can increase over projections due to changes in the availability of materials and fluctuations in material and labor prices, so we are seeking to raise $45,000 to ensure that -- even if unexpected hiccups arise -- we can complete our new bungalow by January of 2019.
If we are lucky enough to come in under budget or to exceed our goal, any extra funds will be put toward beginning work on the other two suites shown on the left in the architectural drawing above.
Should we fall short of our full goal, the funds we do raise will help us begin work on our new suite and will not affect our ability to fulfill our perks since we already have two overwater bungalows ready to go. And, after four years building and working in Panama, we're no strangers to working around challenges!
Exclusive Perks for Our Backers

We have some stellar perks to offer to our backers, which we are ready to deliver immediately since we already have two overwater bungalows and an award-winning restaurant in place.
There are no blackout dates and no expiration for any of our perks, so you can use the dates whenever you would like, subject to availability. They are fully transferable, so you can give them as gifts if you can't make it to Panama. Lock in a special rate to redeem any time in the future!


Book a stay of 1, 3, or 7 nights in one of our existing or future overwater bungalows at a steep discount. We're known for our island-style breakfast/brunch, which is included with all stays.
Get the run of the house for a week for yourself and up to six friends or family members! Breakfast included.
Come have dinner at our top-rated restaurant that features a rotating menu of island-fusion dishes centered around local, organic produce and seafood. We can easily accommodate dietary restrictions, and our menus are vegetarian and vegan-friendly.

Thinking of moving overseas? We've been through it all and can offer customized, expert advice to help you choose a destination, come up with a business plan, avoid common pitfalls, and navigate the logistics of the move and of doing business overseas. We are available via email, phone, or Skype.
Have you stayed with us or eaten at our restaurant and want to recreate one of our dishes at home? Our executive chef will create personalized, easy-to-follow recipes for any of our dishes!

Name a signature cocktail! We'll work with you to create a craft cocktail to serve at our bar and restaurant and you get to name it.
We work with Ngobe-Bugle women to source handmade chakara shoulder bags. Get yourself a snappy accessory and help local indigenous women launch small businesses and earn money for their families and communities.


A Focus on the Environment and Local Community

We would obviously love your help to achieve our goal of expanding our little creation, but it's about more than that! We employ four local chefs and housekeepers and several local tradesmen, and provide income to all of our local boat captains who transport our guests around the islands and on tours.
We promote a living wage in the community by paying our employees significantly more than the local average. By expanding, we will be able to create at least six new construction and hospitality/tourism jobs that offer high wages and opportunities to learn new job skills.
In our local community of Old Bank, unemployment is relatively high, so it would be hard to overestimate the impact those jobs could have for several local families.

We also work closely with the local government to improve infrastructure and to promote the protection of our community's natural treasures by sponsoring local clean-up days, educating our guests about the threats that plastic waste pose to our ecosystem, and limiting waste and the use of plastics in our operation.
We have never sold drinks in plastic bottles or used plastic or styrofoam takeout containers, we were the first business on the island to go plastic-straw free, we've consistently managed to stay close to zero food waste by shopping carefully and by serving our extra food to locals in need, and we strive to reduce our environmental impact by salvaging and reusing materials in building and landscaping.

By supporting The Sea Monkey, our backers are also supporting the responsible development of the islands of Bocas del Toro and helping support local families and the community of Old Bank as a whole.

Why Back Us?

Unlike a lot of crowdfunding campaigns, we aren't starting from scratch. We've been in operation since June of 2015 and have managed to create a solid reputation for our business online and in our community.
We aren't new to the challenges of building on a remote island in a developing country, either. We've built hundreds of feet of dock, two overwater bungalows, and the foundation platform for our three new suites from scratch.
We have also remodeled a local home from the ground up to create Casa Takalua, our overwater casita, and have founded one of the highest-rated restaurants in the area, which we've been operating since 2015. Both our restaurant and bed and breakfast have consistently earned TripAdvisor's Certificate of Excellence and are recommended by Lonely Planet.

 
Check out some of our reviews:

The Sea Monkey Bungalows on Tripadvisor
The Sea Monkey Restaurant on Tripadvisor
The Sea Monkey on Airbnb
The Sea Monkey on Facebook
The Sea Monkey on Lonely Planet
The Sea Monkey on The Blonde Abroad

story:
Who We Are

We're a group of amateur mountaineers who are passionate about Canadian history and the outdoors. We created the Canadian EH Society to organize re-enactments of famous wilderness and climbing expeditions of the past. We're a registered Canadian charity, so we can offer tax receipts!

What We're Doing

We're raising money to re-enact one of the most celebrated Canadian mountaineering expeditions of the early 20th century: the 1926 journey to locate and explore British Columbia's highest mountain, Mt Waddington.

What We Need

Although we're being sponsored by the Royal Canadian Geographical Society, we still need $7000 to fully fund our expedition. If you contribute, you'll be part of the adventure - getting regular updates, receiving perks like original photographs, t-shirts and film DVDs, as well as qualifying for participation in future expeditions. 

Why is it Called The Mystery Mountain Project?

When a group of amateur explorers first set out to find Mt Waddington in 1926, they didn't have a name for it. They weren't sure where it was, or even if it actually existed. They jokingly called it Mystery Mountain. We decided to adopt the name for our expedition.  

The Film

We're shooting a documentary about our Mt Waddington expedition, and as a sponsor you'll get tickets to screenings, advance previews and more. It's the next best thing to actually being on the expedition itself!

We've Done This Before

In 2016, we climbed Bugaboo Spire in British Columbia in period equipment. Our film about that ascent, Hobnails and Hemp Rope, was screened across Canada, Europe and New Zealand. Our Mt Waddington expedition is our biggest and most ambitious project yet, and we're very excited about it.  Help spread the word!

story:
Welcome dear Indiegogo backer!

  • Our story (and campaign!) begins with YOU, me and everybody on the planet!
  • Modern society is forcing us to sleep less, worry more and hustle like never before!
  • So...we are suggesting you keep the so important topic ORAL HYGIENE, practical!
  • So practical that you can hide it in your bra, jeans, suit, micro clutch & even wallet!

 

Introducing, nanoKoLev, our durable, hygienic, foldable medical-grade Silicone toothbrush!

 

First of all, let's make it clear: we don't want you to replace your toiletry pouch...

 

nanoKoLev is meant to be your Every.Day.Carry toothbrush companion (and we're not reinventing the wheel...just improving it!)

 

nano is circling the world...look at our adorable Kiwi customers' testimonial.

 

It is super convenient: you'll never wanna carry anything else!

 

QUICK FACTS

  • In addition to being travel-friendly, the super soft bristles have an added therapeutic benefit: they are gum-friendly for people with Gingivitis and Periodontitis!
  • Not coincidentally, nanoKoLev takes it easy on sensitive gums after surgery.  
  • All photos shown here represent actual recently manufactured pilot units.
  • Preparation for production begins in March '19 but delivery will only happen in June.
  • Choose among 4 colors: Blue Skies, Green Ocean, Orange Salmon and Yellow Lemon.
  • Available in 3 sizes: S, M, and L.
  • The bristle area is twice the area of a regular toothbrush;
  • A raised section of bristles allow users to reach deep into the mouth to the molars teeth.
  • A nice touch is an oval area in the middle of the bristle meant to be a placeholder for dentifrice tabs, paste, and DentyTabs. 
  • 3-YR Warranty against manufacturing defects.
  • You can use boiling water, microwave and an UVC Ionizer to sterilize it.
  • Made of bio-compatible ultra-soft Silicone, made in USA.
  • Fold, Stow and Go!

 

Take your nanoKoLev for a ride! It's so tiny and discreet...you won't feel embarrassed!

 

Never worry about bacteria colonies (i.e. dark spots) thriving on your toothbrush again! Boil up, Microwave it or UVC Ionize it! Go nano! 

 

We are eco-friendly!

 

Simplicity!

Simplicity re-invented! A truly portable travel toothbrush!

 

nanoKoLectible Bonus 1: digital poster

Why not add extra good stuff to what is already good? Check out our Perks!

 

nanoKoLectible Bonus 2: framed pilot-run of nanoKoLev.

Not available yet...once we hear what you think of it, we'll make it official. Est.cost: US$180

This is a special bonus Perk that are very limited in quantity. Shipped only to Continental US.

 

Accountability is key to any business...crowdfunding is no exception.

 

Summary of Features

If you are not convinced yet, this short re-cap should help.

 

 

In case you are curious about our production road-map:

Besides accountability, transparency and responsibility are crucial for credibility.

 

 

We'll keep you up-to-date!

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR SUPPORTING US!

story:
Wearing a helmet for a long time will let bacteria and odours grow inside the helmet, which may affect the health of the scalp and hair. The PJ 4D helmet liner not only adds shock absorption to the helmet, but also has moisture-wicking fabric and is very soft, breathable, and detachable for easy cleaning.

PJ 4D airbag safety liner breaks the traditional design concept and uses the latest scientific airbag technology. Each airbag is scientifically distributed on the inner liner with an ergonomic design.

When under pressure, the air inside the airbag will circulate, disperse the pressure, and play an effective buffer, shock absorption and decompression effect. It helps prevent pressure points from becoming too painful.

The foldable design makes it more compliant with the inside of the helmet and protects your head at 360°, providing a decent fit between your head and helmet.

The engineered fabric cools when wet to help regulate head temperature, providing a cool, refreshing liner that’ll chill you out instantly. Simply put this helmet liner right on your head to provide immediate relief after a long, sweat-filled riding. 

If you want to keep your helmet looking and feeling fresh, a helmet liner is the only way to go. The PJ helmet liner is made of Lycra fabric, making it anti-bacterial and anti-wrinkle. It can breathe and transport moisture away from your scalp.

The air holes are evenly distributed on the liner, allowing the effective and quick dissipation of the heat and perspiration in the helmet. You will not feel muggy because the air circulation is increased, and the stuffiness of the head is reduced. Wearing a high-quality helmet liner will keep the level of funk in your helmets to a minimum.

For people who wear helmets for long stints, this all-round protective helmet liner becomes very necessary. Suitable for construction workers, outdoor workers, police, fireman, motorcyclists and bicycle riders.

It is widely applicable to all standard size helmets.

Compared to the normal version, the upgraded version of the PJ helmet liner has infrared massage particles inside, which can enhance blood circulation and massage your head. When the infrared powder is combined with the cloth, the infrared wavelength will be generated when the product encounters human body heat, which can promote blood circulation.

The hook and loop tape on the back of the PJ helmet liner allows it to be easily attached to the original pad loop in the helmet.

After a few installation steps, you can easily and effectively add a layer of cushioning to the helmet to protect the head more effectively.

The inside of a motorcycle helmet can get rather dirty in short order, especially during the summer. PJ helmet liner helps keep the inside of your motorcycle helmet clean and fresh. This liner is detachable and washable, which can effectively keep the scalp healthy and can really keep the inside of the helmet looking brand-new for many years.

How to Care

Carefully remove the liner from your helmet and hand wash it in the sink with water. Let it air dry before reinstalling them to avoid dampness or mildew.

 

Risks and Challenges

We can guarantee that the first shipment will go out no later than January 2020 if we successfully get funded. We are committed to meet your expectations without any possible delay in production or delivery. We rate the risk of unexpected delays as being very low.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Dionysios Mylonas. I hold an MSc in Chemical Engineering from the University of California, Los Angeles, an MBA from the Imperial College, London and a BSc in Chemical Engineering from the National Technical University of Athens, Greece. My specialization as an engineer is in Fuels' Technology and as a financier in Investment Banking. You may find my detailed bio here: http://www.linkedin.com/in/dionyssis-mylonas-88051156/

My present campaign is the first start-up I am attempting.  It is based on personal work I have commenced, on a part-time basis since 2009, and on a nearly full-time basis since February 2018 trying to find an accurate method for measuring horsepower not at the wheels, but at the internal combustion engine's crankshaft or the electric motor's rotor shaft. The result of this work is two approved patents I hold, namely GR1008172 and GR1009319 as well as a US Patent Application for which I expect first USPTO action in the next months (pls see below sections). Finally, I have already personally funded patenting expenses and, most importantly, a fully functional Android working prototype of the mobile app that implements this patenting work, elaborated by the developers' team I have hired. This project has Arrow Certified Technology, meaning Arrow has reviewed the design and deemed it feasible for manufacturing.

A prospect contributor may think, "isn't this field, i.e. Automotive Technology, a rather specialized one? Will it have broad appeal?". The answer is yes, it is indeed specialized, but this is exactly the reason it requires someone qualified for scientifically proven, accurate and reliable results. As detailed in the Impact and FAQ sections below, the present project will still appeal to no less than 45 million existing users of competing mobile apps commercially launched, but not based on patents and, imho, giving inaccurate results despite the fact that some are quite expensive. 

 

What The Car Addict Team Need & What You Get

My detailed budget, as formulated following necessary input by my developers, has as follows:

As one can see, the first two tasks are necessary for the automatization of the horsepower and torque measurement phase. This phase is fundamentally complete, as, for example, we have measured crankshaft horsepower of my tuned Audi S3 MKII at 299 +/-1.5% ps. In fact, all measurements were between 295 and 303 ps, of course after (manual, for the time being) correction for the prevailing ambient conditions. I believe it's noteworthy that this horsepower turned out to be slightly higher when I replaced the malfunctioning wastegate valve, as shown in the three related YouTube videos associated with this campaign. It has to be pointed out that two different chassis dynos have tested this Audi S3 at 278 ps and 306 ps, with much lower repeatability ("reliability" in statistics' jargon). To be fully transparent, the above difference of 28 ps, or 10%, has given me the final push to try to find a more accurate and reliable horsepower measurement method. Above chassis dynos' results are available to anyone interested. Returning to the measurements with our app, we found similar to the Audi S3's tests reliability on tests of cars like the Maserati Gransport that is shown as one of this campaign's card images, as well as on less powerful cars such as a Mazda MX-5 Miata 2.0lt and a Volkswagen E-Golf, owned by friends of mine who volunteered to offer them to me for testing. 

The next tasks, as explained from Row 3 and below of the above table, do not require any mechanical engineering inventiveness, but IT work tasks of the specific costs outlined above. The most important part, allow me to repeat, is complete and has verified the three (two approved and one pending) patents' claims, as well as certain additional claims that will be filed via a CIP (Continuation In Part) Patent Application upon receipt of first USPTO action. 

An important query I believe I have to address, is what will happen to the funds collected if I don't reach my total goal of USD 9,700, calculated in the above listed table. The answer is clear: such funds will go towards implementing as many tasks of said table as possible. In other words, I will continue following my goal to launch and commercialize Car Addict, by directing all available funds towards further upgrading this mobile app. I will be available to prove this, by delivering the Current Mobile App featuring Arrow Certified Technology to any backer who claims it after the end of this campaign, whereas the Enhanced Mobile App per above budget and the Upgraded Mobile App are currently hidden perks, to be offered at a higher than 50% discount during the course of my campaign. The Upgraded Mobile app will incorporate other performance measurements such as accelerations, as well as certain functions that will enhance ease and safety of its use. Development of the iOS version of Car Addict will be the next and final step. 

As regards the abovementioned perks I, of course, realize that they do not translate to a significant monetary equivalent, but hopefully contributors will find some value in this. However, allow me to stress out at this point that, as beta testing is one of the next steps for which I seek your funding, we will have to be extremely careful as regards the Android smartphone to which the contributor will download the Current Mobile App, as not all accelerometers embedded in such smartphones always give accurate signals; Car Addict is based on such signals to measure horsepower and, in the near future, other car performance figures. 

Finally, I will offer my personal acknowledgement in the form of an Electronic Certificate to every single contributor, and if this campaign proves successful I will be more than grateful to see them become members of the Car Addict blog to be formed. 

 

The Impact

This product, i.e. the mobile app I have named Car Addict, appeals to a specific target market: car enthusiasts. It does not appeal to the family man who drives a  Honda Odyssey or to the housewife who drives a Toyota Camry. So, is the audience for such a product large enough? The answer is definitely yes. By the end of 2013, according to published data (www.prioridata.com), there were already 8.9 million active users of only iOS mobile apps competitive to Car Addict. Assuming that the ratio of Android/ iOS users of such apps was then proportional to the ratio of Android/ iOS users for all apps (i.e. 1.95x), this leads to a total number of 26.3 million users of relevant apps as of 2013 year end. The Compounded Annual Growth Rate, CAGR of global expense for mobile apps is estimated at 19.2% yoy for the period 2016-2023 (https://reports.valuates.com/market-reports/ALL...https://www.googleadservices.com/pagead/aclk?sa...). Assuming, for conservatism purposes, a significantly lower CAGR of 10% for mobile apps of the Car Addict category, we end up to a projected figure of 46.6 million active users by 2019 year end, i.e. practically now. I, nevertheless, strongly believe that the figure is much higher than the above, as Android users are currently 7 times as many as iOS ones. 

Therefore, this product is a specialized one, but still the audience and the relative need are substantial, to say the least. Users of such apps tend to buy more than one in order to compare the one against the other. Key market is the US and especially SoCal, where it is rumored that about half of the world's supercars are located. Indeed, car enthusiasts love to measure their car performance and power frequently, e.g. before and after service checks, or before and after tuning, in order to share and compare their results with fellow car enthusiasts. Responding to this need, there exist thousands of  mobile apps broadly related to cars, as well as numerous YouTube channels addressed to the car addict. 

One might definitely ask, "There exist chassis dynos, as they are called, costing dozens of thousands of dolars, since decades ago. What are, therefore, the benefits of a cheap mobile app measuring horsepower, as compared to this costly equipment?". Apart from what I have written in the previous section, the three major advantages of Car Addict are:

  1. Convenience: You can measure horsepower with  Car Addict as you drive, using your chosen gear and your desired speed range (start and finish). There is no need to book an appointment at a dyno center in advance and spend half a day. It is, nevertheless, strongly recommended that use of Car Addict,  if it is at high (illegal) speeds, be made in tracks/ circuits built for this purpose. 
  2. Cost: Dyno center costs vary from $70-100 per measurement, whereas Car Addict can be downloaded at an est. $4.95 and used infinitely. For rough comparison purposes, the two most expensive competitive current Android apps are priced at 27.99 and 12.99 euros. 
  3. Reliability and Accuracy: Car Addict helps avoid engine fatigue and overheating that are usual in dyno measurements. The main reason for this fatigue is that chassis dynos exert a much greater resistance to the rolling of car's wheels than the resistance encountered in real road conditions, i.e. on the asphalt concrete. I have seen a car engine of mine switching to "safe mode" during a dyno run due to the intervention of the Engine Control Unit, ECU in order to protect the engine. I have witnessed a supercar's engine (I cannot reveal the brand, for obvious reasons) burst during a dyno run and I have also seen a similar video on YouTube. 

Therefore, Car Addict is a more convenient, inexpensive, reliable and accurate alternative to traditional chassis dynos and competitive mobile apps. For more info on comparison with competing apps, pls read the following section.

And, it goes without saying, if you still don't trust me, I believe that the first paragraphs of the next section will appease your concerns.

 

Risks & Challenges

It is important for a prospect contributor to know who the creator of this project is and what qualifies him to undertake it. As noted above, I am a Chemical Engineer MSc (UCLA), and my specialization is in Fuels' Technology. The reason I took this specialization is simply that I am a car addict myself, so I tried to combine my hobby with my studies. My Bachelor's project at the National Technical University of Athens was a combination of Organic Chemistry and Automotive Engineering: I was developing new gasoline/ petrol additives and testing them on a standard engine with variable compression ratio: the well known CFR engine. Subsequently, my Master's thesis at UCLA was dealing with specific aspects of pollution in the LA basin, which was mainly caused by, what else, automobiles. My thesis was briefly presented as a paper published in one of the major scientific journals in the field, namely Atmospheric Environment:

https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/096016869190211O 

I have also worked as an Associate Researcher for the Fuels and Lubricants Laboratory of the National Technical University of Athens. I participated in a project of utmost importance for the Greek State's Fuel Policy: a cost-benefit project for the separation of Diesel Fuel in Greece in two types, heating and motor. Project's recommendations were immediately implemented by the Government and since then Diesel fuel consumed in Greece is separated in the above two types, making the country, allow me to say, a more "modern" one to this respect.

Finally, although I followed for many years a banker's career, capitalizing on my MBA from the Imperial College (after all, we do many things in our lives just for money!), I never stopped researching and keeping up with all developments in the automotive field. I therefore developed two Greek patents, GR1008172 and GR1009319 and filed for a US Patent Application, of which the first page is shown below (I have erased some details for confidentiality purposes, as the patent application is published but first USPTO office action is pending): 

 

In addition, the fully functional Android working prototype of Car Addict has Arrow Certified Technology as of September 13, 2019. 

As said above, the patents on which this project is based have been already tested, quite extensively I dare to say, on various automobiles, as the major risk of this project is competition: there already exist on app stores thousands of mobile apps broadly related to cars: speedometers, lap timers, apps for driving assistance, for taxi booking, car trivia etc, as well as quite a few apps that measure performance and power like Car Addict. However, and to the best of my knowledge,  none of the apps belonging to the last category is based on patents or is featuring certified technology (and I have searched, downloaded and used a lot of them myself) .

In addition, they all do the same thing: they measure horsepower not at the crankshaft, but at the wheels. Then, in order to calculate horsepower at the crankshaft they assume a certain percentage of transmission loss, which is to a large extent arbitrary, and add it to the measured wheel horsepower. Why do I characterize this assumed percentage as "arbitrary"? To give you a striking example, the two most expensive current Android apps, one priced at 27.99 and the other at  12.99 euros as priorly mentioned, assume that these losses are 9.9% and 17.6% respectively of the crankshaft power of my Audi S3 MKII, an all-wheel-drive car; a difference of 7.7%. Another app assumes a 14% loss for all manual transmission cars, where there exist powerful front-wheel-drive manual gearbox cars with only 5% transmission losses, such as the older European spec Ford Focus developing 305 ps (301 bhp), the Honda Civic Type-R of 310 ps (306 bhp), etc. Car Addict is based on a totally different mechanical engineering approach, whereby powertrain losses, which include engine and/or electric motor(s) and transmission ones, are measured; it does not simply assume a transmission loss percentage as competition does. Therefore, the expected accuracy is within +/- 2% of the real (i.e., measured by the car manufacturer's bench test) horsepower. Car Addict will not give the user a 14% transmission loss when it is only 5%, i.e. a 9% deviation; it will measure this transmission loss with the above quoted accuracy of 2%.

Apart from the above decisive competitive advantage, Car Addict is suitable for the horsepower measurement of electric and hybrid cars, for which regenerative braking can be disabled. Some competitors are developing their codes for being able to measure electric and hybrid cars, but Car Addict is ready to use relative proprietary formulas. In addition, the patented electromechanical engineering method applied unburdens the user of the need to know and enter from the menu a number of parameters such as aerodynamic drag coefficient, frontal area, rolling friction coefficient/ tyres' size, exact engine displacement, gear/ differential ratios, transmission and gearbox type etc. Only car weight and speed per 1,000 rpm are needed -the latter only if you want to plot horsepower and torque Vs rpm-, and if not known, the Enhanced Mobile App will help the user find them. 

Finally,  Car Addict, has a number of additional advantages. Unlike other applications, it does not require calibration. The user only needs to mount her/ his smartphone on the windscreen and verify that the acceleration values along the three axes are right, as given by numerous free apps, some offered with the smartphone per se. Again, unlike other applications, it does not require to start measurements from a complete stop, provided that the user has entered in advance the correct inputs and has not exceeded the start speed. Lastly, the car performance and safety of use functions offered will be numerous, but cannot be revealed at this stage, for reasons related to competition.

Another challenge I am facing with this project is market positioning. I did my best as regards this aspect also; although my specialization as an MBA holder and banker is Investment Banking/ Structured Finance, I do have some marketing knowledge and quite some relevant experience, dealing with large corporate clients since 1996 (you may wish to see my LinkedIn profile on this point). Furthermore, I have completed an initial marketing survey through SurveyMonkey, testing the waters with respect to the idea, the pricing, the pros and the cons, etc. The cons were addressed during the development of Car Addict. This initial survey indicated that 31 out of 40 people who took the time to respond found the idea to be "interesting" to "great" to "awesome". Survey's results are available, on a confidential basis, to prospect contributors. Therefore, I believe that the marketing elements of this project have been satisfactorily addressed and I am proceeding safely. 

A last challenge is time, as competition may offer new features - the underlying engineering method is legally risk free to this respect, as it is secured by the approved patents as well as the filing date of the pending one. I would like to stress the fact that my IT team consists of three qualified developers, all Computer Science graduates - one of them is following his graduate studies concurrently with this project. As one of these three team members has recently moved to London to pursue more lucrative professional opportunities, I will hire two additional ones, if I secure funding, to expedite the procedure. Therefore we will do our best to complete the additional app features the soonest possible in order to be ahead of the competition.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know what I wrote above, "this is the most interesting project I have ever run" sounds trite, but it is true. It is the only project I have created 100% on my own, driven by personal need and curiosity. Usually, modern day projects are run by companies or organizations and, as such,  they are run by many qualified people; I have participated in quite a few, some already mentioned above, in both my engineering and banking career. So, this one is what Americans call "my baby", as I have devoted endless hours to its development, especially since February 2018, on both my laptop desk and the field testing various versions of Car Addict on different cars. Therefore, I would be grateful, even if you cannot contribute in monetary terms, if you spread out my campaign by your word of mouth or through the social media you are in. And don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools to make this more popular! Thank you.

I would like to stress the fact that my IT team consists of three qualified developers, all Computer Science graduates - one of them is following his graduate studies concurrently with this project. As one of these three team members has recently moved to London to pursue more lucrative professional opportunities, I will hire two additional ones, if I secure funding, to expedite the procedure. Therefore we will do our best to complete the additional app features the soonest possible in order to be ahead of the competition.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
I know what I wrote above, "this is the most interesting project I have ever run" sounds trite, but it is true. It is the only project I have created 100% on my own, driven by personal need and curiosity. Usually, modern day projects are run by companies or organizations and, as such,  they are run by many qualified people; I have participated in quite a few, some already mentioned above, in both my engineering and banking career. So, this one is what Americans call "my baby", as I have devoted endless hours to its development, especially since February 2018, on both my laptop desk and the field testing various versions of Car Addict on different cars. Therefore, I would be grateful, even if you cannot contribute in monetary terms, if you spread out my campaign by your word of mouth or through the social media you are in. And don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools to make this more popular! Thank you.

story:
SOF ADVENTURES

(WHO)

SOF Adventures is a Veteran owned and enabled adventure guide service.

SOF Adventures was created with two objectives in mind. First, supporting Special Operation Forces (SOF) and other Veterans with value added employment that translates our cumulative experiences to meaningful outdoor opportunities for others. Secondly, encouraging others to get outside, disconnect and explore their nearby parks, recreational areas and environment.

​You may currently be reconsidering the trip to Wally World amusement park, that high population density cruise or other traditional vacations. SOF Adventures is standing by with options to disconnect and get outdoors.

We offer adventures similar to a certain British TV adventure personality without the prerequisite of being a Hollywood A-list celebrity.

 

COI Examples:

(WHAT)

Course of Instruction (COI). In the SOF community we have so many acronyms we've made encryption obsolete. 

All COI's include a scenario driven event designed to challenge your group's skills!!

100 Level Baseline Package

  •     Hiking/Backpacking
  •     Camp Management
  •     Gear and Equipment
  •     Mission Planning
  •     Just Glamping (low impact customizable option)
  •     Earn Certificate of Completion and SOF Adventures 100 Level "Ranger-like tab"

 

150 Level Corporate Leadership Development Package:

  •     Based off the 100 Level Baseline COI
  •     Spot and Assess
  •     Recruit and Develop
  •     Team Building
  •     Leadership Challenge Scenarios
  •     Earn Certificate of Completion and SOF Adventures 150 Level "Ranger-like tab"

 

100-300 Level COI Upgrade Packages:                                                                                                    Offered in Basic (100) Intermediate (200) and Advanced (300) formats. We encourage repeat offenders! Customers with Lower Level Certificates of Completion and SOF Adventures Tabs unlock 200/300 Intermediate and Advanced COI's. New Certificates and Tabs issued for each COI.

  •     Map, Compass, GPS, Geocache (LAND NAV)
  •     Coastal/ Riverine Kayak (MAR OPS)
  •     Basic Climbing (Vertical Assault)
  •     4x4 Overland Mobility (Ground Mobility)

​

400 Level Advanced Customizations:

For those who mastered Advance and Intermediate COI's and don't know when to quit! Once we've tested your resolve with 100-300 prerequisites we'll unlock access to these 400 Level Advanced COI's. You'll be in an exclusive adventurer club at this point. We'll customize exclusive trips for these overachievers!

  •     Helicopter Insert / Extract
  •     Rural Escape and Evasion Scenario
  •     Urban Escape and Evasion Scenario

 

More Exciting Courses at sofdventures.com and in Development....

Concept of Operations

(HOW)

You already live within a 3-4hr car ride of awesome adventure areas! We are experience focused, not location locked.

The SOF Adventure approach saves the expense of an airline ticket and time of travel days by choosing an outdoor location near you. This means, no need to build 2 days of air travel and the related cost, stress and hassle into your itinerary. We'll maximize your vacation time spent on actual vacation, not travel to it.

SOF Adventures brings everything required to complete the task. Just bring the right attire (we'll help here, as required). No investment in gear. You get to test drive our stuff that we chose because it worked in the Special Operations Community.

Force Multiply!

A Force Multiplier, simply put, makes more. We've trained Foreign Forces to recruit teammates or tell a buddy. One becomes two, two becomes six. Wet the gremlin, feed 'em after midnight, instant party!

Be a Force Multiplier and share with 5-12 like-minded teammates who want SOF Adventures to bring the adventure.

(WHEN)

Once you've formed a team of at least 6 and have dates in mind contact us for availability. We'll identify a viable location, get your team booked and relay additional details in a trip package.

(WHERE)

ALL bookings for the 2020/21 season will be run in the extended US Mid-Atlantic Region, PA, DE, MA, NY, MD, VA, NC, CT AND RI.

Visit us at  sofadventures.com for details, trip booking and to review all terms, conditions and policies.

(WHY)

Limitations Preventing Potential Adventure Seekers:

The PROBLEM:

Through trips with family, friends and a few soft openings we found that many did not take the first step to outdoor adventure primarily due to a few limiting factors outlined here. When the opportunity was presented to get outdoors, with limited risk and overhead equipment expense, all surveyed could not wait to do it again.

We fear what we don't understand.

This is generally a lack of Knowledge, Skill and Ability (KSA). KSA is a common term used to check understanding for Courses of Instruction within the Special Operations community. Basically, subject matter Knowledge is relayed. Skill  is demonstrated by the participant. Ability  is confirmed through practical exercises. Just going camping takes quite a bit of logistical management.

Location, Location, Location

Where do I go? This is not your typical KOA campground outing. We've found awesome private locations, often bordering 1000's of open to the public acres that allow exclusive camping options with access to incredible recreational areas.  You already live within a 3-4hr ride of these areas.   For your planning purposes SOF Adventures saves the expense of an airline ticket and travel days by selecting a viable adventure site near you.

Equipment

The expense of purchasing the right expensive tents, sleeping bags and pads, backpacks, food prep equipment, etc.., is a huge leap for beginners. Why would you invest in this endeavor if you aren't certain it is for you? When coupled with the KSA barrier this can be a non-starter for most.   We'll help you find the way...

Our SOLUTION:

A diverse team of highly skilled Veterans share our cumulative Knowledge  of outdoor recreation activities.

We will refine your Skills, sharing best practices of Special Operation Teams applied to your group's outing. 

Your Ability  will be challenged with practical exercises in the field related to the focus of your desired course of instruction. You will leave with the confidence to apply your new abilities to plan and manage your own outdoor adventures.

SOF Adventures applies a crawl, walk, run approach to our instruction. Allowing you to progress at the team's relative pace. Our customizable packages allow for return trips with adventures of increasing levels of difficulty. 

SOF Adventures isn't a traditional guide service. From mission planning to trip execution, we'll teach you to do it alone. We bring all the gear required, no experience necessary, no risk of commitment to the expense of gear, if outdoor adventure turns out not to be your thing.

Campaign Impact

SOF Adventures will force multiply good stewards of the environment, foster no impact/no trace recreational outdoor activities and enable more people to enjoy these activities in their immediate area. Our concept eliminates the need for airline tickets and travel time. We suspect it will be car pool friendly, since we bring all the required equipment. These factors will help limit impact on the environment you are about to explore.

With the current COVID -19, enhanced outdoor activity may become a safe replacement for typical vacation travel. We hope to offer exciting options to traditional vacation travel.

SOF Adventures is Veteran staffed/operated and a Service-Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business. We take pride in offering the best qualified cadre who have made careers of dedication to service.

We suspect this chapter will be more fun for ALL involved!

Contributions

Your contributions will help offset SOF Adventures' startup costs related to licensing, marketing, insurance, legal fees, website build, program development and initial equipment procurement.

Contribute on the "BACK IT" button at the top of the page. SWAG and Perks can also be accessed via this button.

For the 10% off A 3-Day Baseline Voucher you must be on the original CSV email and list of contributors. This is for a single person discount, not an entire group, unless all the group members meet these two requirements. Remember, SOF Adventures requires a minimum of 6 people for our team to build and execute your adventure. If your team members did not meet these two requirements we'll assist you in making fun of them over the course of the trip. 

Perks

Perks listed will be shipped ASAP, currently expecting NLT the end of November 2020. We'll update here if that changes but we know the outfit (quadpromo.com) that does this for the SEAL Teams.

New Perks will be added to unlock and will include discounted trip coupons, surprise limited release survival related items and more SWAG.

Risks & Challenges

Be a Force Multiplier, spread the word! Form your team quickly. There will be limited availability for these exclusive outings. Booking at sofadventures.com as soon as possible ensures your trip makes it on the calendar.

Our largest obstacle, aside from the one below, is the cost for initial procurement of the equipment load-out. This campaign will allow for rapid procurement of the outstanding items. We'll still get it done if these goals are not fully met but the process will be more complicated without your support.

COVID-19

We also suffered some setbacks here, delayed start and waiting for reopening of related service providers.

SOF Adventures takes the COVID-19 outbreak seriously. We'll mitigate risk of exposure through use of masks and buffs (perk coming soon) as required, social distancing as applicable for outdoor activity and the best sanitary practices to disinfect hands and equipment.

See our COVID 19 Mitigation plan on sofadventures.com

Other Ways You Can Help

After a career of hiding in the shadows and blending into the background, we are not social media ninjas. If you can assist with our force multiplication, share our INDIEGOGO Campaign and SOFAdventures.com site, we would certainly appreciate it!

Follow us or click the INDIEGOGO share links at the top of the campaign page.

SOF Adventure awaits just around the corner, disconnect and get outside to explore your environment!

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!
