story:
SEE OUR NEW CAMPAIGN AT:

http://igg.me/at/clevercaps


Thanks for visiting Clever Caps crowdfunding campaign site. We hope you will like our project and our cause. 

By contributing with our campaign, you will also be helping poor children either directly (you can choose the "Donation Perk" for which each 1 dolar will be transformed into 10 Clever Caps to be donated to charity institutions) or indirectly (the sooner we are able to increase production scale, the sooner more products closed with Clever Caps will reach the shelves, and the sooner "used" caps will be available to be reused as building blocks). 

30 days after our campaign deadline we are still very far from our target. So, any contribution will be very important for us, You can help our campaign in 2 ways: by making a $ contribution and by inviting your friends to visit this site.

Even if we do not reach the $ 100,000 USD target, we will deliver the perks. In this case, the delivery will probably take 3-4 months longer, but we will deliver. 

Thanks for your help.

Henry Suzuki, Claudio Patrick Vollers & Clever Caps Team

Clever Caps donations tocharity organizations


Clever Caps are reusable caps that have two lives straight out of the factory:

-  in the first life, it is a cap

-  in the second, a building block.

Using them requires no other action. Take it off the bottle and use it.

The caps will no longer go into the garbage neither will they make streets, beaches, etc. dirty. They will be bilt into daily life objects and toys.

Clever Caps were designed to adapt to the market:

-  they can be used with standard bottleneck bottles

-  they are compatible with Lego blocks

-  they are made from the same recyclable raw materials as conventional caps.

Eco Design, putting the concept of reuse into practice.




Springwise - "Clever Caps offer an environmentally friendly suluition to the production of bottle caps while also adding value to the objetcs to encorage consumers to reuse them."


Fast Company - "These Adorable Bottle Caps Turn Into Lego-Like Toys. Why recycle when you can play with your trash?"

Design Taxi - "Instead of stacking up in landfills, the ridges above and below these caps enable them to add a new an interesting element to LEGO creations."

 Packaging of the Word - "A Brazilian company in the innovative packaging sector, Clever Pack deveolops bottle cap that establishes new paradigm in sustainability"

Are you Global? - "I like this kind of innovation because many people forget that also recycling wastes energy and pollutes the environment for transportation or the recycling process itself. So reusing is the much better way to contribute something to limit the detrimental effects on the environment." 

Impact Consulting - "These caps, created by Brazil-based innovative packaging devoloper Clever Pack, meet both a practical need and are given a second life as a collectable toy. 
What is the key lesson here? Rethinking Product Life Cycles Adds Value $" 

DesingMuseum - "Clever Caps (Designs of the Year) - ' Recycling is a good option. Reusing is even better.' This product starts out life with two uses so when it's finished with as a bottle cap it becomes a toy building block"














PERKS WILL BE DELIVERED EVEN IN CASE WE DO NOT REACH THE USD 100,00 TARGET. In case we do not reach the target, it will take a little longer for us to produce and ship perks, but we will deliver. In case of Caps for donation, we will start delivering part of the Caps even before May 24th.








For all contribution levels:

· PERKS WILL BE DELIVERED EVEN IN CASE WE DO NOT REACH THE USD 100,00 TARGET. In case we do not reach the target, it will take a little longer for us to produce and ship perks, but we will deliver. In case of Caps for donation, we will start delivering part of the Caps even before May 24th (follow updates).


·  IMPORTANT !!!: IN CASE YOU WANT TO RECEIVE YOUR PERK (not in the case of donation to charity institutions), PLEASE ADD SHIPPING COST IN THE BOX AT THE END OF THE PERK SELECTION LIST ON THE RIGHT: “Additional Gift (optional)”

1. CLICK ON "Additional Gift (optional)"

2. CLICK ON THE BUTTON “Custom”

3. TYPE THE VALUE MATCHING YOUR REGION. e.g. $ 54 USD for 1 Large Size Stool Model A, to be shipped to North America. 

4. CHECK IF THE SYSTEM ADDED THE SHIPPING COST TO THE TOTAL VALUE OF YOUR CONTRIBUTION. e.g. TOTAL $ 174 USD  for 1 Large Size Stool Model A, to be shipped to North America.


Clever Caps are compatible with Lego blocks!


Clever Caps of different sizes and shapes for many types of bottles and other recipients. They all assemble together.


Lightweight and sturdy


Objects made with Clever Caps are lightweight and sturdy




Customizable


Customizable in many ways


For more ideas on how Clever Caps can be used, seeClever Caps fan page at www.facebook.com/clevercaps

Playing with Clever Caps is funny. You will not want to stop. Any time somebody will find a new way to use them.


Good for children and bring the family together


Field activity with Clever Caps development batch. Many generations sat together to play with the Caps, like the old times.


For a product to be sustainable it must be:

- Environmentally correct

- Socially just

-  Economically viable


Environmentally correct:

They are reusable, less likely to leave garbage on the streets, beaches, oceans, etc., and are an alternative to recycling 


An alternative to recycling

Recycling is very important for the planet but it does leave an environmental footprint since CO2 gas is released during the phases of transportation and also the use electrical power (separation of the different materials, washing, and reprocessing).

Note:66 % of the world’s electrical power comes from thermal plants, which burn fossil fuel and release CO2 gas.


Long process for new product


Directly to a new product, second life


We are to test Clever Caps manufacture with renewable materials. It will be one additional step for the good of the environment.


We can help change this scenario!

Clever Caps will help changing this scenario!


Socially just:

An inexpensive toy that awakens children’s creativity.

One more choice of raw material for artisans.


Economically viable:

No extra phases are added to the manufacturing of caps or to the bottling line.

Minimal difference in material

They use the same raw material as conventional caps.



- Bringing together people from different generations in activities to assemble objects and toys

- Bringing needy children closer to a fairer world, giving them the chance to create and assemble several toys.

- Contributing to a lower environmental impact

- Awakening people so they can look for alternative solutions.

- Inspiring people to leave routine and be back to childhood, even if for a while

- Breaking barriers: caps from different products and different companies interacting.


After a long development phase involving designers, engineers, and technicians the round 28 mm version of the Clever Caps is completely ready to go to market.

It works perfectly as a:

- cap (threading, sealing and how the seal works)

- building block (they can be assembled with each other and are compatible with Lego blocks)

The cap has already been certified as a toy by the INMETRO (National Institute of Metrology, Quality and Technology – the Brazilian certification agency). It is therefore approved for marketing.

The pilot/development mold is validated for the production of caps in low volumes. Several tests have been performed, and scaling up will be a question of investment in the acquisition bigger molds.

Pilot/development mold,one single cap per injection cycle 


A Brazilian bottled mineral water brand is finalizing tests in their bottling/production line. Within the next 60 days they will be selling mineral water bottles, closed with Clever Caps produced with the pilot mold.
Square and rectangular Clever Cap models are in the final phase of pilot mold adjustments and tests.


Our first goal is to manufacture industrial scale molds of the 3 Clever Cap models already developed so production scale can be achieved.

We will then invest in expanding the concept of Clever Caps to other market segments and other kinds of packaging.

We believe that with sales growth we will be able to increase our production scale and to advertise globalize the product, so products using Clever Caps can be seen in various countries.
It is also our wish that as Clever Caps become better known, they will help disseminate sustainable knowledge and practices in people's daily lives, as well as encourage innovation in this direction.

Clever Caps are a reality already. However, in order to leverage the project it is essential that production scale be achieved. To make that happen we need financing to manufacture industrial scale molds.(most costly item in the project).


- Why do we need to invest in bigger molds, if we already have molds?

Right now, we have a single cavity mold, which makes just one cap per injection cycle. This is OK for samples or even for a first subsidized pilot launch. However, in order to reach a virtuous cycle of growth, we need bigger molds with much more cavities which will allow us both lower production cost and increase manufacture scale.

- Where will the caps be made?

Clever Caps will be made either in Brazil or in the United States.

- Why the shipping cost is so high?

Sending goods overseas from Brazil is quite expensive. We are looking for ways to lower shipping costs. If we succeed (and we hope we will) we will share the savings with our contributors by sending additional of caps.

- How long will it take to get Clever Caps to shelves?

The first commercial product to be marketed with Clever Caps will be a Brazilian local brand mineral water. For this forthcoming low scale pilot launch, Clever Caps will be manufactured with the pilot mold.

The level of success in this Crowd Funding project will have an important impact on the speed of marketing and expansion of the Clever Caps. That means that each contribution will help us bring the new caps to market with the goal of practical expansion of this sustainability concept.

- Why are Clever Caps sustainable?

They are sustainable because they meet the 3 criteria of a sustainable product:

· They are environmentally correct:

Clever Caps leave a smaller environmental footprint because they will be directly reused, i.e., they do not require any industrial processing.

Since the caps will be reused there is less garbage in the streets, ocean, beaches, etc.

· They are socially just and accessible:

Clever Caps can become inexpensive, educational, and fun toys for children; raw material for artisans; and learning tools to foster environmental awareness and develop creativity for people of all ages.

· They are economically viable:

No extra phases are added to the manufacturing of caps (same manufacturing process of conventional caps).

No extra phases are added to the bottling process (bottle filling and cap screwing).  Only assembly line adjustments are needed.

They use the same raw materials as conventional caps and their weight increment is small, without a significant price increase.

- Are Clever Caps against recycling?

Not at all. Recycling is essential for our planet.

It is impossible not to recycle the trash we generate and just take new raw materials from the environment.

The matter is that recyclinged also leaves an environmental footprint.

To turn trash into a new product, it must be sorted out as different materials (plastic, paper, glass, aluminum, organic material, etc.), washed, crushed, granulated until it becomes a new raw material.

This recycled raw material must be processed in injecting, blowing, and extruding  machines, and only then will it become a new product.

During all of these processes, a lot of electricity and fuel (for the various transportation phases) will be spent.

Both the use of electrical power (66% of which is generated by thermal plants) and the diesel-based transportation release CO2 gas, one the villains of the greenhouse effect.

Our proposal with Clever Caps is reuse, which avoids all of these phases. It is also an alternative to recycling.

- Can Clever Caps be recycled?

Yes. They are made from the same raw materials as conventional caps: polypropylene or polyethylene, plastics that can be 100% recycled.

However, because they can be used to assemble objects and develop people’s creativity, we believe using them as building blocks is a better alternative.

- I like the idea but will not be using Clever Caps on a daily life. What can I do with them?

If you do not want to use Clever Caps, you can donate them to a day-care center, school, etc. Children will be happy with the donation since the Clever Caps will be used as toys. Another choice is to donate them to artisans who can use them as raw material in their projects. Bars and restaurants can use Clever Caps in a smart and creative manner. The possibilities for using and reusing the caps are endless!

- Don’t Clever Caps violate Lego’s intellectual property right?

Within the limits of our knowledge and based on studies conducted by specialists in intellectual property (copyrights), we understand that Lego’s trademark rights are not violated. A patent is valid for 20 years, so .... This view is also strengthened by the fact that building blocks compatible with Lego blocks have been sold internationally for years by several competing companies.

We are great admirers of Lego and we believe that bringing Clever Caps to the market can enhance their brand’s success even more.

- Is Clever Caps’ weight difference significant?

No, the weight difference between a Clever Cap and most "conventional" plastic bottle caps is minimal because Clever Caps are lower than most conventional caps so they can be compatible with Lego blocks. So, even with the little ears and pins, the weight difference is very small.

- How are Clever Caps applied to bottles in bottling lines?

The same way as conventional caps. No new machines or additional manufacturing phases are required - only adjustments to existing equipment.

- What are other Clever Caps advantages?

In addition to bringing the concept of sustainability to life, we took into consideration several points during the realization of Clever Caps:

- Foster the development of users’ creativity.

- Enhance the access of needy children to smart and creative toys.

- Serve as an input to projects by artisans and artists.

- Help awaken and develop a “sustainable mind frame” for final users.

- Diminish the amount of plastic discarded, often not recycled, into the environment.

- Provide an extra purchase decision factor for the consumer: packaging reuse.

- Make advertising campaigns easier through the compatibility with Lego blocks

- Make opening easier, due to the better grip and bigger leverage.

- Are Clever Caps BPA-free?

Yes

Playing with Clever Caps is funny. You will not want to stop. Any time somebody will find a new way to use them.


Bom para crianças e unem a família (?) Good for children and bring the family together

Field activity with Clever Caps development batch. Many generations sat together to play with the Caps, like the old times.


Para um produto ser sustentável ele deve ser:

- Ecologicamente correto

- Socialmente justo

-  Economicamente viável 


Ecologicamente correto:

As Clever Caps são reutilizáveis, então colaboram em deixar menos lixo espalhado pelas ruas, praias, mares, etc. e são uma alternativa para a reciclagem,


Uma alternativa a reciclagem

A reciclagem é muito importante para o planeta, porem também deixa uma pegada ambiental, visto que libera gás CO2 durante as etapas de transporte e de consumo de energia elétrica.

Obs: 66 % da energia elétrica mundial vem de termolétricas, que queimam combustível fóssil liberando gás CO2.

O CO2 é o vilão do o maior problema ambiental: Efeito Estufa!

Longo processo para obtenção de um novo produto

É diretamente um novo produto, segunda vida

Nós podemos modificar esse cenário! 

Clever Caps will help changing this scenario!


Estamos testando a fabricação das Clever Caps em materiais recicláveis. Será um passo adicional para o bem ao meio ambiente.


Socialmente justa:

Um brinquedo barato que desperta a criantividade das crianças.

Mais uma escolha de matéria prima para os artesãos.


Economicamente viável:

Sem fases adicionais na fabricação das tampas ou na linha de envase.

Diferença mínima no material. 

Eles usam a mesma matéria-prima que as tampas convencionais.


- Bringing together people from different generations in activities to assemble objects and toys

- Bringing needy children closer to a fairer world, giving them the chance to create and assemble several toys.

- Contributing to a lower environmental impact

- Awakening people so they can look for alternative solutions.

- Inspiring people to leave routine and be back to childhood, even if for a while

- Breaking barriers: caps from different products and different companies interacting.


A versão redonda em 28 mm das Clever Caps, está totalmente pronta para ir ao mercado.

Ela funciona perfeitamente como:

- tampa (rosqueamento, vedação e funcionamento do lacre)

- bloco de montar (encaixes entre si e compatibilidade com blocos Lego)

A tampa já está certificada como brinquedo pelo INMETRO ( National Institute of Metrology, Quality and Technology - órgão brasileiro de certificações), sendo assim está aprovada para  ser comercializada.

O molde piloto/de desenvlvimento está validado para a produção das tampas. Já forma realizamos diversos testes com tiragens maiores.

Molde piloto em funcionamento

Uma marca de água mineral brasileira está finalizando os testes em sua linha de envase/produção. Nos próximos 60 dias está vendendo água mineral com as Clever Caps produzidas com o molde piloto.

O modelos das Clever Caps quadrada e retangular estão em fase final de ajustes das tampas e teste dos moldes pilotos.


Nosso primeiro objetivo é a fabricação de moldes de escala industrial dos 3 modelos das Clever Caps já desenvolvidas, para poder ter escala de produção.

Em seguida, investiremos na expansão do conceito das Clever Caps para outros segmentos de mercado e tipos de embalagem, como: embalagens cartonadas, bebidas carbonatadas (com gás), iogurtes, pouches, cosméticos, creme dental, etc.

 As novas tampas manterão os 2 pontos básicos que usamos nos 3 modelos já desenvolvidos:

 - Elas se adaptarem aos gargalos, existentes no mercado.

 - As tampas serem compatíveis com blocos Lego.

Acreditamos que com o crescimento das vendas teremos condições de aumentar nossa escala de produção e a divulgação do produto, de modo que produtos tampados com Clever Caps possam ser encontrados em vários países.

Também é nosso desejo, que a popularização das Clever Caps possa ajudar na disseminação de conhecimentos e práticas sustentáveis no dia a dia das pessoas, bem como estimular inovações nessa direção.


As Clever Caps já são uma realidade. Entretanto, para alavancarmos o projeto, precisamos ter escala de produção, e para isso acontecer, precisamos do financiamento da fabricação do molde de escala industrial, tanto da versão redonda em 28 mm, quanto das versões quadrada e retangular.


- Quanto tempo levará para as Clever Caps chegarem às prateleiras?

As Clever Caps, modelo CC1, fabricadas com o molde piloto, deverão chegar às prateleiras nos próximos 60 dias, no Brasil. O nível de sucesso nesse projeto de Crowd Funding terá um importante impacto na aceleração da comercialização e expansão das Clever Caps. Ou seja, cada colaboração nos ajudará a colocar as novas tampas no mercado, objetivando expandir esse conceito de sustentabilidade na prática.

- Por que as Clever Caps são sustentáveis?

Elas são sustentáveis pois atendem aos 3 critérios de um produto sustentável:

· São ecologicamente corretas:

As Clever Caps deixam uma menor pegada ambiental, pois serão reutilizadas diretamente, ou seja, não precisam passar por nenhum processo industrial, como a reciclagem.

A reciclagem é muito importante para o nosso planeta, porém,  muitos gases CO 2 são liberados durante o processo. Assim, o reuso direto de um produto é mais sustentável do que a reciclagem. Além disso, muitas das tampas vão para o lixo comum e não chegam a ser recicladas. E outras tantas são jogadas nas ruas, no mar, nas praias, etc, poluindo o meio ambiente.

· São socialmente justas e acessíveis:

As Clever Caps podem se tornar brinquedos baratos, educativos e divertidos para crianças carentes, materiais para artesãos e ferramentas didáticas para estimular a consciência ecológica e desenvolver a criatividade das pessoas de todas as idades.

· São economicamente viáveis para a indústria:

Não acrescentam etapas na fabricação da tampa, pois usam do mesmo processo de fabricação das tampas convencionais.

Não acrescentam etapas no envase (enchimento do frasco e montagem da tampa), apenas alguns ajustes na linha de montagem.

Usam as mesmas matérias primas das tampas convencionais e o incremento de matéria prima é pequeno, sem aumento significativo no preço.

- A Clever Caps é contra a reciclagem?

De forma alguma. A reciclagem é essencial para o nosso planeta.

É impossível não reciclar o lixo que geramos e só retirar novas matérias primas do meio ambiente. A questão é que a reciclagem também deixa uma pegada ambiental.

O lixo tem que ser separado entre os diversos matérias como plástico, papel, vidro, alumínio, material orgânico, etc. Esses materiais tem que ser lavados, moídos, re-separados (caso do plástico separando o PP do PE, do PET, etc.), secos, extrusados, granulados ou derretidos, etc. até que se transformem em uma nova matéria prima. Aí, então, esse material é novamente processado para virar um novo produto e fechar o ciclo novamente para ser usado pelo consumidor.

Então, para o lixo virar um novo produto, muita energia elétrica terá sido consumida e diversos materiais poluentes poderão ter sido usados no processo, inclusive nas diversas etapas de transporte desses materiais.

O transporte gera gás CO2 com a queima de óleo diesel.

Sabemos que 66% da energia elétrica do planeta vem da queima de petróleo, gás ou carvão. Ou seja, a cada 3 máquinas elétricas, 2 funcionam indiretamente com petróleo, gás ou carvão gerando CO2, que é o vilão do efeito estufa.

O que propomos com Clever Caps é o reuso, uma alternativa mais barata e  mais simples para a reciclagem.

- As Clever Caps podem ser recicladas?

Sim. Elas são fabricadas com as mesmas matérias primas que tampas convencionais, Polipropileno ou Polietileno, plásticos que podem ser 100% reciclados. Entretanto, como elas podem ser usadas para montar objetos e desenvolver a criatividade das pessoas, acreditamos que elas tem um melhor aproveitamento como bloco de montar.

- Acho a ideia bacana, mas não irei usar as Clever Caps no meu dia a dia. O que posso fazer com elas?

Se você não quiser usar as Clever Caps, você pode doa-las para uma creche, escola, etc. As crianças ficarão felizes com a doação, pois elas serão usadas como brinquedos. Outra opção é doá-las para artesãos, que poderão usá-las como matéria prima para seus projetos. Bares e restaurantes podem usar as Clever Caps de forma inteligente e criativa. As possibilidades de uso e aproveitamento das tampas são muitas!

- As Clever Caps não infringem direitos da marca Lego?

Dentro dos nossos melhores conhecimentos e com base em estudos de especialistas em propriedade intelectual, entendemos que não. Uma patente tem validade de 20 anos, assim .... Colabora com essa percepção o fato que blocos de montar compatíveis com blocos Lego são comercializados internacionalmente, há anos, por várias empresas concorrentes.

Somos grandes admiradores da Lego e acreditamos que a colocação das Clever Caps no mercado possa contribuir com o sucesso ainda maior da marca.

- A diferença de peso das Clever Caps é significativo?

Não, a diferença de peso entre uma Clever Cap e a maioria das tampas "convencionais" de garrafas PET é mínima, pois as Clever Caps são mais baixas que a maioria das tampas convencionais para poderem ser  compatíveis com os blocos Lego, assim mesmo com as orelhinhas e os pininhos a diferença de peso é bem pequena.

- A diferença de peso das Clever Caps é significativo?

Não, a diferença de peso entre uma Clever Cap e a maioria das tampas "convencionais" de garrafas PET é mínima, pois as Clever Caps são mais baixas que a maioria das tampas convencionais para poderem ser compatíveis com os blocos Lego, assim mesmo com as orelhinhas e os pininhos a diferença de peso é bem pequena.

- Como as Clever Caps são aplicadas nos frascos nas linhas de envase?

Da mesma forma que as tampas convencionais. Não precisa de maquinas novas ou etapas adicionais de fabricação, apenas ajustes nos equipamentos existentes.

- Que outras vantagens as Clever Caps possuem?

Além do conceito da sustentabilidade na prática, levamos em conta diversos pontos quando idealizamos as Clever Caps:

- Estimular o desenvolvimento da criatividade dos usuários.

- Aumentar o acesso a brinquedos inteligentes e criativos a crianças carentes.

- Servir como insumo para trabalhos de artesãos e artistas.

- Contribuir para despertar e desenvolver o "pensamento sustentável" no consumidor final.

- Diminuir a quantidade de plástico descartado no meio ambiente, que muitas vezes não é reciclado.

- Acrescentar um fator de decisão de compra para o consumidor: reutilizar parte da embalagem no seu dia a dia.

- Compatibilidade com blocos Lego facilita campanhas promocionais (rodinhas, bonecos, etc.)

- Maior facilidade de abertura das embalagens.

- As Clever Caps são livres de BPA?

Sim.

Clever Caps are compatible with Lego blocks!


Clever Caps of different sizes and shapes for many types of bottles and other recipients. They all assemble together.

Playing with Clever Caps is funny. You will not want to stop. Any time somebody will find a new way to use them.


Good for children and bring the family together


Field activity with
Clever Caps development batch. Many generations sat
together to play with the Caps, like the old times.




For a product to be sustainable it must be:
- Environmentally correct
- Socially just
-  Economically viable

Environmentally correct:

They are reusable, less likely to leave garbage on the streets, beaches, oceans, etc., and are an alternative to recycling 




An alternative to recycling
Recycling is very important for the planet but it does leave an environmental footprint since CO2 gas is released during the phases of transportation and also the use electrical power (separation of the different materials, washing, and reprocessing).
Note:66 % of the world’s electrical power comes from thermal plants, which burn fossil fuel and release CO2 gas.




Long process for new product



Directly to a new product, second life



We are to test Clever
Caps manufacture with renewable materials. It will be one additional step for
the good of the environment.


We can help change this scenario!Clever Caps will help changing this scenario!



Socially just:

An inexpensive toy that awakens children’s creativity.
One more choice of raw material for artisans.


Economically viable:

No extra phases are added to the manufacturing of caps or to the bottling line.
Minimal difference in material
They use the same raw material as
conventional caps.



- Bringing together people from different generations in activities to assemble objects and toys
- Bringing needy children closer to a fairer world, giving them the chance to create and assemble several toys.
- Contributing to a lower environmental impact
- Awakening people so they can look for alternative solutions.
- Inspiring people to leave routine and be back to childhood, even if for a while
- Breaking barriers: caps from different products and different companies interacting.











After a long development phase involving designers, engineers, and technicians the round 28 mm version of the Clever Caps is completely ready to go to market.
It works perfectly as a:
- cap (threading, sealing and how the seal works)
- building block (they can be assembled with each other and are compatible with Lego blocks)
The cap has already been certified as a toy by the INMETRO (National Institute of Metrology, Quality and Technology – the Brazilian certification agency). It is therefore approved for marketing.
The pilot/development mold is validated for the production of caps in low volumes. Several tests have been performed, and scaling up will be a question of investment in the acquisition bigger molds.
Pilot/development mold,one single cap per injection cycle 


A Brazilian bottled mineral water brand is finalizing tests in their bottling/production line. Within the next 60 days they will be selling mineral water bottles, closed with Clever Caps produced with the pilot mold.
Square and rectangular Clever Cap models are in the final phase of pilot mold adjustments and tests.

Our first goal is to manufacture industrial scale molds of the 3 Clever Cap models already developed so production scale can be achieved.
We will then invest in expanding the concept of Clever Caps to other market segments and other kinds of packaging.We believe that with sales growth we will be able to increase our production scale and to advertise globalize the product, so products using Clever Caps can be seen in various countries.
It is also our wish that as
Clever Caps become better known, they will help disseminate sustainable
knowledge and practices in people's daily lives, as well as encourage
innovation in this direction.


Clever Caps are a reality
already. However, in order to leverage the
project it is essential that production scale be achieved. To make that happen
we need financing to manufacture industrial scale molds.(most costly item in
the project).










- Why do we need to invest in bigger molds, if we already have molds?
Right now, we have a single cavity mold, which makes just one cap per injection cycle. This is OK for samples or even for a first subsidized pilot launch. However, in order to reach a virtuous cycle of growth, we need bigger molds with much more cavities which will allow us both lower production cost and increase manufacture scale.
- Where will the caps be made?
Clever Caps will be made either in Brazil or in the United States.
- Why the shipping cost is so high?
Sending goods overseas from Brazil is quite expensive. We are looking for ways to lower shipping costs. If we succeed (and we hope we will) we will share the savings with our contributors by sending additional of caps.
- How long will
it take to get Clever Caps to shelves?
The first commercial
product to be marketed with Clever Caps will be a Brazilian local brand mineral
water. For this forthcoming low scale pilot launch, Clever Caps will be
manufactured with the pilot mold. 
The level of success in this Crowd
Funding project will have an important impact on the speed of marketing and
expansion of the Clever Caps. That means
that each contribution will help us bring the new caps to market with the goal
of practical expansion of this sustainability concept.
- Why are
Clever Caps sustainable?
They are sustainable because they
meet the 3 criteria of a sustainable product:
· They are
environmentally correct:
Clever Caps leave a smaller
environmental footprint because they will be directly reused, i.e., they do not
require any industrial processing.
Since the caps will be reused there
is less garbage in the streets, ocean, beaches, etc.
· They are
socially just and accessible:
Clever Caps can become inexpensive,
educational, and fun toys for children; raw material for artisans; and learning
tools to foster environmental awareness and develop creativity for people of
all ages.
· They are
economically viable:
No extra phases are added to the
manufacturing of caps (same manufacturing process of conventional caps).
No extra phases are added to the
bottling process (bottle filling and cap screwing).  Only assembly line adjustments are needed.
They use the same raw materials as
conventional caps and their weight increment is small, without a significant price
increase.
- Are Clever
Caps against recycling?
Not at all.
Recycling is essential for our planet.
It is impossible not to recycle the
trash we generate and just take new raw materials from the environment. 
The matter is that recyclinged also
leaves an environmental footprint.
To turn trash into a new product, it must be sorted
out as different materials (plastic, paper, glass, aluminum, organic material,
etc.), washed, crushed, granulated until it becomes a new raw material. 
This recycled raw material must be processed in
injecting, blowing, and extruding  machines, and only
then will it become a new product.
During all of these processes, a lot
of electricity and fuel (for the various transportation phases) will be spent.
Both the use of electrical power
(66% of which is generated by thermal plants) and the diesel-based
transportation release CO2 gas, one the villains of the greenhouse effect.
Our proposal
with Clever Caps is reuse, which avoids all of these phases. It is also an
alternative to recycling.
- Can Clever
Caps be recycled?
Yes. They
are made from the same raw materials as conventional caps: polypropylene or
polyethylene, plastics that can be 100% recycled. 
However, because they can be used to
assemble objects and develop people’s creativity, we believe using them as
building blocks is a better alternative.
- I like the
idea but will not be using Clever Caps on a daily life.
What can I do with them?
If you do not want to use Clever
Caps, you can donate them to a day-care center, school, etc. Children will be happy with the donation since
the Clever Caps will be used as toys. Another
choice is to donate them to artisans who can use them as raw material in their
projects. Bars and restaurants can use
Clever Caps in a smart and creative manner. The
possibilities for using and reusing the caps are endless!
- Don’t Clever
Caps violate Lego’s intellectual property right?
Within the limits of
our knowledge and based on studies conducted by specialists in intellectual
property (copyrights), we understand that Lego’s trademark rights are not violated. A patent is valid for 20 years, so .... This view is also strengthened by the fact that
building blocks compatible with Lego blocks have been sold internationally for
years by several competing companies.
We are great admirers of Lego and we
believe that bringing Clever Caps to the market can enhance their brand’s
success even more.
- Is Clever
Caps’ weight difference significant?
No, the weight difference between a
Clever Cap and most "conventional" plastic bottle caps is minimal
because Clever Caps are lower than most conventional caps so they can be
compatible with Lego blocks. So, even with the little ears and pins, the weight
difference is very small.
- How are
Clever Caps applied to bottles in bottling lines?
The same way as conventional caps. No new machines or additional manufacturing
phases are required - only adjustments to existing equipment.
- What are
other Clever Caps advantages?
In addition to bringing the concept
of sustainability to life, we took into consideration several points during the
realization of Clever Caps:
- Foster the development of users’
creativity.
- Enhance the access of needy
children to smart and creative toys.
- Serve as an input to projects by
artisans and artists.
- Help awaken and develop a
“sustainable mind frame” for final users.
- Diminish the amount of plastic
discarded, often not recycled, into the environment.
- Provide an extra purchase decision
factor for the consumer: packaging reuse.
- Make advertising campaigns easier
through the compatibility with Lego blocks 
- Make opening easier,
due to the better grip and bigger leverage.
- Are Clever Caps
BPA-free?

Yes





Found interesting: we kindly ask you to send the link to our page by clicking below: 



Thanks for visiting Clever Caps crowdfunding campaign site. We hope you will like our project and our cause. 
By contributing with our campaign, you will also be helping poor children either directly (you can choose the "Donation Perk" for which each 1 dolar will be transformed into 10 Clever Caps to be donated to charity institutions) or indirectly (the sooner we are able to increase production scale, the sooner more products closed with Clever Caps will reach the shelves, and the sooner "used" caps will be available to be reused as building blocks). 
30 days after our campaign deadline we are still very far from our target. So, any contribution will be very important for us, You can help our campaign in 2 ways: by making a $ contribution and by inviting your friends to visit this site.
Even if we do not reach the $ 100,000 USD target, we will deliver the perks. In this case, the delivery will probably take 3-4 months longer, but we will deliver. 
Thanks for your help.
Henry Suzuki, Claudio Patrick Vollers & Clever Caps Team




Clever Caps são tampas de reuso, que já saem de fábrica com duas vida:
-  na primeira, são uma tampa convencional
-  na segunda vida um bloco de montar
Elas já vem prontas para montar, é só tirar do frasco e usar.Ao invés das tampas irem para o lixo ou sujarem ruas, praias,elas servem para montar objetos do dia a dia e brinquedos.
As Clever Caps forma projetadas para se adaptar ao mercado:

- montam em frascos com gargalos standard
- compatíveis com blocos Lego
- usam as mesmas matérias primas recicláveis de tampas convencionais
Eco Design, colocando o reuso na pratica.




 


Springwise - "Clever Caps offer an environmentally friendly suluition to the production of bottle caps while also adding value to the objetcs to encorage consumers to reuse them."
Fast Company - "These Adorable Bottle Caps Turn Into Lego-Like Toys. Why recycle when you can play with your trash?"
Design Taxi - "Instead of stacking up in landfills, the ridges above and below these caps enable them to add a new an interesting element to LEGO creations."
 Packaging of the Word - "A Brazilian company in the innovative packaging sector, Clever Pack deveolops bottle cap that establishes new paradigm in sustainability"
Are you Global? - "I like this kind of innovation because many people forget that also recycling wastes energy and pollutes the environment for transportation or the recycling process itself. So reusing is the much better way to contribute something to limit the detrimental effects on the environment." 
Impact Consulting - "These caps, created by Brazil-based innovative packaging devoloper Clever Pack, meet both a practical need and are given a second life as a collectable toy. 
What is the key lesson here? Rethinking Product Life Cycles Adds Value $" 
DesingMuseum - "Clever Caps (Designs of the Year) - ' Recycling is a good option. Reusing is even better.' This product starts out life with two uses so when it's finished with as a bottle cap it becomes a toy building block"


















PERKS WILL BE DELIVERED EVEN IN CASE WE DO NOT REACH THE USD 100,00 TARGET. In case we do not reach the target, it will take a little longer for us to produce and ship perks, but we will deliver. In case of Caps for donation, we will start delivering part of the Caps even before May 24th.
















For all contribution levels:
· PERKS WILL BE DELIVERED EVEN IN CASE WE DO NOT REACH THE USD 100,00 TARGET. In case we do not reach the target, it will take a little longer for us to produce and ship perks, but we will deliver. In case of Caps for donation, we will start delivering part of the Caps even before May 24th (follow updates).
·  IMPORTANT !!!: IN CASE YOU WANT TO RECEIVE YOUR PERK (not in the case of donation to charity institutions), PLEASE ADD SHIPPING COST IN THE BOX AT THE END OF THE PERK SELECTION LIST ON THE RIGHT: “Additional Gift (optional)”

2. CLICK ON THE BUTTON “Custom”
3. TYPE THE VALUE MATCHING YOUR REGION. e.g. $ 54 USD for 1 Large Size Stool Model A, to be shipped to North America. 4. CHECK IF THE SYSTEM ADDED THE SHIPPING COST TO THE TOTAL VALUE OF YOUR CONTRIBUTION. e.g. TOTAL $ 174 USD  for 1 Large Size Stool Model A, to be shipped to North America.




Clever Caps são compatíveis com blocos Lego!
Clever Caps tem diferentes tamanhos e formas, alem de serem compatíveis com diferentes tipos de garrafas e embalagens. Todas os tipos de tampa montam juntas.



Leve e resistente

Os objetos feitos de Clever Caps são leves e resistentes



Customizáveis 

Customizable in many ways
For more ideas on how Clever Caps can be used, seeClever Caps fan page at www.facebook.com/clevercaps
Playing with Clever Caps is funny. You will not want to stop. Any time somebody will find a new way to use them.

Bom para crianças e unem a família (?) Good for children and bring the family together
Field activity with Clever Caps development batch. Many generations sat together to play with the Caps, like the old times.



Para um produto ser sustentável ele deve ser:
- Ecologicamente correto
- Socialmente justo
-  Economicamente viável 

Ecologicamente correto:
As Clever Caps são reutilizáveis, então colaboram em deixar menos lixo espalhado pelas ruas, praias, mares, etc. e são uma alternativa para a reciclagem,


Uma alternativa a reciclagem
A
 reciclagem é muito importante para o planeta, porem também deixa uma 
pegada ambiental, visto que libera gás CO2 durante as etapas de 
transporte e de consumo de energia elétrica.
Obs: 66 % da energia elétrica mundial vem de termolétricas, que queimam combustível fóssil liberando gás CO2.
O CO2 é o vilão do o maior problema ambiental: Efeito Estufa!

Longo processo para obtenção de um novo produto
É diretamente um novo produto, segunda vida

Nós podemos modificar esse cenário! 

Clever Caps will help changing this scenario!


Estamos testando a fabricação das Clever Caps em materiais recicláveis. Será um passo adicional para o bem ao meio ambiente.





Socialmente justa:

Um brinquedo barato que desperta a criantividade das crianças.
Mais uma escolha de matéria prima para os artesãos.


Economicamente viável:
Sem fases adicionais na fabricação das tampas ou na linha de envase.
Diferença mínima no material. 
Eles usam a mesma matéria-prima que as tampas convencionais.



- Bringing together people from different generations in activities to assemble objects and toys
- Bringing needy children closer to a fairer world, giving them the chance to create and assemble several toys.
- Contributing to a lower environmental impact
- Awakening people so they can look for alternative solutions.
- Inspiring people to leave routine and be back to childhood, even if for a while
- Breaking barriers: caps from different products and different companies interacting.








A versão redonda em 28 mm das Clever Caps, está totalmente pronta para ir ao mercado.
Ela funciona perfeitamente como:
- tampa (rosqueamento, vedação e funcionamento do lacre)
- bloco de montar (encaixes entre si e compatibilidade com blocos Lego)
A tampa já está certificada como brinquedo pelo INMETRO ( National Institute of Metrology, Quality and Technology - órgão brasileiro de certificações), sendo assim está aprovada para  ser comercializada.O molde piloto/de desenvlvimento está validado para a produção das tampas. Já forma realizamos diversos testes com tiragens maiores.
Molde piloto em funcionamento

Uma
 marca de água mineral brasileira está finalizando os 
testes em sua linha de envase/produção. Nos próximos 60 dias está 
vendendo água mineral com as Clever Caps produzidas com o molde piloto.O modelos das Clever Caps quadrada e retangular estão em fase final de ajustes das tampas e teste dos moldes pilotos.



Nosso primeiro objetivo é a fabricação de moldes de escala
industrial dos 3 modelos das Clever Caps já desenvolvidas, para poder ter
escala de produção.
Em seguida, investiremos na expansão do conceito das Clever
Caps para outros segmentos de mercado e tipos de embalagem, como: embalagens
cartonadas, bebidas carbonatadas (com gás), iogurtes, pouches, cosméticos,
creme dental, etc.
 As novas tampas
manterão os 2 pontos básicos que usamos nos 3 modelos já desenvolvidos:
 - Elas se adaptarem
aos gargalos, existentes no mercado.
 - As tampas serem
compatíveis com blocos Lego.
Acreditamos que com o crescimento das vendas teremos
condições de aumentar nossa escala de produção e a divulgação do produto, de
modo que produtos tampados com Clever Caps possam ser encontrados em vários
países.
Também é nosso desejo, que a popularização das Clever Caps
possa ajudar na disseminação de conhecimentos e práticas sustentáveis no dia a
dia das pessoas, bem como estimular inovações nessa direção.




As Clever Caps já são uma realidade. Entretanto, 
para alavancarmos o projeto, precisamos ter escala de produção, e para 
isso acontecer, precisamos do financiamento da fabricação do molde de 
escala industrial, tanto da versão redonda em 28 mm, quanto das versões 
quadrada e retangular.





- Quanto tempo levará para as Clever Caps chegarem às
prateleiras?
As Clever Caps, modelo CC1, fabricadas com o molde piloto,
deverão chegar às prateleiras nos próximos 60 dias, no Brasil. O nível de
sucesso nesse projeto de Crowd Funding terá um importante impacto na aceleração
da comercialização e expansão das Clever Caps. Ou seja, cada colaboração nos
ajudará a colocar as novas tampas no mercado, objetivando expandir esse conceito
de sustentabilidade na prática.
- Por que as Clever Caps são sustentáveis?
Elas são sustentáveis pois atendem aos 3 critérios de um
produto sustentável:
· São ecologicamente corretas:
As Clever Caps deixam uma menor pegada ambiental, pois serão
reutilizadas diretamente, ou seja, não precisam passar por nenhum processo
industrial, como a reciclagem.
A reciclagem é muito importante para o nosso planeta,
porém,  muitos gases CO 2 são liberados durante o processo. Assim, o reuso
direto de um produto é mais sustentável do que a reciclagem. Além disso, muitas
das tampas vão para o lixo comum e não chegam a ser recicladas. E outras tantas
são jogadas nas ruas, no mar, nas praias, etc, poluindo o meio ambiente.
· São socialmente justas e acessíveis:
As Clever Caps podem se tornar brinquedos baratos,
educativos e divertidos para crianças carentes, materiais para artesãos e
ferramentas didáticas para estimular a consciência ecológica e desenvolver a
criatividade das pessoas de todas as idades.
· São economicamente viáveis para a indústria:
Não acrescentam etapas na fabricação da tampa, pois usam do
mesmo processo de fabricação das tampas convencionais.
Não acrescentam etapas no envase (enchimento do frasco e
montagem da tampa), apenas alguns ajustes na linha de montagem.
Usam as mesmas matérias primas das tampas convencionais e o
incremento de matéria prima é pequeno, sem aumento significativo no preço.
- A Clever Caps é contra a reciclagem?
De forma alguma. A reciclagem é essencial para o nosso
planeta.
É impossível não reciclar o lixo que geramos e só retirar
novas matérias primas do meio ambiente. A questão é que a reciclagem também
deixa uma pegada ambiental.
O lixo tem que ser separado entre os diversos matérias como
plástico, papel, vidro, alumínio, material orgânico, etc. Esses materiais tem
que ser lavados, moídos, re-separados (caso do plástico separando o PP do PE,
do PET, etc.), secos, extrusados, granulados ou derretidos, etc. até que se
transformem em uma nova matéria prima. Aí, então, esse material é novamente
processado para virar um novo produto e fechar o ciclo novamente para ser usado
pelo consumidor.
Então, para o lixo virar um novo produto, muita energia
elétrica terá sido consumida e diversos materiais poluentes poderão ter sido
usados no processo, inclusive nas diversas etapas de transporte desses
materiais.
O transporte gera gás CO2 com a queima de óleo diesel.
Sabemos que 66% da energia elétrica do planeta vem da queima
de petróleo, gás ou carvão. Ou seja, a cada 3 máquinas elétricas, 2 funcionam
indiretamente com petróleo, gás ou carvão gerando CO2, que é o vilão do efeito
estufa.
O que propomos com Clever Caps é o reuso, uma alternativa
mais barata e  mais simples para a reciclagem.
- As Clever Caps podem ser recicladas?
Sim. Elas são fabricadas com as mesmas matérias primas que
tampas convencionais, Polipropileno ou Polietileno, plásticos que podem ser
100% reciclados. Entretanto, como elas podem ser usadas para montar objetos e
desenvolver a criatividade das pessoas, acreditamos que elas tem um melhor
aproveitamento como bloco de montar.
- Acho a ideia bacana, mas não irei usar as Clever Caps
no meu dia a dia. O que posso fazer com elas?
Se você não quiser usar as Clever Caps, você pode doa-las
para uma creche, escola, etc. As crianças ficarão felizes com a doação, pois
elas serão usadas como brinquedos. Outra opção é doá-las para artesãos, que
poderão usá-las como matéria prima para seus projetos. Bares e restaurantes
podem usar as Clever Caps de forma inteligente e criativa. As possibilidades de
uso e aproveitamento das tampas são muitas!
- As Clever Caps não infringem direitos da marca Lego?
Dentro dos nossos melhores conhecimentos e com base em
estudos de especialistas em propriedade intelectual, entendemos que
não. Uma patente tem validade de 20 anos, assim .... Colabora com essa
percepção o fato que blocos de montar compatíveis com blocos Lego são
comercializados internacionalmente, há anos, por várias empresas concorrentes.
Somos grandes admiradores da Lego e acreditamos que a
colocação das Clever Caps no mercado possa contribuir com o sucesso ainda maior
da marca.
- A diferença de peso das Clever Caps é significativo?
Não, a diferença de peso entre uma Clever Cap e a maioria
das tampas "convencionais" de garrafas PET é mínima, pois as Clever
Caps são mais baixas que a maioria das tampas convencionais para poderem ser
 compatíveis com os blocos Lego, assim mesmo com as orelhinhas e os
pininhos a diferença de peso é bem pequena.
- A diferença de peso das Clever Caps é significativo?
Não, a diferença de peso entre uma Clever Cap e a maioria
das tampas "convencionais" de garrafas PET é mínima, pois as Clever
Caps são mais baixas que a maioria das tampas convencionais para poderem ser
compatíveis com os blocos Lego, assim mesmo com as orelhinhas e os pininhos a
diferença de peso é bem pequena.
- Como as Clever Caps são aplicadas nos frascos nas
linhas de envase?
Da mesma forma que as tampas convencionais. Não precisa de
maquinas novas ou etapas adicionais de fabricação, apenas ajustes nos
equipamentos existentes.
- Que outras vantagens as Clever Caps possuem?
Além do conceito da sustentabilidade na prática, levamos em
conta diversos pontos quando idealizamos as Clever Caps:
- Estimular o desenvolvimento da criatividade dos usuários.
- Aumentar o acesso a brinquedos inteligentes e criativos a
crianças carentes.
- Servir como insumo para trabalhos de artesãos e artistas.
- Contribuir para despertar e desenvolver o "pensamento
sustentável" no consumidor final.
- Diminuir a quantidade de plástico descartado no meio
ambiente, que muitas vezes não é reciclado.
- Acrescentar um fator de decisão de compra para o
consumidor: reutilizar parte da embalagem no seu dia a dia.
- Compatibilidade com blocos Lego facilita campanhas
promocionais (rodinhas, bonecos, etc.)
- Maior facilidade de abertura das embalagens.
- As Clever Caps são livres de BPA?

Sim.

story:
Get to know Nicole!

I'm a recent college graduate trying to get to her second World Cup (April 11-12)! Last year I had the time of my life, running around, taking photos, making new friends, and seeing new teams play Quidditch! Luckily, last year I was going with a group of people and the cost wasn't too high however, this year I'm traveling alone and need all the help I can get.

My photography can be found here.

What I Need

Your funding will help pay for many things during my trip.

  • Gas - about 650 miles roundtrip
  • Hotel stay
  • Food and water for the weekend
  • Any Emergency that should come up
  • Help afford the perks offered
  • Help pay indiegogo fees

What You Get

Some just get joy out of helping out, but lets be honest...everyone loves perks! My perks are very self explanatory. Some perks will be instant, others will be sent out after I return from World Cup 8. Ideally everything will be out by July but I am only one person so bare with me if its pushing the time frame.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can contribute but sharing this campaign with your friends and family is helping almost as much as donating!

Thank you for all your help!!

story:
The Fair Game Eco Adventure Resort offers flights from Toronto to Timmins and transportation to the resort form the airport. Accommodations will be in fully-equipped cabins for two, four, or eight people. High-end cuisine will be prepared at the main lodge which will include a lounge a corporate facilities. Guided wilderness adventures will include tracking and stalking irreplaceable wildlife while guests will be quipped with a non-lethal rifle adapted with a smart device, filming high points and photographing "The Kill Shot!" Evenings will be spent eating, drinking, and reviewing the best shots of the day. 

Revenue will come from customers such as corporate team building events, transitioning hunters, European and domestic family vacationers, and nature and Canadian heritage enthusiasts. 

Expanding, The Fair Game Eco Adventure Resort will add a spa to its facilities in addition to more lodging. A higher quality kitchen will be installed to attract the best local chefs. With consistent sales by this point, The Fair Game Eco Adventure Resort can approach a regular airline that services Toronto to Timmins to create a strategic partnership.

Key Services Offered

Accommodations and food services

Hosting guests for a number of nights is integral to Fair Game Eco Adventure’s business plan. As such, accommodations will be constructed in the form of cabins containing individual rooms with a main lodge that will serve as a place for meeting, relaxing, and dining. A full-service kitchen will provide guests with all meals throughout day, or alternatively, pack meals for when guests will be out on an expedition. 

Ethical Hunting

At the center of Fair Game Eco Adventure’s business is the tracking and pursuit of the wildlife that inhabit the estate and surrounding crown land. As such, dedicated guides well-versed in the ways of game tracking, hiking, nature, and the wilderness will lead expeditions throughout the area. These expeditions can be tailored to guest experience level and, of course, the time of day. 

Fishing

As an alternative adventure to wilderness expeditions, guests can fish in the many rivers and lakes on the property. Fishing equipment is on site with professionals that can assist guests if required. 

Hiking

An alternative to the intensive expedition and tracking that encompasses much of a guests time at the Fair Game Lodge is basic hiking. Ranging from a self led tour of the property on marked trails and paths to going on group walks, guests can get a last minute taste of the forest or simply not be out for the many hours that an expedition requires. 

Sales Plan

To coincide with marketing initiative, and to tie into sales initiatives, Fair Game Eco Adventure should consider being present at as many conferences and trade shows as possible. In this way, the brand and name can begin to circulate within the industry and within the devoted niche of clients that would attend these kinds of events. Organic promotion will then be possible. 

Corporate

It will be important in the early stages of Fair Game Eco Adventure to reach out to potential corporate partners looking for locations for executive or employee retreats. Reaching out by phone or in person will likely be the most effective methods for setting up in-person meetings. Once in the door, a refined presentation could be given to elaborate on the benefits of visiting the Fair Game Eco Adventure Resort. Materials could also be left at each location.

Family

The family segment could potentially be more difficult to reach directly. Some sales may come indirectly from corporate contact. Some sales campaigns could take the form of mailouts targeting ideal regions based on favourable demographics. Further, promotions could be purchased with institutions like CAA or other travel magazines. 

Nature-Enthusiast

This customer segment will most likely be engaged with at trade conferences about nature, outdoorsmanship, hunting, etc. 

Operations Plan

Transportation

Fair Game Eco Adventure will provide necessary transportation to get to site. Generally, this will include booking round trip airfare to Timmins where guests will be met at the airport and driven to site. On site transportation will not be necessary as all activities will be done on foot. All water activities will have appropriate equipment necessary, such as canoes and floatation devices. 

Accommodations/ Hospitality 

The nature of Fair Game Eco Adventure’s business plan is to provide all goods and services necessary for an enjoyable week long stay in the Ontario wilderness. Cabins will have all amenities necessary for an enjoyable stay, including linens, towels, bedding, bathrooms, and showers. Any special requests will be happily met with advanced notice for those with mobility restrictions etc. 

Food and beverage

Clientele will enjoy home cooked meals for the duration of their stay and will have a wide selection of beverages available to suit their needs. All meals will be provided as part of the charge for the week’s stay and will be cooked by qualified employees, meeting all health standards and regulations. 

Ethical Hunting

A knowledgeable and experienced guide will provide nature tours for Fair Game patrons. Services will include tracking of various wildlife and information about various species to provide both an informative and fun tour. Ontario is home to many different species of wildlife, however, variability will exist in what wildlife are seen depending on the time of year.

Fishing and boating

Fishing will require various forms of equipment including rods, fishing line, bait, tackle boxes etc. In order for fishing to be successful, a guide may be necessary depending on the difficulty of catching fish as well as the process of releasing fish back into the water. Maintenance of all boating equipment as well as storage will also be necessary. 

For the Kids/ Family

Offering informative and engaging sessions about the lives of nearby First Nations is part of Fair Game’s planned operations. This will benefit multiple stakeholders including First Nations and may offer employment opportunities. Packages containing information as well as research will be necessary aspect of operations. 

Start-up Plan

Site Planning

Site visits to determine an ideal location for the lodge, followed by the blueprinting and mapping out of the surrounding area. It will also be important to start mapping the routes for planned expeditions with guests. 

Material and machine purchase/ rent

Based on the plan, rent the necessary equipment and machinery and buy the appropriate materials as they are necessary. 

Construction

Assemble a proficient and reliable team to execute the building plan. 

Stakeholder Engagement

While construction is happening, engage with local stakeholder groups including native bands. Constructive conversations should inform if there is an opportunity for a fruitful strategic partnership. Topics to explore could include involving them in the leading of expeditions through Fair Game land in addition to the surrounding crown land. It could also be worthwhile to discuss the potential for the resort to host guest-engagement activities with the natives to learn about the culture and ways of life.

Marketing and PR

While construction and stakeholder engagement meetings are happening, the marketing team should be reaching out to local and provincial media about all that Fair Game Eco Adventure has to offer, its vision, mission, and overall service offerings. It is important to get traction as early in the process as possible to ensure that, by opening time, there are many bookings and stories. 

Pre-book a few months

As a part of the marketing process, it is especially important in the early days to have at least weekends sold out for a couple of months. Word of mouth will hopefully perpetuate this process, in addition to online efforts, and enable constant and reliable revenues. 

Hiring and training

Staff will need to be hired and trained just before construction is completed. A maid, a grounds keeper, kitchen and wait staff, a front desk concierge, and expedition guides are among the staff that will be necessary to run the resort. 

Soft-Opening

As a part of the training process and the testing of all accommodations, equipment, and processes, a soft opening will be conducted with family and friends of the owner and employees. This will allow the staff to work in a live environment, will provide an opportunity to add services that might be missing, eliminate irrelevant processes, and better prepare the facility to receive paying patrons. 

Hard-Opening

With the media present and invited to stay and enjoy a weekend experience, Fair Game Eco Adventure Resort will officially open to the public. 

Sustained operations

With reservations for at least a few months in advance, the resort can continue to operate, learn, and perfect the services that it offers.
story_txt:
The Fair Game Eco Adventure Resort offers
flights from Toronto to Timmins and transportation to the resort form the
airport. Accommodations will be in fully-equipped cabins for two, four, or
eight people. High-end cuisine will be prepared at the main lodge which will
include a lounge a corporate facilities. Guided wilderness adventures will
include tracking and stalking irreplaceable wildlife while guests will be
quipped with a non-lethal rifle adapted with a smart device, filming high
points and photographing "The Kill Shot!" Evenings will be spent
eating, drinking, and reviewing the best shots of the day. 
Revenue will come from customers such as
corporate team building events, transitioning hunters, European and domestic
family vacationers, and nature and Canadian heritage enthusiasts. 
Expanding, The Fair Game Eco Adventure
Resort will add a spa to its facilities in addition to more lodging. A higher
quality kitchen will be installed to attract the best local chefs. With
consistent sales by this point, The Fair Game Eco Adventure Resort can approach
a regular airline that services Toronto to Timmins to create a strategic
partnership.
Key
Services Offered
Accommodations
and food services
Hosting guests for a number of nights is
integral to Fair Game Eco Adventure’s business plan. As such, accommodations
will be constructed in the form of cabins containing individual rooms with a
main lodge that will serve as a place for meeting, relaxing, and dining. A
full-service kitchen will provide guests with all meals throughout day, or
alternatively, pack meals for when guests will be out on an expedition. 
Ethical
Hunting
At the center of Fair Game Eco Adventure’s
business is the tracking and pursuit of the wildlife that inhabit the estate
and surrounding crown land. As such, dedicated guides well-versed in the ways
of game tracking, hiking, nature, and the wilderness will lead expeditions
throughout the area. These expeditions can be tailored to guest experience
level and, of course, the time of day. 
Fishing
As an alternative adventure to
wilderness expeditions, guests can fish in the many rivers and lakes on the
property. Fishing equipment is on site with professionals that can assist
guests if required. 
Hiking
An alternative to the intensive
expedition and tracking that encompasses much of a guests time at the Fair Game
Lodge is basic hiking. Ranging from a self led tour of the property on marked
trails and paths to going on group walks, guests can get a last minute taste of
the forest or simply not be out for the many hours that an expedition
requires. 
Sales
Plan
To coincide with marketing initiative,
and to tie into sales initiatives, Fair Game Eco Adventure should consider
being present at as many conferences and trade shows as possible. In this way,
the brand and name can begin to circulate within the industry and within the
devoted niche of clients that would attend these kinds of events. Organic
promotion will then be possible. 
Corporate
It will be important in the early stages
of Fair Game Eco Adventure to reach out to potential corporate partners looking
for locations for executive or employee retreats. Reaching out by phone or in
person will likely be the most effective methods for setting up in-person
meetings. Once in the door, a refined presentation could be given to elaborate
on the benefits of visiting the Fair Game Eco Adventure Resort. Materials could
also be left at each location.
Family
The family segment could potentially be
more difficult to reach directly. Some sales may come indirectly from corporate
contact. Some sales campaigns could take the form of mailouts targeting ideal
regions based on favourable demographics. Further, promotions could be
purchased with institutions like CAA or other travel magazines. 
Nature-Enthusiast
This customer segment will most likely
be engaged with at trade conferences about nature, outdoorsmanship, hunting,
etc. 
Operations
Plan
Transportation
Fair Game Eco Adventure will provide
necessary transportation to get to site. Generally, this will include booking round
trip airfare to Timmins where guests will be met at the airport and driven to
site. On site transportation will not be necessary as all activities will be
done on foot. All water activities will have appropriate equipment necessary,
such as canoes and floatation devices. 
Accommodations/
Hospitality 
The nature of Fair Game Eco Adventure’s
business plan is to provide all goods and services necessary for an enjoyable
week long stay in the Ontario wilderness. Cabins will have all amenities
necessary for an enjoyable stay, including linens, towels, bedding, bathrooms,
and showers. Any special requests will be happily met with advanced notice for
those with mobility restrictions etc. 
Food
and beverage
Clientele will enjoy home cooked meals
for the duration of their stay and will have a wide selection of beverages
available to suit their needs. All meals will be provided as part of the charge
for the week’s stay and will be cooked by qualified employees, meeting all
health standards and regulations. 
Ethical
Hunting
A knowledgeable and experienced guide
will provide nature tours for Fair Game patrons. Services will include tracking
of various wildlife and information about various species to provide both an
informative and fun tour. Ontario is home to many different species of
wildlife, however, variability will exist in what wildlife are seen depending
on the time of year.
Fishing
and boating
Fishing will require various forms of
equipment including rods, fishing line, bait, tackle boxes etc. In order for fishing
to be successful, a guide may be necessary depending on the difficulty of
catching fish as well as the process of releasing fish back into the water.
Maintenance of all boating equipment as well as storage will also be
necessary. 
For
the Kids/ Family
Offering informative and engaging
sessions about the lives of nearby First Nations is part of Fair Game’s planned
operations. This will benefit multiple stakeholders including First Nations and
may offer employment opportunities. Packages containing information as well as
research will be necessary aspect of operations. 
Start-up
Plan
Site
Planning
Site visits to determine an ideal
location for the lodge, followed by the blueprinting and mapping out of the
surrounding area. It will also be important to start mapping the routes for
planned expeditions with guests. 
Material
and machine purchase/ rent
Based on the plan, rent the necessary
equipment and machinery and buy the appropriate materials as they are
necessary. 
Construction
Assemble a proficient and reliable team
to execute the building plan. 
Stakeholder
Engagement
While construction is happening, engage
with local stakeholder groups including native bands. Constructive
conversations should inform if there is an opportunity for a fruitful strategic
partnership. Topics to explore could include involving them in the leading of
expeditions through Fair Game land in addition to the surrounding crown land.
It could also be worthwhile to discuss the potential for the resort to host
guest-engagement activities with the natives to learn about the culture and
ways of life.
Marketing
and PR
While construction and stakeholder
engagement meetings are happening, the marketing team should be reaching out to
local and provincial media about all that Fair Game Eco Adventure has to offer,
its vision, mission, and overall service offerings. It is important to get
traction as early in the process as possible to ensure that, by opening time,
there are many bookings and stories. 
Pre-book
a few months
As a part of the marketing process, it
is especially important in the early days to have at least weekends sold out
for a couple of months. Word of mouth will hopefully perpetuate this process,
in addition to online efforts, and enable constant and reliable revenues. 
Hiring
and training
Staff will need to be hired and trained
just before construction is completed. A maid, a grounds keeper, kitchen and
wait staff, a front desk concierge, and expedition guides are among the staff
that will be necessary to run the resort. 
Soft-Opening
As a part of the training process and
the testing of all accommodations, equipment, and processes, a soft opening
will be conducted with family and friends of the owner and employees. This will
allow the staff to work in a live environment, will provide an opportunity to
add services that might be missing, eliminate irrelevant processes, and better
prepare the facility to receive paying patrons. 
Hard-Opening
With the media present and invited to
stay and enjoy a weekend experience, Fair Game Eco Adventure Resort will
officially open to the public. 
Sustained
operations

months in advance, the resort can continue to operate, learn, and perfect the
services that it offers.

story:
The Idea

After seeing a recent picture of a young toddler washed up on a beach while trying to flee from Syria I thought to myself " I need to help do something about this crisis"

  • Raise Enough Funds To Buy Island Off Coast Of Greece/Italy
  • Build shelters and villages for these refugees
  • Provide an infrastructure and create jobs for the future.

Remember: Any funds raised will go towards helping these refugees in Syria

What We Need

We need enough money to buy a small island. :

  • We need to show the government in Greece and Italy we have the funds to purchase. Then we need for the government to sell us a small island 
  • We will need volunteers to help build on the island to keep the costs as low as possible
  • If we do not reach our goal then we will find some other way to help these refugees. Rest assure your donation will help these people so we will never have a tragic picture surface online of a little toddler drown on a beach while trying to flee his home country.

The Impact

This will make a huge impact on he current situation in Syria. We can help save thousands of lives each year.

  • Your contribution will help save lives.
  • You will be able to monitor the progress of the island and the development and know that you helped towards this

Risks & Challenges

We cannot guarantee that the government will sell us an island, but to show our intent by raising the funds is a great start to show them we mean business.

  • We may not be able to get permission to purchase the island ( If so we will use the funds to help with either temporary shelters/food/clothes being sent to their temporary establishment in Syria )

Other Ways You Can Help

If you do not have the funds to donate then please help us spread the word

  • Please SHARE this on Facebook,Twitter and other social media outlets.
  • Please contact radio,television and news website/facebook pages and let them know that we are eager about this idea.

Finally I really think this project is possible if we put our mind to it. I am sick of sitting back and hoping the government will do something about it. Sadly they will not so I think its about time we take things into our own hands

Examples of islands to buy if government do not allow

http://www.privateislandsonline.com/islands/ven...

story:
Short Summary

I’m Rick Sokoloff and I've been skiing, mountain biking and living in Stowe, VT for the past 36 years. I was the co-founder of the Stowe Mountain Bike Club and founding president. I ran the club for over 10 years and help develop over 50 miles of legal and permanent trail.

What I saw was missing was a better way for people to get started. Being a ski instructor, I realized we could make it easier. I am certified by the International Mountain Bike Association and spent a lot of time teaching and guiding. I am very excited that there is a real need, not only to learn, but to be shown around, given some tips and to share some local knowledge. 

With that in mind, I started 4 Points VT, a Mountain Bike School, with Guides and Brewery Tours. Yup, Brewery Tours, the best thing after a ride. And you don’t have to go on a mountain bike ride to visit the breweries. It's a great combo, but not everyone will get on a mountain bike and you don't have to go on a brewery tour to mountain bike.

I’m running this Indiegogo campaign to get this business going. I have upfront costs and need to pre-sell trips to raise money to purchase a 12 passenger van for guests and a 12 foot trailer for the bikes. You can help; buy something and use it anytime, it will not expire. And to make it worth your while, I’m offering discounts on mountain bike lessons, guide service and brewery tours.

The offerings make great gifts or company outings! Bring your employees or friends on a brew tour, get them on a bike or do a special event; bike in the morning, have lunch and take a brew tour in the afternoon! Please check out the ‘Perks’ and see if there’ anything you might like. 

What We Need & What You Get

To get started I will need to raise around $25,000. This will give me a down payment on a 12 passenger van, a trailer for bikes, a small marketing budget and a down payment on the insurance, legal fees and accounting. 

What you get is the opportunity to have great experiences in the green mountains of Vermont. If you become a mountain biker, you get to live a healthy, active lifestyle. You also get to help build the mountain bike economy and support the local community. 

The Impact

The past 15 years has seen an incredible trail network develop in Stowe. And in the last five years we have seen mountain biking explode, not only in Stowe, but around the country if not the entire world.

I am passionate about this project, not only do I get to work with something I love, but it will also make a very positive impact on my community and hopefully the health of many people yet to ride! I will be bringing in people who will be staying in the hotels, eating in the restaurants, and spending money locally. This project stands on the shoulders of all the work the SMBC and I have accomplished in the last decade. What's better than a mountain bike economy in a ski town!

The other side of this is that I believe by getting people into mountain biking, there's a positive impact on their physical and emotional lives! Let's fix the health care problem in this country by keeping people healthy! Go ride a bike!

Other Ways You Can Help

I really appreciate all the help and support that many of you are offering. If you can’t help financially, perhaps you can help me get the word out and promote this campaign.

Talk to your employer about setting up a Mountain Bike and Brewery Tour. How about weekly mountain bike rides for the team! Build comradery, get people fit and have fun together! 
Help me get the word out! Anyone that you think might be interested, let them know!

story:
Kevin DeArmond and Tarit Rao-Chakravorti (Left/Right)

Summary

Squash Drive (squashdrive.org) is a great organization that works to provide afterschool enrichment through academic tutoring, squash instruction and community service to underprivileged children in the Bay Area.

As two people completely crazy about squash, Tarit and Kevin figured there was no better way to raise money for a great cause than to do what we like doing most--playing squash. A lot.

Starting on Friday, May 22nd at 7am, we will begin playing squash for as long as possible, with the aim of breaking the world record of 36 hours and 2 minutes. The rules are simple: just keep playing squash, with five minute breaks every hour. 

As we said, we like squash and SquashDrive even more. We hope you will join us on this adventure!

What We Need

What we need: Donations for a great cause and supporters during a long 36 hours.

Anything you donate will go directly to Squash Drive as part of their annual fundraiser before their SquashSlam! event on May 30th. Please do visit their website to find out more about the great work they are doing in the Bay Area, as well as opportunities to volunteer. 

We are generously sponsored by our home away from home, the Bay Club of San Francisco, which is providing a venue for our record attempt. We are also grateful for support from Harrow Sports, which is generously equipping us for the attempt. We'd love to see you stop by! The Bay Club is at 150 Greenwich St, San Francisco, CA. Come right in and ask for the squash courts.
