story:
Hello family and friends,

My name is Sara (as you already know.) I'm obsessed with the tiny house movement and have been for about the past 5 years. Over the past 3 years I've been putting a lot of serious thought into how I see my future. I don't know a lot of things, but I do know I don't want to be plugged into our current system. I don't enjoy the normal 8-5 job and have no idea where I want to put my roots down just yet. 

Because of this I have worked hard in my own free time to establish my entrepreneurial success as a Vedic Astrologer. It brings me a great deal of happiness knowing I'm providing a service to others around the world. I feel blessed. 

I want to take the leap and turn this into a full time business. In order to do it I need to downsize my life. This includes having affordable housing as I plan to travel from city to city going to astrology conferences, networking, and building up a bigger client base.

By having your money, I will be able to make my dreams come true and hopefully be completely self employed and debt free by the time I'm 30. 

What I Need & What You Get


I need $4800 in the next few weeks to purchase a tiny cabin on wheels. (I'm not telling you where this tiny cabin on wheels is listed otherwise you'll try to buy it, it's THAT good of a deal.) I promise I'll never ever ask you for anything else ever again.... 


For all your trouble I will be providing many perks so check out the perks section for more information on what you get in return. 


If I do not reach my goal in the next few weeks then any money made will be used to purchase strippers. Yes. Male strippers. Kidding. I'll be putting it towards building a tiny cabin because this is something I truly believe in.


With all my love and humblenatude, (that's a word right?)

Sara

story:
WE TRAVELED THE WORLD AND LEARNED OF MAJOR PAIN POINTS. WE SOLVED THEM.

A solution that solves the modern day problems we all face while traveling from city to city despite hundreds of inadequate products out there. It’s hard to beat the thrill and feeling of standing in a new city with no boundaries on how far you can go and how many experiences you can have.

The most trusted tool of a backpacker today is their adventure backpack that comes along for every part of the journey. Now they’ll have the ultimate adventurer with them.

Here is the Lucky Backpack.

A major goal of raising funds is to develop our technology platform to integrate the physical product with our software to enable certain functionalities otherwise not possible without the backpack. Functionalities include integrating hotel keys, boarding tickets, and more. Our web-application is currently available at http://www.luckybackpack.com!

 

 

INVITE FRIENDS AND EARN PRODUCT

Simply invite your friends to the campaign (MUST be logged in and use the share tools on this campaign page for referrals to be counted) and win product when they back the campaign: 

  • 5 Referrals: Lucky Backpack Shirt 
  • 10 Referrals: The Lucky Backpack 
  • 15 Referrals: The Lucky Backpack Power System
  • 20 Referrals: The Lucky Backpack Complete System  

Details: https://www.luckybackpack.com/stories/invite-friends-and-win-product

A LUCKY BACKER  WILL WIN A LUCKY TRIP AROUND THE WORLD. GATHER MORE BACKERS AND INCREASE YOUR CHANCES TO WIN. 

Each timer a backer supports our project by buying into one of the perks they will be entered to win one of the following prices.

Referral Incentive: For every person that you refer that backs the campaign you will earn an additional entry into the contest. That means that if you get 20 friends to back the campaign you will earn 20 entries to the raffle of the grand prize.

Learn more about the contest here: https://www.luckybackpack.com/stories/the-lucky-backpack-golden-ticket-contest

 

 

Support System for a Weightless Feel

The foundation of the Lucky Backpack is that the market lacks a solution that provides maximum comfortability while allowing travelers to pack and reach enough items for months on the road. We’ve created a state-of-the-art support system to keep your back straight and distribute the weight of the pack evenly onto your back and shoulders at all times.

The backpack contains a supportive metal plate that holds the padded back panel. This means that no matter what items are inside of your pack your back will always feel the padded straight back panel.

 

An Exterior Built to Last


Building a world-class exterior for our modern day community of adventurers was no simple task. We arrived at the perfect balance of visual appeal and functionality. Starting with a high-quality polyester fabric that is sure to make the backpack last for years and endure countless weather conditions around the world. 

On the other hand, we understood a simple but critical problem with current travel backpacks: All backpacks with enough room to fit ALL the items you'll need for a long adventure did not look good or had an opening at the top making your items inaccessible unless you removed all your items from the pack.

That is why we built this backpack with full carry-on suitcase style functionality. Meaning it will open 180 degrees flat across the backpack. Now there exists a travel backpack that works like a carry-on AND is capable of storing all the things you'll need on your next adventure. 

 

Material

Built with fully water-resistant polyester to make the backpack the perfect durable product for years of travel. Food and drinks will not stick to the fabric of the backpack.

Waist Straps

Gone are the days when you have to remove your backpack off your back to reach essentials like metro cards while in-transit. Our padded waist straps contain high-quality zippers that open a pocket to hold essentials.

Stash Pocket

Ever had to store certain items that you need to be hidden from the public eye? Your phone, passports, personal medicine? Our back panel is designed with a special pocket to be visible and accessible only to the traveler carrying the pack.

Charger Port

Our devices are important during our travels so now you may charge any device while in transit with our charging port built on the side of the backpack. Feel free to connect any portable battery to the port and place inside the pack.

 

Superior Carry-On Interior

The interior of the backpack features expansive technology that will expand the fabric of the pack as you fill the main compartment. Simply place all your belongings inside and the backpack will expand accordingly to its optimal size. 

We also equipped the backpack with highly functional compartments and features including an area to separate your dirty clothes or shoes, pockets for toiletries and essentials, and a compartment for your external battery.

Fully Carry-On Access - 180 Degree Main Compartment

The Lucky Backpack functions exactly as a carry-on suitcase because it opens completely 180 degrees. Lay the pack horizontally flat and pack all your things. The backpack will stretch proportionally to fit everything. Easily reach any of your items at all times.

 

Special Toiletry Pocket for Quick Access

Store any toiletry or health item in the special pocket designed for easy access right when opening the interior of the backpack.

Separate Your Dirty Clothes or Shoes from the Rest 

The dilemma of carrying around dirty clothes or shoes in our backpacks has long haunted millions of travelers. Now with the Lucky Backpack travelers have the ability to store any items separate from the rest in the special elastic compartment.

Essential Pockets and Battery Compartment

Mesh pockets on the inside of the backpack to store those items needed to reach on the go. Store and connect your external batter in the open mesh pocket on the inside.

 

Best in Class Safety Measures

When it comes to security, all external zippers feature our theft-proof lockable feature where you can slide any lock to secure your belongings. There’s also a safety whistle on the chest strap’s buckle to use at any moment to alert your surrounding. Our logo is also made from reflective fabric to light at night.

The Lucky Backpack Design - Built By Adventures for Adventures 

The journey started by taking a leap of faith when our founder Edgar decided to live abroad instead of taking a consulting job in New York City. From that moment, the Lucky Backpack community was being born. We grew into the hundreds and then thousands by visiting countless countries, meeting travelers around the world, but most importantly discovering the beautiful cultures in every corner of the globe.

From this experience, we learned all about the life and journey of thousands of travelers: Their glories, their struggles, their stories. We saw a large opportunity to create a product with them for the entire adventure community. 

Over the past 2 years, we captured pain points in hostels, airports, music festival, and many more places. We held critical focus groups with people from over 35 countries in person, online, and every other method in between. We arrived at the Lucky Backpack. By us for us. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Growing up we never had the opportunity to travel or explore the world so the Lucky Backpack story all began with a decision to live abroad and travel the world before starting the corporate world after graduation. That experience over the last three years led us to meet thousands of people from around the world with beautiful cultures and precious traditions.

We were personally moved by the experiences we had that it changed our lives forever making us better individuals and opening our views to the effect that worldwide travel can have many seeking opportunities for a better life.

That is why we created Lucky Backpack, with the mission to provide products to allow anyone with the will to explore the world to do so regardless of their financial or demographic background.

Our backpack is built to function as a carry-on to solve the vast majority of problems of backpacking like removing back pain, storing dirty clothes, safety pockets, storing and retrieving essentials on the go,  all without having to shed out the premium price on the market.

 

 

Edgar Alza (Lima, Peru | Miami, FL) - Founder and Designer

Edgar is an action-driven entrepreneur with a mission to make the world a better place. A lover of adventure and pushing all internal limits to live a fulfilled life. Prior to starting Lucky Backpack, Edgar was a consultant at Accenture Digital and a world-wide traveler. Edgar holds a B.S. in Industrial & Systems Engineering from the University of Florida. Go Gators.

Christopher Veau (Paris, France | West Palm Beach, FL) - Designer

Christopher's journey has taken him around the world and back working with travelers and adventures in over 12 countries to create the Lucky Backpack. Growing up in sunny South Florida, Christopher became passionate about the outdoors and helping others. Apart from traveling the world and creating beautiful products, Chris is a consultant at Manhattan Associates and an avid adventurer. Christopher holds a B.S. in Industrial & Systems Engineering from the University of Florida. Go Gators.

Kimberly Gant (Pensacola, FL | Oakland, CA) - Graphic Designer

Kim is a bonafide full-stack designer and a go-to creative mind across the tech industry. Kim is known by industry experts around Silicon Valley for her relentless work effort and determination to improve the communities she has been part of. Kimberly holds a B.S. in Industrial & Systems Engineering from the University of Florida. Go Gators.

Micheal Berlfein (Miami, FL) - Photographer & Videographer 

Michael discovered his passion for photography and video during a pivotal point in his life. Learning from the ground up, Michael took countless courses online, stayed late to attend in-person training, and most importantly learned in practice by working in shoot after shoot for 3 years. Michael grew up in Miami, FL originally from Buenos Aires. 

Logan Schaner (West Palm Beach, FL) - Designer

Logan is the definition of a world explorer, having spent 5 years balancing a Bachelors and Masters degree with a real estate business while in college Logan decide to travel the world for the last 2 years. Having visited over 40 countries around the world he truly embodied our community while learning all the pain points that led to designing this product today. Logan lives in West Palm Beach, Florida and is currently planning his next adventure to the Caribbean. 

FAQs

1. I’m leaving for some amazing adventure in August, can I get my backpack before then?​

Yes, we will deliver a backpack before the end August to all backers that support our project before hitting our goal. If there are any delays for further backers we will communicate that right away.

2. Is the Lucky Backpack Waterproof?

No, the Lucky Backpack is water resistant. While the TPU material that covers the majority of the pack is technically waterproof, there are seams on the backpack which make it not fully waterproof. Each backpack comes with a water waterproof raincoat.

3. Does the Lucky Backpack come with a battery?​

Depends, our standard package does not include a battery pack while our power and complete packages include a FAA approve power bank. For various safety reasons and regulations by airline’s we allow users to place any portable battery inside the backpack to charge their devices as well. 

4. Is there a return policy?​

Once the campaign ends, all sales are final. We will ensure that products arrive on-time although there may be delays which we will communicate. In the case, we cannot deliver a product we will issue a full refund.

5. Are any other colors available?​

For this campaign, we are only offering the black and blue backpacks. Once we complete the orders from this campaign we’ll push out more products with other colors.

6. Does the backpack fit as a carry-on or personal item on airlines?

The backpack will be accepted as a personal item on all major airlines and transportation companies around the world.

7. How much is shipping? 

Shipping is free for all U.S. based orders. Orders outside the United States will have additional charges. Please allow an extra month for the backpack to arrive to orders outside the U.S.
story_txt:
WE TRAVELED THE WORLD AND LEARNED OF MAJOR PAIN POINTS. WE SOLVED THEM.
A solution that solves the modern day problems we all face while traveling from city to city despite hundreds of inadequate products out there. It’s hard to beat the thrill and feeling of standing in a new city with no boundaries on how far you can go and how many experiences you can have.
The most trusted tool of a backpacker today is their adventure backpack that comes along for every part of the journey. Now they’ll have the ultimate adventurer with them.
Here is the Lucky Backpack.
A major goal of raising funds is to develop our technology platform to integrate the physical product with our software to enable certain functionalities otherwise not possible without the backpack. Functionalities include integrating hotel keys, boarding tickets, and more. Our web-application is currently available at http://www.luckybackpack.com!
 

 
INVITE FRIENDS AND EARN PRODUCT
Simply invite your friends to the campaign (MUST be logged in and use the share tools on this campaign page for referrals to be counted) and win product when they back the campaign: 

5 Referrals: Lucky Backpack Shirt 
10 Referrals: The Lucky Backpack 
15 Referrals: The Lucky Backpack Power System
20 Referrals: The Lucky Backpack Complete System  

Details: https://www.luckybackpack.com/stories/invite-friends-and-win-product
A LUCKY BACKER  WILL WIN A LUCKY TRIP AROUND THE WORLD. GATHER MORE BACKERS AND INCREASE YOUR CHANCES TO WIN. 
Each timer a backer supports our project by buying into one of the perks they will be entered to win one of the following prices.
Referral Incentive: For every person that you refer that backs the campaign you will earn an additional entry into the contest. That means that if you get 20 friends to back the campaign you will earn 20 entries to the raffle of the grand prize.
Learn more about the contest here: https://www.luckybackpack.com/stories/the-lucky-backpack-golden-ticket-contest

 

 
Support System for a Weightless Feel
The foundation of the Lucky Backpack is that the market lacks a solution that provides maximum comfortability while allowing travelers to pack and reach enough items for months on the road. We’ve created a state-of-the-art support system to keep your back straight and distribute the weight of the pack evenly onto your back and shoulders at all times.
The backpack contains a supportive metal plate that holds the padded back panel. This means that no matter what items are inside of your pack your back will always feel the padded straight back panel.

 
An Exterior Built to Last
Building a world-class exterior for our modern day community of adventurers was no simple task. We arrived at the perfect balance of visual appeal and functionality. Starting with a high-quality polyester fabric that is sure to make the backpack last for years and endure countless weather conditions around the world. 
On the other hand, we understood a simple but critical problem with current travel backpacks: All backpacks with enough room to fit ALL the items you'll need for a long adventure did not look good or had an opening at the top making your items inaccessible unless you removed all your items from the pack.
That is why we built this backpack with full carry-on suitcase style functionality. Meaning it will open 180 degrees flat across the backpack. Now there exists a travel backpack that works like a carry-on AND is capable of storing all the things you'll need on your next adventure. 



 
Material
Built with fully water-resistant polyester to make the backpack the perfect durable product for years of travel. Food and drinks will not stick to the fabric of the backpack.

Waist Straps
Gone are the days when you have to remove your backpack off your back to reach essentials like metro cards while in-transit. Our padded waist straps contain high-quality zippers that open a pocket to hold essentials.

Stash Pocket
Ever had to store certain items that you need to be hidden from the public eye? Your phone, passports, personal medicine? Our back panel is designed with a special pocket to be visible and accessible only to the traveler carrying the pack.


Charger Port
Our devices are important during our travels so now you may charge any device while in transit with our charging port built on the side of the backpack. Feel free to connect any portable battery to the port and place inside the pack.

 
Superior Carry-On Interior
The interior of the backpack features expansive technology that will expand the fabric of the pack as you fill the main compartment. Simply place all your belongings inside and the backpack will expand accordingly to its optimal size. 
We also equipped the backpack with highly functional compartments and features including an area to separate your dirty clothes or shoes, pockets for toiletries and essentials, and a compartment for your external battery.

story:
I The Card I

 

Note: €25 is equal to (roughly) USD  31 , CAD 38 , AUD 38 and NZD 42

The Capture Travel Card is a discount card designed to promote small, independent and awesome businesses in Europe. Through visiting these intriguing spots, we hope our customers discover a more authentic European experience away from the tourist trail. 

www.capturetravel.eu

Capture Travel collaborates with 35+ businesses in each European city to secure discounts and deals to some of the hottest restaurants, shops, bookstores, cafes, bars and nightlife. 

We've chosen everything from independent coffee houses to vintage clothes stores,  some of the craziest places to eat (think dinner in an old train car or on a boat) to the coolest things to eat (like sushi burritos, vegan steaks, and local treats). We've chosen bars with ambitious cocktail recipes to the biggest selection of craft beers, to amazing late night shows and evening entertainment. Alongside everything from bicycle tours to art-house cinemas to cat cafes. 

 

 

 

I HOW IT WORKS I

 

 

We individually pick every business involved in our program. A business who has not received their invite can contact us directly to inquire about joining. But we only support businesses who we feel do something unique, that stand out from the crowd and provide excellent customer service. 

Then, we ask them to provide a discount or deal for Capture Travel Card holders. 

In exchange, we vow to increase their sales by sending our customers to them, and to improve their online presence through social media development and advertising. It's like being part of a big business family. To keep away from corporations, we want to celebrate and promote small and independent businesses who are doing their own thing and doing it brilliantly!

The funding of this project goes towards the making of the card and fulfilling our promise to our chosen businesses through promotion, advertisements, and marketing. 

 

 

I The Idea I

 

Capture Travel is a Dublin-based start-up company pioneered by Katie Doyle. Inspired by the missed opportunities for young adults visiting Europe, The Capture Travel Card is an initiative that brings them closer to unique opportunities offered by small businesses. 

After living and working around Europe, Capture Travel's Katie Doyle (23) realized that city trips are often trails through historical monuments, overpriced restaurants and unoriginal encounters. Whereas, the real essence of a culture is not in its landmarks but in its businesses. It's sitting with a great coffee in a cafe window, observing Londoners go about their day-to-day life, it's eating dinner in an old train car in Amsterdam or a decadent restaurant in Paris, finding an amazing thrift shop in Edinburgh or having a cocktail in a converted market hall in Dublin.

 

 

We want to change the way young adults see Europe by bringing them closer together with the real side of a city. At the same time, we'll be promoting small businesses that deserve to be recognized for their high quality products and services. 

 

 

I YOU I 

 

We market our card and the businesses involved to an array of young adult groups on social media primarily through Facebook, Instagram and Twitter (you might have seen us!). When we say 'young adults' we mean everybody from undergrads still at university, to graduates in the professional workplace: anyone who lives in, travels to or dreams of Europe.

Capture Travel is a young, vivacious start-up business that will endeavour to change the way we see European cities; not full of tourist attractions, but instead, filled with opportunities.  

We started this brand with you in mind. We want you to have real life experiences in Europe- meeting people of the same age, enjoying modern amenities and finding original adventures in the capitals. 

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Don't worry if you can't donate or get your super-awesome-post-alternative-extraordinary-Capture-Travel-Card. We'll be grateful for your share, follow, or like- we'll even return the favor! You can sign up for our email updates on our website and find us on:

Facebook

Instagram

Twitter

story:
TrailFork? Who? What? Where?

TrailFork is women-owned and people-supported. 

  • You tell us about you, your dietary preferences, and your trip,
  • We pack enough meals to sustain your adventure,
  • And we ship your supplies to your door in time for take-off.

Our company mission is simple: We sustain adventurers and the environment they love. That means your meals are optimized for both pack weight and calorie requirements. And it also means that unlike other companies, our meals are packed in compostable packaging—meaning less waste on the trail and less stuff in landfills.

What We Need & What You Get

We've been taking and shipping orders since August of 2017, and now we're hoping to grow. 

Your contribution will help launch the #trailforktour2018. Our marketing approach is grassroots: social media and in-person events are our mainstay. So we're planning to road trip it up the west coast from L.A. to Seattle, slinging samples, spreading the word, and meeting you fine folks along the way.

And hey, we've got sweet swag!

  • Contributions of $25 will get a TrailFork window sticker and a pack of our smash hit Paleoats cereal.
  • For a contribution of $50 or more, you'll also get a super cool TrailForkTour T-shirt.
  • For $100 contributions, you'll double the fun with two T-shirts, two packs of Paleoats, and two window stickers!
  • $250 contributions will also get you a day's worth of TrailFork supplies.*
  • And contributions $500 or more will be handsomely rewarded with a day's worth of supplies, a t-shirt, and outdoor trip planning support. Wanna hike the Grand Canyon and don't know where to start? We gotcha.

*P.S. Not the outdoorsy type? We'll send you a gift card so you can pass on the TrailFork perks to your favorite outdoor adventurer.

EVERYONE who gives will:

  • be mentioned in social media shout-outs along the tour (be sure to include your Instagram handle with your pledge!)
  • get with thank you postcards from the road (Yes! Snail mail!)
  • have access to our road trip Spotify playlists, and
  • get invites to meet-ups along the west coast

Basically, We're planning a party, and we want you to come! 

(minimizing) The Impact

Your contribution matters; we need your support!

  • If every person in the backcountry packed their food in compostable packaging, our trails would be cleaner and our landfills would be emptier.
  • We've had a lot of success with pop-up shops in Colorado. Now we want everyone to know how to minimize their impact while also maximizing deliciousness, before the summer 2018 adventure season begins.

And we're serious about protecting sacred and adventurous spaces. 30% of all funds raised over and above our goal will be donated to the Native American Rights Fund, directed to support of the Bears Ears National Monument.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not ready to contribute? That's okay--you can still help spread the word!

  • Share our campaign on your Facebook page or Instagram feed.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to tell the world about TrailFork!
  • Tag your adventures of all kinds with @mytrailfork on Instagram.

Extra thanks to...

Luseatosky Creative for their beautiful photos,

CHC for all design elements, and

Bird.Bird for the soundtrack and sound editing on our campaign video.

CHC for all design elements, and
Bird.Bird for the soundtrack and sound editing on our campaign video.

story:
WHO IS LOUISE TRES? LOUISE IS A WONDERFUL LADY OF THE SEA, A 43 FEET SAILING BOAT, BUILT IN 1988 BY ELAN SHIPYARD IN SLOVENIA AND DESIGNED BY J & J. GREAT FOR CRUISING, COMFORTABLE 4 ROOMS AND 2 BATHROOMS, SPACIOUS DINETTE WITH A BIG TABLE WHICH CAN HAVE 8 PEOPLE ON BOARD, TO 10 MAXIMUM; TWO FORWARD CABINS ARE BANK BEDS WITH A COMMON BATH, TWO AFT CABINS ARE DOUBLE BED, ONE HAS A LITTLE BAD FOR KID AND COMMON BATH ASWELL.

LOUISE SAILED IN DENMARK MOST OF HER LIFE THAN WAS SELLED IN SPAIN AND THERE HAS BEEN FORGOTTEN FOR A WHILE SINCE I BOUGHT IT FIXED A BIT AND SAILED WITH TO ITALY. I'M GOING VERY SLOW WITH THE REFIT DUE TO JOB, THAT WAS AROUND THE WORLD IN THE LAST YEARS; DUE TO SPENT, WHICH ARE TOO MUCH FOR ME AND OTHERS PRIORITY LIKE FAMILY SPENT.

RECENTLY I QUIT FROM MY JOB AS SAILOR/MEDIA MANAGER ON MASERATI ITALIA 70; WORKING AS FREE- LANCE PHOTOGRAPHER NOW, AND IN FREE TIME I WANT TO FINISH THE JOBS ON LOUISE.

THIS BOAT HAS A BIG POTENTIAL, CAN BE USED FOR CRUISING AROUND WORLD, (HAS ALREADY SAILED ATLANTIC OCEAN), CAN BE REALLY COMFORTABLE AND EASY TO USE FOR SAILING SCHOOL; AND WHEN WEATHERS CONDITION LOOK YOU ON THE DOCK CAN BE NOT JUST A BOAT BNB, BUT A FUNNY PLACE FOR SPECIAL DINNERS COOKED BY ME.

LOUISE DECK NEED TO BE PAINTED, I ALREADY TOOK OFF THE OLD TEAK WHICH WAS REALLY BAD, AND

FILLED DECK; THE FINISHING WILL BE ANTI SKID. I'M REPLACING NOW THE TEAK IN THE COOKPIT, I STARTED NEW ELECTRICAL WIRING, PART OF MOTOR CHECK UP, SEALING HATCHES, FIXING HAUL AND SEACOOKS.

WE NEED NEW SAILS, INSTRUMENTS AND AUTO-PILOT AND SOLAR PANEL. FRIDGE, AND HOT WATER BOILER NEEDS WORK, HEOLIC GENERATOR TOO, MAYBE REPLACED BY A HYDRO GENERATOR. WE HAVE HEATERS IN ANY CABIN AND IN DINETTE, BUT WEBASTO HEATING MOTOR NEED TO BE REPLACED.

THE BOAT IS DOCKED IN ITALY, NEAR THE CAVE OF WHITE MARBLE.
AS SOON SHE WILL BE READY, WILL START TO SAIL IN MED SEA, ITALY, GREECE AND SPAIN. IN OCTOBER OF THE SAME YEAR, WILL MOVE TO CANARY ISLANDS, SP, IN THE ATLANTIC OCEAN, TO WAIT FOR RACE IN THE ARC.

(The ARC is a ‘must do’ for many sailors, and attracts over 200 boats and 1200 people every year to sail 2700 NM across the Atlantic from Gran Canaria to Saint Lucia. The ARC is for everyone; families with children, tough racers, cruising couples, big boats and modest boats. Crossing the Atlantic together, but having their own adventures. More than just a boat race, the ARC is about friendships made ashore in the two weeks of pre- departure activities continued over the radio net at sea. It’s about arriving in Saint Lucia to be met on the dock with a rum punch and a chilled beer, knowing you have achieved something fantastic - crossing an ocean on a small sailboat).

AFTER THAT WILL PASS THE SEASON IN CARIBBEAN SEA AND LEAVE IT ABOUT IN APRIL. FLORIDA CAN BE

OUR BASE FOR SUMMER AND NEW YORK AND BACK TO CARIBE. 

ITALIANO TRADUZIONE ITALIANO

IMMAGINATE PER MOMENTO DI VELEGGIARE IN QUESTE PIACEVOLI   ACQUE, DARE L'ANCORA IN UNA BAIA TRANQUILLA, NUOTARE O FARE UNA PASSEGGIATA PER GUSTARE ATTRAZIONI E CIBO LOCALI,  OPPURE SEMPLICEMENTE PER SGRANCHIRE LE GAMBE.                                     BUONGIORNO A TUTTI, MI CHIAMO MICHELE E VORREI INVITARVI A NAVIGARE A BORDO DI LOUISE TRES. LOUISE E’ UNA BARCA A VELA DI 13 METRI, COSTRUITA NEL 1988 DA ELAN. E’ STATO AMORE A PRIMA VISTA, ERA IN UN PORTICCILO IN SPAGNA, BISOGNOSA DI ATTENZIONE. CONOSCEVO IL SUO POTENZIALE QUINDI HO ACCETTATO LA SFIDA A RISTRUTTURARLA.        IL PRIMO TEST VELEGGIANDO TRA SPAGNA E ITALIA E’ STATA UNA BELLISSIMA AVVENTURA, SCOPRENDO UNA BARCA SICURA E DIVERTENTE ALLO STESSO TEMPO.

DA ALLORA LA BARCA E’ IN CANTIERE FUORI DALL’ACQUA. C’E’ ANCORA MOLTO DA FARE, ALL'ALBERO, AGLI IMPIANTI, VELE NUOVE, STRUMENTI, SICUREZZA E COMFORT), IL TEMPO E IL DENARO SONO LIMITATI PERO’ STO LAVORANDO CON IMPEGNO IN OGNI MOMENTO LIBERO PER RIPORTARLA ALLA SUA GLORIA E HO BISOGNO DEL VOSTRO AIUTO. LAVORO NELLA NAUTICA DAL 1999, IN DIVERSI MAXI YACHT.

NEGLI ULTIMI ANNI HO MIGLIORATO MOLTO LE MIE CAPACITA', MENTRE ERO PARTE DELL’EQUIPAGGIO DI  GIOVANNI SOLDINI, MASERATI, ASSIEME AD UN EQUIPAGGIO DI 9 PERSONE ABBIAMO NAVIGATO 65.000 MIGLIA NAUTICHE ATTORNO AL MONDO, BATTENDO ALCUNI RECORD DI VELOCITA' E PASSANDO CAP0 HORN E BUONA SPERANZA. ORA SONO PRONTO PER RIPRENDERE IL LAVORO SU LOUISE,  A PROPOSITO DEGLI INTERNI C'E' DA DIRE CHE  E' PROGETTATA CON 4 CABINE DOPPIE PER UN TOTALE DI 8 POSTI, 2 BAGNI ED UNA SPAZOSA DINETTE CON CUCINA. NELLE SEGUENTI FOTO VEDRETE L’ASPETTO DI UN ALTRO ELAN 43 QUANDO E’ PRONTO PER NAVIGARE.

LA VOSTRA PARTECIPAZIONE A QUESTA CAMPAGNA DI INDIEGOGO  MI PERMETTERA’ DI TERMINARE I LAVORI E RIMETTERE LA BARCA IN ACQUAE. VOI SARETE PARTE DI QUESTO PROGETTO, UTILIZZARE LA BARCA CHE SARA’ DISPONIBILE PER NAVIGARE, PER REGATE, PER DORMIRE COME IN UN BNB, PER SCUOLA VELA, O ANCHE SOLO PER UNA CENA.  VI OFFRIREMO L’OPPORTUNITA’ DI VELEGGIARE CON LOUISE DAL MAR MEDITERRANEO, ALL’OCEANO ATLANTICO, AI CARAIBI E PIU’.

LA NOSTRA ROTTA SARA' VISIBILE SUL SITO WEB  HTTP://MICHELESIGHELPHOTO.COM, 

CI SONO DIVERSE PROPOSTE TRA LE QUALI SCEGLIERE,  COME AD ESEMPIO 5 POSTI A BORDO PER LA ARC, REGATA ATLANTICA A PORTATA DI TUTTI.

VERSATE ORA, VENITE A BORDO, VELEGGIATE CON NOI! SENZA SCADENZA DI TEMPO. PER FAVORE DONATE.

GRAZIE GRAZIE GRAZIE!  CIAO A TUTTI

ESPANOL TRADUCION ESPANOL

Quien es Louise tres?

Louise es una señora dela mar. Un Sloop de 43 pies, construido en Slovenia en el 1988 por Elan. Ella ha navegado la mayoría de su vida en Danemarca y después vendida en España donde la encontré en malas condiciones, la he comprado y navegado en Italia. 

El barco puede contener 8 personas, tiene cuatro camarote doble y dos baños, cocina y cómoda dinette. 

Se podrá utilizar para charter, escuela de vela, regatas, y cuando está parada en puerto como "posada"...

Estoy haciendo lo que puedo pero no consigo finalizar debido a la falta de moneda, por esto necesito la ayuda de ustedes, de todos lo que quieren gustar dela vida al la mar y de la vela. 

Louise cubierta necesita trabajos, estoy cambiando el teak en el pit, haciendo nueva conneciones electrónica, control de motor, sellando ventanas, y otros trabajos al casco. Necesitamos velas nuevas, electrónica de viento, visto generador, paneles solares. Y algo más. 

Cuando el barco estará listo, vamos navegar en Mediterráneo, después a Baleares y Canarias y en el océano Atlántico con la ARC REGATA. 

DESDE EL SITIO DE ARC

la ARC es un MUST para muchos navegantes y llama más de 200 barcos y 1200 personas cada año para navegar 2700 Nm cruzando el Atlántico de Gran Canaria a Sant Lucia. La ARC es para todos, familias con hijos, expertos marineros, parejas, grandes barcos y pequeños. Cruzando el Atlántico juntos pero cada uno con su propia aventura. Más de una simple regata la ARC es algo de amistad echa en puerto antes de salir en las actividades de preparación, siguiendo al agua con la conneciones radio en el océano. 

Llegando a Sant Lucia recibido con un punch rum u una cerveza fresca sabiendo que han conseguido algo especial, cruzando el atlántico en un pequeño barco. 

Después de esto vamos pasar el invierno en Caribe, después Florida, New York y regreso en Caribe aún. 

Mi experiencia viene de 15 años dé navegación y mantenimiento en diferentes tipos de barco. Puedo hacer mucho trabajos, los últimos años he navegado con Maserati un VOR 70, alrededor de el mundo. Obtenemos varios récord de velocidad como la New York - San Francisco y la Cape2Rio. Tengo casi 100.000 millas náuticas en todos océanos. 

Esperando que con esto se sientan al seguro, les voy ofrecer para sus donaciones la posibilidad de llegar al barco donde quieren sin limitaciones en el tiempo. Para saber dónde estamos y hacer sus reservas y contactarnos habrá el sitio: http://www.michelesighelphoto.com

La página Facebook: Louise tres

Mail: louise3.sail@gmail.com
